description:
Perfect stop for bar hopping along Hayes!

Love the whimsical decor, antique and glamorous looking couches to sit comfortably with your friends while sipping on some drinks plus plenty of seats at the bar.

I'll be back for the ambience and drinks! You won't regret stopping by!
author: Diane C.

description:
I am disappointed I didn't find this place sooner.

It's an eclectic feel: the decor is vintage, that night rock music was playing and there was a video of a musical on the tv. It felt like a weird mix of everything - and I loved it.

What really has this place shine is the amazing happy hour. $1 off beers which usually has them about $4-5 and $5 well drinks. They also have a special drink.

The night I went it was a watermelon long island a.k.a. danger because it was just liquid candy with a lot of alcohol in it. Luckily my friend and I had to meet someone for dinner or else I would have been there the whole night.
author: Stephen P.

description:
I have been coming to Sugar Lounge for many years (well as many as I can for only being 24 years old) and it never disappoints. I've hosted a going away party and attended two birthday celebrations at Sugar Lounge! All of the bartenders are extremely friendly, and I love talking to the wonderful owner and her charming daughter (extra points for a family business). Their specialty cocktails are all fun, flirty and creative. My favorites are the Pink Pussycat (clementine, mango champagne, honey, etc.) and the Apple Mojito. 

Sugar Lounge is by far the best place for happy hour in Hayes Valley. They offer a different $5 cocktail Monday-Friday that range from a peach cosmo to a strawberry margarita. If you come on Friday, make sure to come hungry!  During peak happy hour time they offer free finger food such as sushi rolls, paninis, and quesadillas.

Keep up the good work, Sugar!
author: Bryan D.

description:
Randomly came in this spot because they had a Happy hour sign. Best Cali decision that day, outside of the great vintage leather bag I bought at a consignment store. The lounge is super cute and the bartenders were like old friends from the past. Shirley and "the cute, really nice guy." Can't remember his name at the moment. 

These were actually great bartenders which we all know isn't always the case. I was drinking an Old Fashion that was perfect. It came in an old school bourbon glass that looked like he got it from my Grandma's cabinet but I loved it!! Three drinks for $24 (they weren't on the Happy hour menu) and it's not well. Can't find that too many places in ATL.

They were playing r&b and after drink two I was having a mini concert on my stool. So much fun!! 

The crowd seemed to be mixed, not too many people drinking that early in the day but it got busier as the afternoon went on. 

Pleasant surprise in the middle of my day. Thanks Sugar Lounge. I shall return...someday
author: K. C.

description:
i think this place has become my designated Happy Hour place on Fridays!
$5 Special cocktail that changes every week. So far i've seen $5 lemon drops and Strawberry Margaritas. $4 well drinks and draft beer !

Also....they serve food on Fridays :) complementary chips and salsa and little panini sammys 

Super cute bar, tastefully decorated that exudes a sexy and classy vibe. 
Also, bartenders are quick quick quick! i don't think i've ever had to wait more than 2 mins for a round of drinks
author: Anh T.

description:
Located in Hayes Valley, Sugar Lounge is a great small bar that has interesting decor (it's a little bit of everything and it's not really my thing), good bartenders and dangerously delicious drinks. 

Why dangerously delicious? Because most of the time you do not even taste the alcohol but after a few you definitely start to feel it. 

Overall, it's a great place for drinks and small groups but it's not a bar for everything or everyone.
author: Mario B.

description:
I've avoided Sugar Lounge for so many years. It's time I finally came here. My roommates and I put our names down at the ramen shop down the street. Since the wait was supposedly 1.5 hours, we went for drinks. All my favorite places in Hayes Valley were insanely packed, so we ended up at Sugar Lounge.

The décor here is very... Eclectic. There's so much going on, like a cross between a sports bar and a nightclub. It's like no one could decide on the theme of this place. There's seating at the bar and high tables along the side, as well as couches in the back towards the restrooms. We were lucky to grab a comfy couch.

There's an extensive cocktail menu, all of which sounded quite tasty. I decided on the Pepper Khan cocktail, which was spicy af. At first it tasted like straight alcohol because it wasn't well-mixed. Oh and the bartender was sniffly and sick that day, which was a concerning.

Sugar Lounge seems like more of a neighborhood bar for regulars, not one that attracts hipster millennials flocking to the latest craze. I wasn't a fan and would only come here again in similar circumstances... If my favorite Hayes Valley bars were too crowded. At any rate, I appreciated the experience!
author: Stefanie C.

description: Been here once and I'm a fan. Was in the area because I was going to watch a comedian nearby. The bar has some candy for patrons to snack on. The bar has some cool mixed drinks. When I went, it looked like they had Snickers mini on display. Also they just got some pizza for the whole bar so cool beans for that as well. The bartender was a gentleman who kept the drinks coming and good sense of humor. The gin and tonic here was good. They made it strong just the way I like it. Also the tonic tasted good, not flat like some other places have. It did get very busy later on.
author: Joe M.

description:
I love this spot. I've been several times and always enjoy it. It's got a very cool vibe and it's never packed like most other bars in the area. Good for a date or catch up with friends because it's not super loud. There is bar seating, high top tables, and even a few couch spots in the back. There is a great happy hour menu and the bartenders are friendly.   

Awesome place to grab a drink before dinner.
author: Taylor F.

description:
Drinks and lounge!  It is as simple as that!

Simplicity is hard to achieve these days with tech advancements, fast paced city vibes and the daily struggles of what one wants from each other, calls for a drink! 

The end lounge couches is a secluded section and great for some flirtatious motives!  Fridate and every date!  Get a drink or two in, loosen up because it's Friday and the start of a weekend! 

Good pit stop and onto the next!
author: Tiffany D.

description:
One of the best bars in the neighborhood. 

Great vibe, cool bartenders, fair prices. They always have candy, and they have food on some days. You don't come here for the food though, its a great spot to meet up w/friends or a date. Music is generally good and you can hear the person across the table from you. Worth coming here again.
author: John G.

description:
Cute and unique ambiance. Kitschy but nice, I liked it a lot. I would definitely come back.

Love the diversity (Asian pride) amongst the workers! 

Drinks were yummy and beautifully presented (purple and white orchids galore); average city price at $12 each.
author: Stephanie P.

description: Awesome happy hour from 4:30-7:30pm with great drink deals. I actually don't like sweetened cocktails but you can order beer or vodka soda. They give out chocolates and it's a fun place.
author: Laurence S.

description:
I. Say. Friends Time. 

Great bartenders, good vibe for down time... always a good get together with friends...
author: Edgar M.

description: This place is pretty cool. Lots of candy to munch on. The vibe is cozy with speciality drinks. I was a tad annoyed when we were here. The female bartender or manager, not sure, doesn't put out a good vibe. And, she was coming down on one of the bartenders. I was also grossed out watching her eat a piece of fruit behind the bar, rolling the eaten piece all around in her fingers. Ugh. Maybe it just wasn't a good night to sit at their bar. I'm assuming it's probably a fairly cool place on a regular basis.
author: Ellie C.

description: Would really recommend this bar during happy hour. Great daily specials during happy hour. Great atmosphere for a chill great together with friends or a date. It's quiet enough to have a conversation. It doesn't get overly crowded during happy hour, which is hard to find in the neighborhood. If you get there early enough they'll have little snacks available!
author: Bao D.

description:
*** Highlight ***
Free finger foods during Happy Hour!!! What!!!

Great place for happy hour around Hayes valley after work! They provide free bite sized sushi, chips, and other types of food such as sandwiches during happy hour, and the food is pretty delicious too! Bartenders are friendly. The music is a tad bit loud so if you're looking to come here for a deep heart felt conversation it may not be the best place as it is just slightly hard to hear. Other than that, I've always had great times coming here. They have a TV in the back that they sometimes play the big sports games going on there. Very clean place with some sofa couches to lounge on and chairs near the food and bar area.
author: Benjamin W.

description:
The best thing I can say about this place is that it wasn't a packed SF bar. There was tons of available seating so that was nice. 

Aside from this though, not really much else to say. I had the Major Old Fashioned, which was hyped for having bacon bourbon. No bacon flavor--this was especially disappointing because bacon isn't exactly an easy flavor to hide. It was a decent old fashioned. 

My gf had a vodka soda and said that it was disappointing (that's hard to do too right?). 

This is a cool place to come if you're tired of the crowded bars. There's a reason it isn't crowded though. If you want a better drink go to Smuggler's Cove or Anina down the street.
author: Nick D.

description: DeAngelo is the man! Makes the best cocktails, awesome service, great guy! Thank you DeAngelo, one love
author: CeeCee Y.

description: Absolutely loved the atmosphere and the music. The bar tenders are great. Would come back. Good for a chill hangout.
author: Mary N.

description:
Best happy hour in hayes valley, and definitely one of the top in the city.  The happy hour includes all of their bar cocktails and beers.  In addition, they provide some free bar snacks and chips for all patrons.  The seating is ample and usually not the most crowded bar in hayes valley.  But the family run bar is great and I've gotten nothing but great vibes from the people working there. 

A must for the Hayes Valley bar hop and chill
author: Joel Christian A.

description:
This place is cute. It's perfect for a low-key night out with friends!

We came here with a giant group of people. We couldn't all find seating but eventually, were able to all sit together. 

The drink menu consists of a variety of sweet drinks. They are very pretty to look at but I opt for my favorite cider of all time: Pear Cider!

They played a mix of top 40, old school music, which I didn't expect but liked. Lol

They also offer free candies! Hahahahaha 

I liked the place and if I were ever in Hayes Valley, I'd be happy to come back!
author: Alice L.

description:
Stop #5 or #6 (I've lost count) on bachelorette weekend!

Perfect place for a bachelorette party- good music, good drinks, and everything is PINK! Pretty cool if you ask me. 

I had a tequila with lime ($8) and sat back in the cube seats to talk to our partying neighbors. It wasn't packed to the gills but it surely wasn't that slow. Pretty good amount of people for a cold Saturday and a variety of singles, couples, and groups of friends. 

I don't remember music being played but I do remember a movie being shown and there were people dancing around with the green headphones for their private dance party that connected with a couple different bars in the area. 

Would I go back? Yes, if just to try out their happy hour where I seen a cute cocktail list to go with the sugary pink theme.
author: Evangelina R.

description:
Absolutely great standard menu on the board. Definitely try their old-fashioned, it's worth it. 
Bartenders are really cool and the vibe is trendy and it's like perfect personalized ambience as in people come in groups they can listen to bar top 20 music and also the personalized sound party headphones. 
Definitely a bookmark neighborhood and bookmarked lounge.
author: Victor D.

description: Went here with my hubby on a Thursday afternoon for happy hour and it was the perfect ambiance for chillaxing. The lemon drop was delicious. We swore the drink had more alcohol than other places because we both came out of there 'happier' just after one drink! We shall be back!
author: Virginia F.

description:
Small lounge with delicious cocktails and a good selection of beers on tap. Most lounges that have decent to good cocktails don't have a decent section of beers on tap - this one does!

We were there on a Thursday, around 6pm and the place was well visited but not overly crowded. Sound level were perfect - giving you the feeling to be in a bar while still allowing a conversation without the need to yell. Liked the place, will be back.
author: F. P.

description: This bar is adorable and the actual bar itself and many of the tables in it GLOW!  As we walked in they were playing The Chain by Fleetwood Mac, which always brings a smile to my face and we had the Migo Cooler - a delicious concoction made with tequila, mint and fresh watermelon. Yuuuuuuummmsss! I highly recommend it and I just found out the sweetener they use is agave which makes me go ahhhhh.  Low glycemic sweetener? Yes please!  We just ordered another round and just as we were being served they played CCR-- doo doo doo looking out my back door!  Couldn't be happier. Love this place and we don't want to ever leave!
author: Monica E.

description: I remember when this was a different bar... twice!  This time, it is called "Sugar Lounge" and apparently, if you are a middle aged woman, you can't get served a drink and all the snotty 20-somethings will come up with some way to start a fight to make you uncomfortable.  I made a comment about how the bar seemed so much the same since my first visit and was accused of being racist by some children who were seated near me.  Meanwhile - my two friends spent nearly 40 minutes trying to get the bartender's attention -- even despite a regular at the bar trying to help us out.  This was at 6pm -- not exactly rush hour or even happy hour -- we walked around the corner to another bar where we spent a lot of money and were treated much better!
author: Jenn C.

description: My husband and me love love love this place. Our first time here was in Dec 2016 when I was commuting to San Francisco for work. We went there one of the evenings as it was in the area where I worked. Their happy hours serve great cocktails, especially Martinis. I am too fond of their black rum based cocktails, Soo much that I have tried the same ones at home after getting inspired!! I usually find that place decently crowded after 6:30 pm and goes on till 11 pm. The ambience is lounge type and cool. We also have taken a few friends of ours to that place and they have liked it too!!! I would keep going there once a month till I really feel I have had enough of it. Cheers to sugar lounge.
author: Foram C.

description: Worst service I've ever received from a bar tender, Justin. Disappeared for 20+ minutes when he was the only bar tender. When we did put in an order he didn't serve us. He continued to take other people's orders while we waited. Currently still waiting for 4 drinks that may never come.
author: Luke B.

description:
This bar is legit. Great cocktails - I get the Richmond gimlet. 

For some reason it's never crowded. Which is another plus. If you ever need a bar that has seating room and is good for groups, this is your spot. 

I've also heard they have a great happy hour with free cheese and snacks. I've yet to check it out
author: Laura D.

description:
I've never actually been here on a normal day...its just always the first pit stop for me during Bay 2 Breakers.  Full bar is open and serving from 800am Great time to get some shots, including jello-shots(2 for $5).

The friendly owners and employees aren't enforcing any bathroom rules. There might be a line, but if you hate port-o-potties and need to poop, this is probably the best time to do it.
author: Chun P.

description:
This is the spot for happy hour with coworkers.  

Cheap drinks
Free food
Large space
Good service
author: Linda N.

description: My friends and I came in over the weekend for drinks. As we walked in, the vibe seemed it was hip and chill...perfect for the girls to have a cocktail and chat. Since we were Yelpers, we all checked in because that is what my friends and I do. What appears on my phone? $1 off a cocktail. Wow! My friends and I show the check in offer to the bartenders. They gazed and held my iPhone at the checked in offer and was talking to each other that I made it up...or maybe Yelp did? I don't know. For the bartenders to be talking to each other about it in front of me and my friends made me mad. Why would I make it up? If you don't want to honor the check in offer, just say so. Just say, this offer was a mistake or it hasn't been cancelled yet. No biggie. But for you to talk about patrons that go there...I'm sorry. That's unprofessional for any profession that provides customer service.
author: Jennifer G.H. W.

description: Lights are on and music is playing. We walk in and someone says, dude it's a private party. Few thanks. Put a sign up or just don't open the door and put the lights on on the sidewalk. Rude!
author: Steve H.

description: A great place for drinks and Happy Hour with friends. They have Lemon Drop specials too for only $5. The place has a nice dark ambiance and the service is fast and it's not that busy either so you don't have to wait for a seat. What more could you ask. Nicely located in the Hayes Valley. Definitely going back !
author: DJ Nocturna R.

description:
I thought this was a nice little spot to grab a drink. 
It's a bit of a hole in the wall, in a good way. 
The interior is SUPER dark, so if you have an unattractive date, it's a good place to go lol. It's also pretty loud, so if the date isn't that smart and can't hold a conversation, I recommend it as well. 
My drink was yummy, but the inside isn't very big and it was standing room only so we didn't stay long. 
The had a lot of specials and specialty drinks, so it took us a while to decide what we wanted to try but I liked that. 
The bartender was super busy but when we did finally get his attention, he was nice enough. 
As Yelp says, this place is A-OK.
author: Dale S.

description:
Cute intimate bar in Hayes. The light up geode looking tables are a cool addition. It makes you want to sit at one of the tables...if you can get a table that is.

The price for drinks is pretty reasonable, but the drinks seemed a little weak. 

It's an interesting mix of people - Oprah house attendees, fancy Hayes Valley renters, and a small sprinkling of hipsters. Surprisingly I didn't see any tech heads the times I've gone. 

Sugar Lounge gets pretty crowded. By the time my friend and I left the bar at 7pm on a Saturday night, the line to get a drink extended to the entrance way. Temperature wise, it can get kinda hot in there.

Overall, it's an okay bar, but not worth trying to battle for a drink when the place gets crowded.
author: Josh S.

description:
I came here with a group of friends on a recommendation and found Sugar Lounge to be fun. With many types of cocktails, you can find the alcohol of your choice. Ranging from tequila to vodka to Kraken, you can find any drink you want and they all come out to be of the perfect strength. I was feeling "Russian Mule" (wait, Moscow Mule ... The name threw me off) that night, so ginger beer and vodka all the way. Mighty delicious with a fun copper cup. 

The interior of the space is small, but typical of San Francisco. Luckily our party of 6 managed to squeeze in a space and had a lovely time! 

I'd recommend the happy hour prices since after that, it is a little bit pricey, but not too bad.
author: Albert H.

description:
Great cocktails, great lounge, great artwork, great lighting.

Stumbled upon this lovely cocktail lounge on a Saturday night after dinner nearby and couldn't have been happier. I was with a few girlfriends and we wanted a nice little bar to grab a cocktail before we met back up with the rest of our friends and Sugar was exactly what we had been picturing, if not better. 

We all ordered the Richmond Gimlet - Hendricks, St. Germaine, simple syrup, lime juice, fresh muddled mint, and a champagne float. YUM

Perfect spot for GNO, will most definitely be back!
author: Ilana B.

description:
I'm giving this 5* simply to bring the average rating up because this is def a solid 4*

The place is relatively empty compared to the other bars on Hayes and I have no idea why! There are good lounge seats and it's got a great lounge feel.

The drinks are solid. I usually do whisky drinks but the Richmond cocktail is amazing.

Definitely the best hidden secret on Hayes for how comfy and easy to get into bar it is plus has good cocktails.
author: Farid V.

description: Thought it was a great bar, friendly staff, cool vibe with decent mixed drinks... until a cockroach ran across my drink at the bar.
author: Renée A.

description:
I went here this past Friday for this first time with some friends from work, and others for Happy Hour. It was pretty cool overall I thought. Even though I didn't drink anything, the atmosphere was electric, and it was nice to hang around other young people. I'll be honest, I don't drink liquor, even though I like wine like Asti Spumante wine.... Even though I didn't drink anything when I was at the Sugar Lounge this time around, I have to admit, the Margarita's looked kind of good. Next time I go there, I might have to have a Margarita. LOL.

But yes, this place is pretty chill spot overall, and it's a nice place to unwind after a long work week (if you go on a Friday night), even though last week was a short work week due to the President's Day holiday. LOL.

I think the only cons to this place would be what has been mentioned earlier. It is kind of small inside and it gets kind of cramped around 6-6:30, which might be the peak of Happy Hour. It can also get kind of loud too, so many people cramped in one space, socializing.

Yeah, I agree there also aren't enough seats, even though the spot kind of clears out quickly when Happy Hour is done, and people are there just to hangout with friends/family and co-workers.

With that being said, I'll definitely go to this place again if I'm invited again. I liked the energy of the place, and it's a nice place to hangout after work.
author: Otis B.

description:
When other Hayes Valley bars are filled to the brim, Sugar Lounge always seems to have free seats.  This is a big perk and service to the area. 

The place is long and but not so wide.  We sat at one of the high-top tables which parallels the opposing wall to the bar.  The table had a huge wobble.  One in our party ordered a martini-style drink in an "up" glass.  The drink spilled no less than 3x from the wobbling.  In the end, we just held our drinks in the air. 

As we were starting on our second drink, an older lady who works there came over and announced, "Private Party".  We were unclear at first what this meant.  So we picked up our drinks and went to the back of the bar, assuming that the tables were sitting at were being taken over by a private party.  Having settled in at a different table, we noticed the place clearing out.  After some discussion we decided that the lady meant the WHOLE bar was being cleared out for a private party.  This was confirmed when she came over to tell us (politely) that we can finish our drinks.  Probably a better approach to the whole situation would have been to tell us when we ORDERED the drinks that we would be kicked out soon.

On the bright side, the bartop is an underlit marble that is quite nice.  Aside from that, it looks like a diver bar that's been recently renovated.  Also the couches toward the rear are a nice touch and give it a lounge feel. 

Noise level is nice and low.
author: Joel B.

description: THE BEST HAPPY HOUR! Please tell me one place in SF where you can get $5 beers and cocktails AND free food? I went on a Thursday and their special of the day was $5 lemon drops. Never tried one before, but I am now a fan. I asked the bartender what happy hour food specials they had and he laughed and told me they didn't sell food. But that they did have free food, "just like the grilled cheese sandwiches over there on the table." This immediately won my heart. In this neighborhood and at a time where there would be a crowd, there's free food? Amazing! The garlic bread grilled cheese sandwiches were yummy. The staff and ambiance were on point. This is a deal you can't beat. I strongly recommend stopping by if you're ever in the area. It's very close to a lot of historical sites in SF like City Hall, SF Symphony, SF Ballet, etc.
author: Carmelisa M.

description: The cocktail menus on the table have some big errors - so make sure you check the mirror. But staff is nice and works fast. Place was relatively uncrowded and the drinks were pretty good
author: Robert U.

description:
SIT AND SIP
(5 stars)

Cute atmosphere, very chill, sit and sip kind of place. Love the cocktails!!!! Tasty, good portion, and good pour. 

PINK PUSSYCAT - it has vodka, orange, mango, and another fruit. Those three fruits combined had the cocktail taste like a "Creamsicle grapefruit" taste. It was very enjoyable and fun as it was garnished with a hibiscus flower.  

PINEAPPLE EXPRESS - even better drink. All I know is that it had other fruits and obviously, pineapple. It tasted great! Even your after-breathe smelt good. I'll be real, when many people take in fruity drinks and liquor their breath is tarty. Not after this drink. I kept wanting to smell a others breathe, and my own! And no, we weren't drunk. Lol

Love it and definitely will be back.
author: Jane A.

description:
I have been to Sugar Lounge a couple times, once for a friend's bday and other times for happy hour. All of the ones have always been good to my taste buds but not to my liver. Lol the drinks here are good and can be a creeper. 

We went this past Friday for happy hour and had such a good time. It looks like they had remodeled the place a lil bit by adding tables that have a glowing marble top. This definitely adds a fun accenting light to the place without making it look too dark. They do provide little munchies to snack on - grilled cheese with jalapeño peppers, egg rolls, guacamole with chips and tempura. The drink I stuck with for the night was the American mule. It was deceivingly light in alcohol flavor, but boy did I get a great buzz after 2. The ginger beer hit the spot every time in the American mule. My husband got the mandarin mule, it was sweeter than we like but definitely a good choice for people that want their drinks that sweet. We ordered a Jameson on the rocks and it literally looked like a full size cocktail, woah. 

At one point we ordered drinks and not sure how the order was wrong but the Owner Mehe(?) came over afterwards and gave us a drink on the house! How nice is that? She was really sweet and even came by every now and then to make sure we had a good time.

We'll definitely be back to enjoy more happy hours here. One tip I would say is get there around 5pm before it gets crowded and you can't get a table.
author: Yvonne T.

description: Pretty cool bar in a convenient location in Hayes Valley. It actually isn't super crowded compared to other bars and has a nice ambiance (comfortable couches to sit in and chat with friends). Lots of tasty cocktails available and a good selection of draft beers for a place that's known for cute drinks. What really makes me give this bar five stars is the bartenders! They're super friendly and chill without being overly chatty and it just brightened my mood to sit at the bar and see them chatting with the regulars. This is a good place to pop in when you want some cute cocktails or just want to enjoy a local watermelon beer with some quality service.
author: Jacqueline K.

description:
Once twice three drinks and I won't fall down. 

Not a hole in the wall. 

Warriors games always on. 

And wonderful patrons.  

Free chips and fresh salsa !!

Need I say more !
author: Xbig T.

description: It is so comfy sitting at the cushions. The drinks are strong. Good for a date night. Luv it!!!
author: Bentley K.

description: 5 dollar drinks who can't be mad about that? Came on a Sunday, bartender was really helpful and patient with my group of friends. Really cool place to chill with friends while listening to throwback music. Also this place is very modernized and clean which is what I look for. Overall excellent experience!
author: Roseanne V.

description: Walked in to an empty bar. We sat at a table and they said that it was reserved. We sat at another table. Sat for 15 min and they never took our order.  No one ever sat at reserved tables. We girl up, said goodbye and left
author: Tracy R.

description: We were being tourist and this place totally intrigued us. So much so that we actually got drinks, went somewhere else and then can back. The migo cooler was our favorite cocktail due to the muddled fresh watermelon and refreshing taste. The venue is very lounge-y feeling and pretty dark but very chill. When we went in it wasn't overly crowded but once it got later it turned it to a bit of standing room only situation. Overall we had a great experience here and I would definitely come back!
author: Brittany S.

description: I am a big fan of Sugar lounge! I love the decor, very red and reminds me to bars in NYC. Perfect spot for dates or to grab a drink before or after a show at SF Jazz.
author: Elizabeth D.

description: The atmosphere is upscale and laid back but nothing much else really stands out about this place besides the annoying opera crowd. The drinks are meh for the most part. The happy hour specials are usually good but weak on the liquor . The bartenders seem a little sub par with cocktail knowledge too; my advice being don't stray for the specials or any cocktail with more then 2 ingredients.
author: Sabrina D.

description: Came to a 0DB concert on Friday and had fun dancing with my boo! Came back on Saturday cause he left his jacket and we got a couple cocktails. Apple mojito was fruity and what I was in the mood for. He got a mandarin mule which was sweet with like a spicy muddled ginger aftertaste. Drinks are standard sf prices ~$12-15 for a cocktail.
author: Megan T.

description:
A big array of cocktails as one would expect. We came here on a Sunday night as it was a holiday weekend and it was quite full at midnight. 
There are two sections (back room and front). The noise level isn't too high. Had a nice ambience and the vibe is pretty casual. It's in the heart of Hayes Valley so a nice spot to go before or after dinner :)
author: Van-Anh N.

description: Lush pink lights. Very sexy. Fun for a ladies' night out. But it can get crowded so you might or might not end up with a table.
author: Yad L.

description:
I almost feel this is a dive bar disguised as a nice lounge.  The ambience is nice, the location is nice, and even the bartenders look really nice.  However, it still feels like you are in a dive bar in the middle of downtown.  

The drinks are pretty good.  I had the Pepper Kahn and thought it was delicious.  The pineapple martini was too sweet.  and the bender will get you twisted!  

After a couple of the menu drinks, I just stick to my Jameson, can never go wrong with that.  Surprisingly,  this place can get a little packed, but not ridiculous.  There is a kinda hidden table in the back after the bathrooms.  Good place to get some privacy.  

If you are in Hayes Valley and are looking for a bar, I would recommend this one.
author: Veasna H.

description:
Great happy hour and daily deals ($5) but their regular priced drinks are a little pricey for what they are ($10, $11, and $12??)

Strong drinks and free happy hour eats (tempura, veggies, fruit, teriyaki, candy with comfy seating. As great as free happy hour food is, they run out fast, so don't come for the second half of happy hour if food is what you're looking for! The bartender that helped me out couldn't even crack a smile, but anyway...

I was NOT a fan of the mango mutiny, as there was way too much cayenne kick in it for me. Felt like some kind of a diet cleanse if you know what I mean. Worst $12 I've spent.

Vibe was kind of... off-putting. Not sure if I'll be back.
author: Colleen M.

description: It got crowded on a Friday night, and it was very loud considering the lounge-y atmosphere. The drinks were good, but pricy and small. The watermelon cocktail had real watermelon in it. I unfortunately didn't notice the free candy...maybe it's subtle?
author: Leeyen R.

description:
Cute place.  Nice mix of tall tables with high chairs,  bar seats and cozy cushioned seating. 
Tvs with sports game airing but doesn't feel like a sports bar. 
Great cocktails, but service can be a little slow. 
Specials are a real deal. On a Saturday  afternoon, the offer was a strawberry Margarita for $5!
author: Cheryl D.

description:
3.5 stars 

Cool, low lit bar in the Hayes Valley area.  The setting is nice and the drinks are well made.  I think the seating areas leave something to be desired and the shaky high tops need some attention.  

I will definitely be back given the location and proximity to the Opera House and Symphony Hall.  

Hopefully they spruce up the seating area a bit though and perhaps a cocktail menu.  Not exactly asking for the moon.
author: Lee S.

description:
Post-dinner spot and we lucked out! It's a trendy bar with a lounge ambiance. The bartenders were nice & the bar top is just cool--I mean--just look at it.  

Delicious cocktails (I had the Papa's Sour) and it's solid. We beat the Thursday night crowd so it was pretty low-key until it started jumping. Overall, it's a nice, intimate bar with good seat and the feeling was just right.

Will totally check this spot out again!
author: Juan T. K.

description: After passing by Sugar lounge every single day on my ride from dental school to home and seeing a huge pack of people outside, I finally made it here! And they have a $1 off yelp deal. I did not realize how popping Hayes Valley has become, I certainly will have to spend some more time here. Sugar Lounge was a nice cocktail bar. They have $5 happy hour and my friend got a cosmo. I wanted to try something strong, so they recommended the Richmond gimlet, and I told her I am not a gin fan, so she put vodka in instead. Thank you bartender! This place is small but a great place to come with a small group for a good drink and to hang out.
author: Nikita K.

description: Came here on the suggestions of the concierge at our hotel- Inn at the Opera. There was free appetizers for happy hour and drink specials! Can't beat the nice ice cold beer before hitting AT&T Park for a game! Loved the mini grilled cheese apps! Nom nom...
author: Vanessa O.

description:
THE BEST HAPPY HOUR SPOT IN SF!!!

Alluring cocktails and FREE FOOD in a sexy, sophisticated yet laid back hideaway in Hayes Valley...

HAPPY HOUR SPECIALS (until 7 PM)
*$3 Beers
*$4 Wells
*$5 Daily Cocktail Specials:
--Monday: Peach Cosmo
--Tuesday: Watermelon Long Island
--Wednesday: PBR with a Shot of Jim Bream
--Thursday: Lemon Drop
--Friday: Margarita
--Saturday: Peach Long Island
--Sunday: Any Daily Cocktail Special

FREE ALL-YOU-CAN GRUB (while vulture supplies last): 
Veggies & Dip, Chips & Salsa, Shrimp & Veggie Tempura, Lumpia, and Chicken Teriyaki. http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/TVRand2wmHT67J5WMsiBcA?select=IqtKXxil_FzOmn6DViGC7Q

"STRONG" SIGNATURE COCKTAILS (~$12): 
There about 12 kinds listed on the mirror board on top of the bar.  

Yesterday, 4.12.11, Chelsea, the awesome bartender made me the Rusty Ginger (Dewar's White Label, Ginger Ale) http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/TVRand2wmHT67J5WMsiBcA?select=8LklAZM4O1fVUkoyP6b4nA and Richmond Gimlet (Gin, Mulled Mint, Lime) http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/TVRand2wmHT67J5WMsiBcA?select=ocd2ZBBP5QGhezhO-r2LQg.

I'm a shots type of person and have achieved a high tolerance from weekend binge drinking but the Rusty Ginger which tastes like a spiked sweet ginger ale, had me whoozy and trying to contain my inner giggles since I was with my co-workers and one of my managers. As a regular gin drinker, the Richmond Gimlet was my favorite cocktail. It had a very clean and refreshing taste from the mint with a slight punch of citrus from the lime. Let's just say, this second cocktail had me wanting to jump on the couches and start dancing but I had to remind myself that I had a "professional" reputation to uphold, well at the office at least.

AMBIANCE/DÉCOR:
Sugar Lounge is small and intimate with a décor that would make any girly girl happy; pink walls, handblown glass lights and abstract art hanging on the walls. Soft rock plays in the background and is not blaring like other bar/lounges, so it's very easy to hold a conversation. There's a live DJ spinning on weekends.

PARKING: 
Easy street parking on weekdays before 6 PM. Parking is a little bit more difficult therefater and on weekends but not impossible like the downtown area. 

The HIGHLIGHT of my night at Sugar Lounge? 

Meeting the sweetest boy ever...

Too bad it was a 30 lb Golden Retriever mix. *sigh*
author: Cherylynn N.

description:
Hip kool neighborhood, stylish bar, very good vibe.

The staff and patrons at Sugar Lounge are really chill and friendly.

Is this a kute gurlie cocktail place?  Maybe.  I quite liked it.

Sugar Lounge also knows to cater to sports fans.  There's a huge widescreen monitor towards the back, and a game was on.

Seriously though-- is basketball ever *not* on?  ;p

Unusual little couch and table set-up right outside the restrooms.  Feels like you could just hang out there with pals all evening.  Just overlook the fact that toilets are in the next room, inches behind you.

It seemed to be an Eighties night, so a lot of poppy cheezey new wavey stuff was playing.

And If I'd been starving and less paranoid of free-for-all food at a bar, I might have tried some of the free appetisers.  Drinks were good.

This is a lovely, safe spot for a friends night out or a date.

All in all, the Sugar Lounge is kind of sweet.
author: Jade T.

description: The pink stripey awning outside of Sugar Lounge is vaguely reminiscent of a New Orleans strip club, and at night the exterior definitely gives off a tawdry vibe.  But once you get in,  there are clever twists on classic drinks ( American Mule instead of a Moscow, Richmond Gimlet with Hendicks, mint, lime, St Germaine and a champagne float) the seating is comfy and ample and the music is at a fun level but still allows for conversation . Recommended for 20/30 somethings with time to burn after the opera, ballet or symphony. We outwaited the atrocious parking structure  traffic after a performance and definitely recommend that strategy for anyone with a short fuse when it comes to ridiculous driving in a parking structure.
author: Marisa R.

description:
I used to live in the neighborhood and was a regular here.  Now, living in another state, I so wanted Sugar Lounge to be as wonderful as I remembered, so this was my first stop in San Francisco after checking in at my hotel.  I'm not sure how they managed it, but they are actually better!  The owners were present when I came in, and they actually remembered me, even though it's been ages.  Many of the regulars remembered me too.  

"Sometimes you want to go
Where everybody knows your name
And they're always glad you came"

Jamie is such a great bartender too.  That is reason enough to go in, but there are so many more reasons.  The décor is fun.  They keep mini-candy bars out for the guests.  Weekday happy hour features delicious complimentary appetizers (like yummy tempura, egg rolls, homemade guacamole, and bite size Panini), and there is a daily drink of the day.  Want to watch the game?  No problem.  Three different screens enable more than one sporting event to be enjoyed at the same time.

Every day I was in town, I came in and every time I left happy.  I have only one problem.  Living 625 miles away, won't allow me to come in again for awhile.
author: Michael F.

description:
If you're a single dude or gay girl THIS is the place to meet women. Colorful candy colored cocktails with cute garnishes with free mini candy bars at the bar: #girlheaven Think I spotted two dudes, total. Drinks are strong and around $10 a pop and the lounge has low pink lighting and comfy couches.

The candy assortment was average: Milky Way, Snickers, etc, but I mentioned FREE right? Cute bar for post work drinks and an affordable  (rare) Hayes Valley spot.
author: Zara S.

description:
Great place to have great drinks and catch up with friends! I came here on Wednesday with a group of friends celebrating their co-workers retirement and I had a wonderful time!
The place is a little small so it is perfect for an intimate get together! The bartenders were very attentive and made good drinks! 
The food was yummy as well! I'm not sure what they were called but I had a slider with coleslaw and it was yummy. I've heard they have free appetizers during happy hour but first come, first serve. (We had ordered ours).
author: Georgette E.

description: The cocktails were nice, not great. The music was too low as I could barely hear it and I was sitting at the bar. It was busy but not too busy. Overall, I would say this is a good place to grab a couple of drinks but not to hang out for an entire evening.
author: Rudy S.

description: We stopped by for one drink on Friday night. Loved the atmosphere. Light up tables look really great and make the place very comfy. Excellent service. Would definitely come back
author: Julie D.

description:
Hm. Sugar is a very interesting spot. 
Very mixed clientele (age, gender, orientation, etc) , decent drinks.
They have a good HH that goes on until 7pm if you like fruity cocktail type of drinks. Not exactly my thing anymore, whiskey and ginger ale please. 

They've got free food during HH: kimbap (Korean sushi), carrot and celery sticks, tempura, caprese skewers, chips & salsa, they re-fill a few times but I'm not sure when they stop. They usually run out of food around 6pm-ish. 

There's a decent amount of seating but each time I've been there, the drunks that sit by the doorway have this tendency to be ALL OVER THE PLACE. If you're sitting on a cushioned stool facing away from them, watch your back. It gets annoying having people ram into your back constantly.

I like this spot well enough to drop in for an after work stress reliever drink, but I wouldn't stay.
author: Susy C.

description:
I like Sugar Lounge for Happy Hour - $4 Well Drinks and $5 Cocktail of the day (Thursday - Lemon Drop). I have been here twice and have enjoyed myself, the drinks are great and the Vodka Soda is VERY strong.. I should not complain about that. 

During Happy Hour, Sugar also provides complimentary appetizers, snacks, and chocolates. Previously they have had spring rolls, chicken, tempura vegetables, sushi rolls, and chips & salsa. This definitely draws folks in, it is a great perk. 

Right now they have their Valentines Day decorations up and my goodness, if you are not a fan of V-Day - STAY AWAY! Basically, Cupid threw up all over Sugar. It is cute though..

The bartenders are also friendly and very speedy. Also, the seating is great - many options and it does not get crazy crowded.
author: Natasha S.

description: Came in after reading the reviews about the ambiance. Interior is cool but the place has no music, can't even redeem the $1 off offer because the owner doesn't appreciate her customers. This place sucks. Don't come here.
author: Kimbo S.

description:
After a filling dinner... sis, S.O. and I stumbled upon this place to warm up. 

It was pretty dead considering it was just 9 pm.

I forgot what the S.O. got as well as the sis BUT I got a hot toddy... and it was perfect! It kept me warm and fuzzy... bingo. Just what the doctor ordered! 

Decor is sexy... well after a couple of drinks... something red in the interior screams sexy to me! 

The DJ was mostly playing 80s music ... but as soon as he started playing some songs that I actually know... sis wanted to get out... 

Decent spot for a drink.
author: Cath M.

description:
Minus a wack DJ, the homies and I had a great time celebrating a birthday here! Not too crowded, stiff drinks and to top it off...no cover charge! 

The DJ was playing music from all genres, which we all enjoyed. But dude needed help mixing and transitioning from his dope old school hip hop to Rihanna.

Nice lounge, I'll add it to my list!
author: Earlene C.

description:
Great spot to get drinks in Hayes Valley. Very much a lounge not a dive bar at all, love the neon sign outside reminds me of a 1980s club. 
BUT MOST OF ALL this review is about the lovely Ms. Ginger.  She's beautiful, nice, an angel as well as a Tae Kwon Do Black belt as well as a swimsuit competition model as well as one of the bartenders at Sugar Lounge. You might find prettier bartenders in the city but none as hospitable or interesting as Ginger. 
Sadly Ginger round house kicked some drunken fool at the bar and now has to have foot surgery. Just kidding, but she is having foot surgery and probably at one time or another wanted to roundhouse kick a customer. Regardless we will all miss her and hope she has a speedy recovery. 
The other bartenders are nice ladies as well. The management in this place knows how to hire.
author: Devin S.

description: This was the only little bar we visited while out here on vacation. The bar tender was super friendly and helpful, the place was not busy, the music was great. The bathrooms were clean and the floor was not sticky! That is always a plus in my mind!
author: Tina S.

description:
I met up with a group for HH on a Wednesday. I checked out the website before hand and was looking forward to going. It's a great spot to actually have a conversation - the music is good but not too loud, and there were 2 bartenders which meant that drinks were made quickly. My only gripe is that they taunt free appetizers, but when I got there shortly after HH started, there was nothing left and it wasn't refilled during the 2 hours or so I was there, so I had to eat their candy instead.

I'd definitely come back, but want to try their food :(
author: Candace R.

description: Lovely place!! Their bacon old fashioned is amazing!
author: Nick C.

description:
Odd option.

This place is a little weird - it feels like it's trying to appeal to my 13 year old self - lit up bar, free candy and over the top. 

Didn't really try the cocktails - wasn't sure it would have been a good idea. We had shots and then leaves out.
author: Stephanie M.

description: One of my favorite local spots. Good cocktails, awesome bartenders, and cool mix of people.
author: Karina B.

description:
I don't know why I thought this place was a lesbian bar at first because the bartenders were female and then I realized almost all bartenders were female. I also got this place confused with sugar cafe when I first saw it. I obviously went full retard the night I was here. 

They have some awesome cocktails and specials that run all night. I asked the male bartender if this one cocktail was good and he told me he never tried it instead of lying and saying it was good. I don't think I would have realized he did that if he didn't point out that he decided to tell me the truth instead of making something up. 

This place is pretty girly and got quite loud. The decor is gorgeous and I would def come back again although I don't know who I could ever talk into coming here with me. I didn't really see any other bars in the area. It was either this or Absinthe and I always feel uncomfortable at restaurant bars. God forbid I get shitfaced drunk while people are trying to have a nice peaceful dinner.
author: Tiffany V.

description:
DRINK:
1.) mudslide = I had just had dinner, so I felt like dessert. Since I was at a bar, I just ordered something very sweet. And this did it. 


SERVICE
friendly bartender :)


ATMOSPHERE
Cute lil dive bar layout w few high tables and a small seating lounge in the front. The atmosphere is nice, as why it attracted me to stop and go in
author: Angela L.

description: They bought me with this delicious Old Fashion. Very friendly place, music is nice, having the best time of my life! Thanks a lot to Mert and Sherly, great customer service.
author: Andreja J.

description: Suga suga , you ain't that sweet. Good place to grab some booze. I once ordered a midor sour and the lady wasn't sure how to make it... So.. I picked something else. Sometimes they have free snacks. However, the last time I went there was only candy or chocolate available. Anyways, not a bad place to watch sports games if it's not crowded.
author: Ann L.

description: I enjoyed the drinks, this was my first time there, the only thing I didn't enjoy was the smell.  I'm not really sure what it was but one side of the bar smelled really bad.... :-/
author: Noelle W.

description: Went to this place after looking for someplace fun to hangout before Janet Jackson show.  Read this on their website "Join us after work and sample Sugar's award-winning Happy Hour. Featuring a $5 daily drink special, as well as happy hour prices on cocktails and beers, Sugar lays out a delicious spread of appetizers, from our sister restaurant Hahn's Hibachi Family Style Korean BBQ Restaurant."  This made our decision a slam dunk!  Wrong.  No delicious spread of apps.....lots of halloween candy.....asked bartender about food, she said she could scrounge up from chips and salsa if we wanted.  :(  Drink was good....but had to split, needed more then fun size snickers to power me through a night of dancing!  Kinda bummed!  Wanted to like it.
author: Dar D.

description:
If you like FREE food during happy hour AND want to be incognito, come by Sugar Lounge!

The crowd is very diverse, possibly consisting of a lot of people working around the Civic Center area. There is plenty of seating (if you come right after work), but after all of the seats and bar stools fill up, you can always stand around or stand near the free food. What kind of free food? Well, they almost always have chicken teriyaki, tempura, small fried egg rolls, chips & salsa, veggies, finger sandwiches and tomato/basil/mozzarella skewers - just to name the things that I've seen there. Not all dishes are there for happy hour every day though.

The drinks are all fairly cheap during happy hour. The bottled beers are $3, so I always enjoy a couple bottles of Blue Moon, Sierra Nevada or Stella. Well drinks are $4 and some specialty cocktails (my friend likes the lemon drop martini) run at $5. 

Inside, it's very dark, despite how light it can be outside. Maybe you'll want to take a first date here, so you don't feel the pressure of having them stare at you. ;)
author: Melissa D.

description:
Love the decor, unique drink menu, and intimate atmosphere (I've only been here on Thursdays & Sundays). Great place to meet a friend, or a first date, for a drink and conversation. But don't expect great, or even good service on a Sunday.

Every Sunday that I've been here, the bartender was unfriendly, slow-moving, and indifferent. At $10/drink I would expect at least a bit of hospitality, but not here. Thursdays are always great!
author: Olga P.

description:
The place is nice the drinks are Ok but the bartender, she's too rude and have attitudes towards customer. She should smile and communicate more!!!
Even say Hello would be nice...
author: Sonya B.

description: Great low key chill spot. I came here on a Sunday, perfect for what I was looking to do; have a good drink and be in a relaxed atmosphere.
author: Charita H.

description:
I hate to give you a bad review, Sugar Lounge, but after getting THE WORST food poisoning from your "Taco Tuesdays", I feel obliged to warn others and protect their guts.

4 hours after eating your food, I experienced terrible stomach cramps, and was simultaneously vomiting and having diarrhea until the early morning. I had to call in sick today because I nearly fainted on the bart train to work. 

Please please tighten up your Happy Hour food. Often I see not enough communal utensils such as tongs.  Food Borne Illness is serious business.

Aside from my horrible health experience, I really like this place. The bartenders are really friendly and the atmosphere is very intimate and stylish.
author: Lex B.

description:
I've been here twice now. The first time was entirely forgettable- except for the fact I can't forget how ridiculously bad their lemon drop was. I don't care if its on HH, its not good. 

The second time I realized the bar was actually decorated nicely- post christmas, so I assume that had something to do with it. And they had a tv with the warriors game on.. so maybe its not such a bad place after all. I don't recommend it to people, but because Hayes Valley only really has ...3? bars.... what are you going to do?
author: Emily D.

description:
Went for a rare night out with some besties, looking to take part in a little tom foolery action listening to my man Andrew Tosh dish out some modern day funny. Before the show we decided to hit up some local libation spots, and stumbled upon the Sugar Lounge.  

I got carded and my wife and 2 friends did not, which was a great starting perk. We went in and the place was full, a nice pinkish hue dimly spilled throughout the space. I make my way through the music and crowd to the bar. A lovely latina bar tender greets me and I charm her into smiling with a smile of my own. I ordered a few specials off their board for the ladies, and a couple beers and shots of Jamie. We get lucky and score the tables in the back intimate room and revel in the gold glow from the table, pictures to commemorate.  

I get up to score another round of drinks, but this time on the other side of the bar. My friend and I stand there near the bar tender, not the gal this time but a short white dude, he doesn't even bat an eye, he must be busy. Cleaning glasses? another couple stands next to us and we all stare at him. You would think in a packed house of eager drinkers would be the time to make money for the bar and himself? He instead turns the other direction and leaves the bar area, WTF. I then say let's get out of here. As I pass the idiot bartender I make sure to bump into him really good. So, whoever owns this bar, invest in upbeat bartenders who like to work in that type of atmosphere and keep the spirits flowing. The next bar we went to was much different by large. I will review them next. BEWARE, NO SUGAR AT THIS LOUNGE. only salt, and maybe a few lemons.
author: Jason D.

description: Great place for a super chill happy hour! It seems like half the people there are regulars and all chat with each other. It isn't packed, either, so it's easy to get a decent spot to sit. I think beers are $5 and well drinks are $6? Not bad for Hayes Valley! Decor is reeeally dated, but it's very charming in a don't-eat-anything-off-any-surfaces-because-they-haven't-been-cleaned-since-1986 kind of way. But DO eat the happy hour mini-buffet, because you're about to throw down 3 strong greyhounds on a weeknight.
author: Rachel M.

description:
*FREE* bar food during happy hour - tortilla chips with fresh salsa, chicken teriyaki chunks, and jalapeno "quesadillas" (more like mini buns) were served hot in buffet steamers during our visit.    The snacks were plentiful and refilled for the light crowd, although be forewarned - the free food attracted a few older "retirees" who milked a beer and hovered for dinner.

Being Sugar Lounge, the mixed drinks are obviously for those with a sweet tooth.   The Pisco Revival ($12 signature cocktails listed on the overhead mirrors) was strong and tasty, served in a martini glass.  The lady friend's $5 Thursday Happy Hour Lemon Drop (different nightly specials - I must try the Watermelon Long Island on Tuesday!) was pretty much pure tart lemonade without any buzz.  We stuck to the $4 Happy Hour well drinks after that.

Where have you been all my life, Sugar?  I'm ready to commit - let's go steady.
author: Kevin W.

description:
I met up with someone here for the first time. I arrived a few minutes ahead and ordered an American Mule cocktail. It had a prominant ginger taste and quite good. When my friend arrived she ordered a Pink something cocktail and she thoroughly enjoyed it. My second drink was a vodka based concoction that I don't recall what it was called. It was equally good if not better than the first. I am quite impressed with the drinks in this place.

The decor is really cool, see the pictures. I like the sofa style, lounge seating throughout the place. Great lighting and perfectly positioned TV's not too much but enough to have something to distract.

I'm definitely coming back.
author: Gabriel B.

description:
This bar/lounge has really unique drinks, which is definitely a plus. But the drinks are really, really strong. I guess that can be a pro or con, depending on your goal for the night. I got the basil gimlet and while it was good, I could only really taste gin and wasn't able to enjoy the cocktail as much. Maybe next time I go there, I'll ask to make the drink a little bit less strong. Prices are comparable to other places in San Francisco. 

On weekdays, this place isn't too crowded so finding a table or a place by the bar isn't hard. It does get really crowded on a Friday/Saturday though.
author: Krishna S.

description: Came here on a random rainy night with a guy friend. Very friendly bartenders, nice decor, and great drinks! The music wasn't my taste, but not a deal breaker. I would come back for pregame drinks with my ladies!
author: Monique W.

description:
The place looks great! I really liked their decoration!
The lights under the tables, and the table that imitates marmol? Nice!

The waitress was really nice.

Ideal when you want to have a chill conversation during the week
author: Antonia R.

description:
I made the pick for this venue for an after-work meet-up and the resulting feeling was"m-eh."  The drinks were inventive and the bartender was a gorgeous and engaging woman.  

The as advertised snacks were gone by the bottom of the 7:30pm Happy Hour end-time; restocking seemed out of the question as it was pretty quiet on the foot traffic.  The decor left a bit to be desired as well.  Perhaps all the creativity went into the drinks.  Full disclosure, it was a rainy Wednesday night, so it may be an a-typical evening.  That said, I wouldn't put this place on my go-to list unless someone I know had a better experience.  Spruce the place up a bit and the vibe would definitely change; in this city, there's tons of places to get an $9 cocktail, so the competition is definitely on!  Sadly, from my visit to Sugar Lounge, they've just barely phoned it in.
author: Caleb H.

description:
Not sure if a Pink Pussycat should be anything but pink! Nonetheless, it tasted alright, although it's an orange-ish color due to its mixing origins. Nobody would naturally call a drink "pink" if not visually apparent, right? Just sayin'.

Might be just an okay place otherwise... Service can be inattentive for getting your check.
author: Garett T.

description:
After a big dinner, our little group decided to walk around Hayes Valley in search of a swanky bar to get our drink on.  Absinthe was pretty busy and we were hoping to find a place to sit so we went across the street to Sugar Lounge to grab a drink.  They're normally much busier and we were a little surprised at how quiet it was there, but there were seats open so we dove in for a fancy cocktail.

I decided to try the Bees Knees and bought my friend a Pineapple Express.  Both $10 drinks, the Bees Knees consisted of Jameson, Wild Turkey American Honey, Frangelico, and a honey drizzle.  I can't quite remember what was in the Pineapple Express except that it was sort of like a piña colada but used gin instead of rum.  The Bees Knees was really damn strong but was lightened up by the honey drizzle and I quite enjoyed it at the time.  However, I did end up with a huge headache the next morning which didn't help much.

While the place might have been quiet on a Wednesday night, I can see why the Sugar Lounge is normally packed.  The drinks were tasty and reasonably priced for this neighborhood and it's definitely popular with the locals.  It's not quite as posh as Absinthe but has a charm all its own.  I will definitely be dropping in again when I'm in the area.

Food: 8/10

Service: 8/10

Price: $$

Atmosphere: 8/10
author: Joe M.

description:
Neighborhood bar where all the local professionals go for a stiff drink after work, or to watch sports or elections.  Only novices bother to try the whimsically named but overly sweetened drinks on the board above the bar.

This place is sultry and dark but always has a good crowd of attractive people.  

Free happy hour food on certain days and free candy.
author: M S.

description:
Worst bar in San Francisco. They have no idea how to make drinks. When the bartender made me a manhattan and it came up short in the glass, he topped it off with soda water.

When a friend ordered a vodka drink and it came up short, he topped it off with a ton of vodka. Gross.

Stay away.
author: Sachin A.

description: I feel like the video shows why Hayes Valley is being taken over byt polite bartenders who make a good Old Fashion: https://youtu.be/9XXOiUC9MXw
author: Hayes T.

description:
Always have a great time here :)

The location is great, although parking is pretty difficult here at night.

I believe their happy hour is $5 beer and wine. And they have free food (kimbap, caprese salad, chips, guac, etc).

The downside of free food though, you see people that look out of place, that were there just to enjoy the free food. It's fun to talk about them while we're drinking, so whatevs.

Cheers to many more happy hour here!
author: Novalina N.

description:
A fun neighborhood bar that keeps it quiet when need be but knows how to make a mean sugary drink (or not-so-sugary if that's what you prefer).

The bartenders have always been friendly and know their craft well.  Ask them for a special drink and I'm sure they'd be happy to create something just for you.  Make sure they're not crazy busy first ;)
author: Kevin J.

description:
Wonderful atmosphere in this laid back lounge. Good crowd and music, excellent happy hour options and top notch bartenders.

Nice varied seating options and a TV without sound which is nice for the sports fans but doesn't impede on the chill lounge vibe.

Also, really impressed with the mixology here. Jamie (sp?) made one of the best gin martinis I've ever had. Definitely worth the trip across the bay for this one.
author: Miyaka C.

description:
Dude. Duuuuuewd. Fvcking dude.

Last time I went here I was all like, OMG this free happy hour food is so awesome..

And then they hit it off with the orange chicken and ham-cheese-jalapeno-lumpia quesadillas... Y E S effff yeah man.

hellaloveyouguise and stuff.
author: Noe O.

description:
The decor is great - cute and just enough.  We went on a Tuesday and had different drinks, including watermelon long islands for $5 each.  The drinks were a little strong, but it worked out since I happened to be in the mood for a strong drink or two.

There were free melt sandwiches, which were delicious.  We wish there were more, but can't complain since they were free.  

We sat in the back past the bathrooms.  Honestly, we did not expect there would be seats there, but there was.  There were some fruit flies in the back, but hey, what were a few fruit flies when you were going for drinks and a good time?

The bartenders were very nice and attentive.  They might not smile when you first meet them, but I don't need bartenders creepily smiling at me all the time. They had good work attitude, and that was good enough for me.
author: Vivi S.

description:
Watermelon Long Island is my favorite.

I did get lucky on my visit, wasn't too crowded. I can imagine a hip place like this would get really busy and not be as fun.

Despite that, I love the sweet drink selection and if you can find a seat it's a lovely place. I don't even mind the prices.
author: Alejandro T.

description:
My Diamond in the Gough. 

You know when you find one of those really awesome spots, and you're hesitant to let the world know about it for fear of losing your quality seat at the bar? Well (sigh), let me introduce you to Sugar Lounge. 

Located on the corner of Gough and Hayes, this little gem features one of the best happy hours in the city. Hands down.

What makes a great happy hour, you ask? Besides the obvious (cheap drinks, good selection, friendly bartenders), it's delicious, delicious free food. 

And not janky peanuts and crackers. No No No. The happy hour food here is legit. I'm talking tempura shrimp, teriyaki chicken, chocolate covered strawberry's...

You know what... I'd write more but it's almost happy hour and I'm starving. So while you read this, I will undoubtedly be enjoying free food, cheap drinks, and possibly some romantic chocolate-covered-strawberry-feeding. 

Find me at Sugar Lounge, suga.
author: William H L.

description: Great happy hour, amazing decor (love the under lit agate bar, sofas and tables). Innovative cocktail list. Great looking food on offer (we didn't try it having just eaten.) Happy hour drink special was a solid drink for $5. Great place to wait for City Arts and Lectures at Nourse theatre to open their doors. I saw all types, great neighborhood mix, one ancient, elegant woman on the couch that was dressed to the nines (who was being personally served by the bartender- very heart warming) a group of women from work near the door, a couple and their dog at the bar, two very in love couples (one gay, one straight) at the side tables, a loose group of men talking sports at the bar. Bartenders were quick, friendly and made lovely drinks. This is San Francisco.
author: L J H.

description: Came here with one of my girls for happy hour. She chose this place because the food here is free. The food is pretty good actually. They had chips and salsa, sushi (futomaki), tempura veggies and shrimp, and some yummy grilled chicken. I had their strawberry margarita, which tasted just ok, so that's why I'm only giving them 3 stars. But this place is great for a more low-key experience.
author: Karen L.

description:
3.5 stars

Being that it's the holidays, Sugar Lounge had that festive mood going on with Christmas lights, ornaments galore, little candy canes on the wall and wreaths on the door. 

You'll instantly notice the low lighting here. I'm glad I didn't have to pile on the concealer for my pimple since its dim enough, nobody would even notice! Plus, it gets warm in here especially if you're sitting towards the back of the bar, so the flush on your cheeks makes you even more beautiful. 

The drinks we had were on the weak side! we had a sip of my friend's pomegranate martini and we're like, "uh, is there alcohol in there?"  Happy hour at Sugar Lounge means $3 beers and $5 well drinks. The cocktail special of  the night was the $5 peach cosmos which I didn't get to explore since I was stuck on my Tanqueray and Tonic. If you're feeling the munchies, they have free food set-up (chips and salsa, quesadillas, etc.) but get here early as they don't replenish the food. 

On a side note, my BFF had an incredibly great time here. This guy gets turned on by exposed brick just like (* snaps finger *) that. There weren't any acts of lasciviousness involving the said friend and the exposed brick, but then again, I don't kiss and tell. ; )

Sugar Lounge, thank you for happy hour. You gave me much needed respite from the crazy holiday season. 

* For David B, exposed brick lover and BFF extraordinaire *
author: Janice C.

description:
Came here on a late sunday afternoon for some drinks. I absolutely loved it! The bartender was amazing and was very attentive to the group. She introduced us to several DELICIOUS drinks such as the Watermelon Long Island- this definitely put me over the edge. It was so delicious, not too sweet and a little bit tart. Cant taste the alcohol!

I forgot the names of the other ones, but the 3 drinks I got were delicious. Very fruity, but lemony and NOT sweet, which is awesome. Its like drinking lemonade!

Added perk: they have tons of candy lying around the bar! Played old school hip hop music which brought a very chill atmosphere
author: Annie K.

description:
I have gone to Sugar a bunch of times. I love love love the decor and how cozy it is. I love the very small room (sits 6-8) in the back to hang out away from the crowd. 

Stay with the mixed drinks, as that is what they are known for - don't order the wine and don't come here thinking they have coffee or tea (like I have a couple of times).
author: Jenn D.

description:
So, I've been wanting to come here for, I don't know, several YEARS?!  You know how sometimes the longer one waits to try something, the bigger the opportunity for disappointment can be... Well, I finally happened to be in the 'hood last night and thankfully remembered to come to Sugar.  $5.00 Strawberry margaritas... all night long... on a Friday?!  Yes please!  These aren't the powdered strawberry margaritas you may remember from your college days.  There were actually fresh strawberry slivers! yummy!  They did run out, but then they were nice enough to keep the $5.00 special going for regular margaritas. 

The music was awesome, lots of the top 40 hits, but also a whole slew of late 90's jams.  It was loud enough to be fun, but we could still talk and hear each other without having to yell.  Oh, and there was plenty of seating. So, yeah, I'm definitely a fan.
author: Chloe M.

description:
Excellent cocktails. Plenty to choose from. 
Great happy hour snacks. 
Dark, cozy and reasonable noise level so you can hear yourself talking. 

Finally a bar that has female bartenders who don't hurtle the bottles across the room into a trash can to crash loudly. No need to rattle the bottles so loudly!. At the end of the day, I like to relax, not feel like I have to put in ear plugs and yell at the person next to me.
author: Nancy G.

description:
11 pm.

The door opens, warmth pulls.

Faces. 

Do I know you? Would be nice.

Phil M, hey whats up.

Hard to move, ouch come on. Hey who's hand was that?

Can I have a drink? Whiskey please. W-h-i-s-k-e-y, please!?!

cute, dude, dude, meh, dude, cute, dude.

These people, from where?

Amorphous glass covers the light. Yellows and reds. 

Tired, not tonight. Darwin awaits.
author: Jeremy S.

description:
This is one of the most hip bars in Hayes! Sugar Lounge has a great clientele mix along with magnificent drinks at amazing prices!!! I was so excited to find this adorable lounge on Pride day 2013. Not only is the ambiance relaxing, but the bartenders are incredibly welcoming. I had the best time here and hope to go back SOON!!!!!

Thank you bartenders at SUGAR LOUNGE for being so BAD ASS!

-Marc S.
author: Marc S.

description:
The ambiance of this place is really girly, which I like. The counter was also an amber color light up bar. The bartender (1 woman show) is friendly and helpful.  She gives her advice on which drink to order.  The menu is written up on mirrors atop the bar.  
Plenty of seating and cushy pillows. 
They offer free food and candy during Happy Hour. Kimchi egg rolls, SPICY salsa and chips, M&Ms, twix bars, etc. 
It's a nice place to grab a drink before heading to dinner in the area.
author: Patricia S.

description: Hubby and I stumbled upon (and out of) Sugar Lounge when we went to see the President in SF.  There were so many people at the event, we didn't want to wait in line and were looking for a place to have a few drinks before the event.  Sugar Lounge was close by and an easy walk.  We made it for HH where they had a setup of chips, salsa, chili and other fun goodies.  Yup, it was free and the drinks were reasonable.  The decor is comfy with stools at the bar and little couches.  It's a great place for a pit stop.
author: VB L.

description: Place is nice to be with friends but drinks are ok. I would have given this location a better review but they get 3 stars because the bartenders did not do a great job when i mentioned a fly had fly in to my drink. Instead of giving me a new drink or a refund she just took the drink away. I wasn't very pleased by the service.
author: Brenda M.

description:
Love this bar! Cozy enough for a small group. Lots of bar space to hang with the bartenders (who are awesome, BTW). 

Free food during happy hour! You don't see that very often anymore. Drinks aren't cheap, but they aren't pricey. I wish they had beer on tap, though.

Definitely not a place for straight guys to go alone or in a group of guys. Bring a girl- you'll thank me later.
author: Mar A.

description: My usual watering hole one block from my work. Free appetizers (tempura shrimp and veggies, sushi, teriyaki chicken, chips and salsa and guacamole, lumpia), great people, great happy hour, can't complain. You meet regulars or concert goers in the area heading to the symphony or venues in the vicinity. Always fun to bullshit with the bartenders...Ginger is one of my favorite bartenders in the city, hands down. Did I mention free appetizers!
author: Nick L.

description: wow shriley and this guy mertt whos a barback is amazing. good customer service on a wednesday night. will def come back
author: Rjay D.

description: I love the Sugar Lounge! It's a fantastic place to enjoy a cocktail! The ambiance is very classy! The signature cocktails are a must try! I love this place & I think you will too!!
author: Cori M.

description: It's ok. Not too crazy or loud, places to sit, but nothing exciting. And I didn't like the big distracting tv screen.
author: Andrew K.

description:
What more can you ask for than a cocktail lounge with girly drinks and ESPN on? 
We came in after dinner looking to catch the last few minutes of the big game and managed to find a prime place to watch a 5x overtime game.  The best part was we could chill and watch the game without anyone hassling us.  The barback even filled us in on what we missed.

We ended up coming back after ice cream and each enjoying a drink. I tried the Richmond Gimlet which tasted mostly of mint and mildly of lime.  No nasty juniper here!  The Root beer float was not as good, tasting mediciney at the bottom.  

The nicest part was my friend had jammed her finger earlier and it was hurting.  The bartenders were kind enough to fill a ziplock with ice for her so she could ice it.  Overall a great place to hang out with friends.  

A+ for service, B for the cocktails.
author: Nicole R.

description: Review is only for HH.  The drinks are good but the free buffet is where it's at.  The bartender wasn't the most cheery or friendly lady.
author: love n.

description:
They get an extra star for putting up with my drunk friend admirably! we can barely do it sometimes so I really appreciate it when bars can.

Cocktails are ok, had some whisky ginger ale and somesuch drink and it was a tad weak but tasted fine.
author: Misha T.

description:
Sugar lounge is the only bar I went to when I lived in Hayes Valley.. it has a great happy hour with some not-so-great free food.  Ok it's free so, I guess I can't judge, but still.

They also have a bunch of fun drinks to order from on the wall behind the bar.  Pretty small place, worth going to at least once.
author: Laura P.

description: Yes, 5 stars for this place for being somewhere between a dive and a lounge -- not pretentious, not crowded for a Saturday night. If you have a big group and arrive between 8 - 830 -- as someone mentioned below, you'll feel like you own the place. A lounge with room in SF is certainly a commodity.
author: Mel G.

description:
As the name would suggest, the drinks in the place are sweet ... 

"It's really sweet" the bartender warned ... so I ordered something else instead.  I love sweet ....so I should probably have just stuck to my guns.

The something else I ordered was a margarita type drink with cayenne pepper.  It was as spicy as the other drink was sweet. I don't love spicy so much ... but then again, it probably saved me from a hangover.

Pretty cool place ... if you're a chick.
author: Kathleen W.

description: Just went for a quick relaxing drink after work and I must say that the drinks were amazing and the service was even better. The bartender was fantastic and the barback mert was very friendly with customers . Would highly recommended coming to here
author: Mark H.

description:
After skimming through their board of specialties, you really start to wonder if they do sprinkle in some sugar in their drinks.  So many seem pretty sweet and tasty...I can easily see how the place earned its name.  

Drinks are about average in price for mixed varieties, but I'm not sure about their cocktails.  They all seemed to be served in fairly large glasses though (and they all seemed pink...), so they might be worth the money even if they are priced higher as some people noted.  The bartenders seemed friendly enough, and one seemed to forget to tell me how much for me to pay.  I actually had to ask her what the tab would be just so I could make sure to put something down on the bar.

There are a few tables and couches towards the front for people to sit, along with some stools along the wall opposite the bar.  They also have a small room towards the back that lends some privacy from the main bar area.  It's probably pretty handy when you want some alone time, or at least to get away from some of the crowds.

Defintely a place to go in the Hayes Valley area, and I'll probably try to come back for a HH to get the free appetizers (woohoo for free food!).  Just do yourself a favor though - make sure you know you are going to Sugar Lounge and not Sugar Cafe (or vice versa) so that you don't end up driving all over the city like how I did.
author: Mike L.

description: Great happy hour. With free apps given,but they are not plentiful. So first come first serve.
author: Thomas M.

description:
Cute little Bar. Came in around 9:30 on a Saturday to meet my girlfriends. 

The decor is nice and classy, but... whatever the things are on the walls covering the lights... well they look like mouth retainers, my friends and I had a grand laugh about that and joked about it the rest of the evening..!

The drinks were great, I really liked the Pink Pussycat. 

We did notice that this place was swarming with women, if you are looking to flirt your way into free drinks from men, this is not the place for that ladies! 

I would come here again for sure. It's perfect for girls night.

P.S - The bathrooms were CLEAN!
author: Meghan L.

description:
This place has an AWESOME happy hour from 5-7:30.
