Not only do they have a fun new $5 cocktail every day of the week, but they have free food! When I went there were chips and guacamole, chicken teriyaki bites, veggies and dip, and a couple other things. Not exactly a gourmet meal but definitely some fun bar bites. And all for free!

Tuesday is Watermelon Long Island day, but I wasn't a huge fan. It was just too sweet and had an overpowering artificial watermelon flavor. On the bright side, it was pretty strong!
author: Laura L.

description:
Broke? Hungry? Tired? Chances are, Sugar Lounge can cure what ails ya.

Well, maybe not the tired part... but most definitely the broke/hungry ends of the spectrum!

Sugar Lounge arguably does one of the better happy hours in the city. Sometimes, when businesses offer up "happy hour," there's hardly an incentive to rush over between 5:00 and 7:00pm, just to trip over some joker in a three-piece suit who just left his stuffy office job for $1 off a Pabst Blue Ribbon and a bowl of stale Chex Mix. Sure, saving a buck is cool, but I need a little more oomph to be inspired to hit a happy hour gathering these days. This is where Sugar Lounge comes into play, as they go above and beyond nearly every other bar in the city taking a stab at conquering the Irish Commute.

During Happy Hour, they not only have cheap beers and cocktails ($3 beers, $5 well drinks), but they also have free food! Everything from chips and salsa, lumpia, fried sweet potatoes, teriyaki chicken and more! It's hard to say that I'd be excited to pay for this food any other time, but seriously - as a free accouterment to the already-discounted drinks, it's pretty generous on their part. Plus - the chicken was darn good! Definitely worth the grand total of $free.99.

For as little as 180 pennies (not counting tip), you can acquire a nice post-work buzz and grub enough nosh to ensure you leave the bar feeling like you had a decent-sized meal. Not too shabby, huh?
author: Ruggy J.

description:
Happy Hour Review. 

Drinks are cheap, taste pretty good, and did I mention free food? Like real food. Egg rolls, chips and salsa, little sushi bites, chicken nuggets, chicken teriyaki, these yummy free bites changes periodically. 

Free bites, cheap drinks, how can I complain?
author: Jamie T.

description:
My cocktails tasted decent. For a small venue that's not overcrowded and serves free bites during happy hour, I have no complaints.  Free.99!  It's like Costco "food tasting"... with alcohol. 

If you get here early and squat with a large group, you'll feel like you booked the place.  Pimpin'.
author: Erika C.

description:
When you're torn between throwing back a couple drinks and having a chill night and just going all out, I think Sugar Lounge is the perfect medium between the two. There isn't anything that completely wow's me but there's also nothing that would stop me from coming back. 

I've been here a couple times and have always had a great time. They offer strong, tasty drinks in a chill, laid back, and cozy atmosphere. I had a greyhound here (my new go-to drink) and it was made well and they also offer specialty cocktails. 

They usually have a DJ on the weekends playing mashups and top 40. Pretty much anything to get you in the mood to have a good time.

Sugar Lounge is perfect for any kind of night but I'd recommend it for a more laid-back night or the first stop of the night. Definitely one of the more affordable spots to get a drink in the neighborhood. It's on the smaller side so if you're in a group get there earlier so you can snag the comfy red couch by the window - perfect spot!
author: Stephanie C.

description:
Who knew so many douchenozzles from the Marina came out to Hayes Valley?

Terrible service too.
author: William W.

description:
Sugar Lounge is a sweet little spot (that will hit the spot) if you are  looking for a place to chill in a friendly loungey atmosphere in Hayes Valley. Friends live right near by, so I've been here a couple times to get watered.

Love the music, vibe, and bartenders....wish I could come here more often!
author: Jessica R.

description: The drinks are freaking expensive as hell. You know where you're at when you're buying beverages here. I like the chill vibes and low-key music, but I'm not paying that much for drinks again anytime soon. The place is also tiny.
author: Danny C.

description:
I've scanned through all of the reviews and I just don't see how people can say that they've received good service here. I've been to Sugar Lounge a handful of times, and without fail, my friends and I have received terrible, terrible service. I'm not kidding myself, we go out often and are polite customers, and I'm always patient, but these bartenders have straight up ignored us on multiple occasions even while sitting at the bar. I saw some major eye-rolly attitude thrown at my friend last night while he waited EVER so patiently for a Chimay when he asked her, after ten minutes of standing there quietly and her making no effort to pop a damn cap off a bottle, where his damn beer was.

I'm also not a huge fan of the crowd that Sugar attracts... there's a scammy vibe to the dudes that frequent this place. It's also time to lose the Christmas decor, unless... they always have ornaments hanging off of the ceiling.

All said and done, okay, Sugar, I don't like you and you don't like me even though we've tried. Luckily Two Sisters Bar and Books is just up the street and more than happy to take my money with their friendly service and cool atmosphere. I'm fine with this amicable breakup, you must not know 'bout me.
author: Lisa P.

description:
Great place for happy hour.  With their daily $5 specials and free appetizers, I don't see why you wouldn't have a good time here without spending a fortune.  By free appetizers, I mean it's FREE.  They offer chicken teriyaki, caprese salad, tempura, egg rolls, veggie sticks, as well as chips and salsa.  They don't taste bad either.  

I like their watermelon margarita and french kiss.  Drinks are pretty strong, and if you come here at night, prices are fairly cheap too.
author: Nancy S.

description:
Date: Friday night 630pm ish
Food: korean style sushi, chips and salsa, veggie tempura, chicken wings, carrots and celery
Drinks: discounts on virtually everything. I stuck with beer because the drinks were super sugar- thus the name
Seating: harder to come by after 7pm
author: Skye W.

description:
Sugar lounge is so sweet that I feel like I have a cavity the second I step in. It's like I'm in Ms. Elle Woods' bachelorette party lounge. Pink, feminine, cute (at least as cute as bars can be) and filled with the sugariest & sweetest concoctions known to man. 

Unfortunately these concoctions aren't the tastiest - they are just simply filled with sucrose. In fact, most of the cocktails start tasting the same after a while considering they all share one key attribute - copious amounts of sugar. 

Also the bartenders tend to have a lot of attitude. And I don't mean the good kind of sassy and vivacious attitude. I mean the insolent and overtly cheeky kind. 

Yet I still give this place 3 stars because it makes for a prime girls night out spot with great music selection and average relatively fancy cocktails. So come here for the "experience" as opposed to the so-called artisan drinks.
author: Priya S.

description: Stopped by sugar late last night for a night cap, I have been into this bar before when it was jam packed but last night was very quiet, only a few people at the bar. I was extremely disappointed in the bartenders and how they chose to handle a situation between three drunk men and some girls whom were minding their own business.  The men at the bar began verbally attacking the women sitting in the lounge yelling at them and calling them names after the women showed no interest in their attempts to come on to them. The women looked uncomfortable and upset as the men at the bar continued  to talk nasty to them. The bartenders who were girls just sat and watched the whole thing, I believe they cut the guys off from drinks but continued to allow the nasty behavior without saying anything to the men or grabbing a bouncer ( who was no were in site till end of the night) as someone who works in the industry I can't believe this was allowed, I personally would never let people stay in my bar who were acting so inappropriate especially when it's men verbally abusing women, not cool. I would suggest giving the bartenders better training in making sure the environment is safe, the girls left upset and still getting yelled at by the men and I'm sure took their business elsewhere. I almost got up and got involved since no one else seemed to be doing anything but the ladies ended up leaving and so did we, no longer wanting to be there and went elsewhere as well.
author: Mary R.

description: Went to sugar late night on a Friday with two of my girlfriends because we had gotten off work late.  I have been to this place couple times before but this time was absolutely horrible. There were three of us and the second we walked in the drunk guys in the bar were cat calling,  I had no problem with that considering it was late, but when we did not reciprocate their advances they stared being super rude and mean to us. My friend's and I are all bartenders in the city and also happen to be professionally fight trained, we did not fight with them but not only did these young men provoke a fight with three wemon but the five bartenders and the bouncer did nothing to stop it.  We eventually ended up leaving and going somewhere else but as a bartender myself I literally couldn't believe that the bartenders would do nothing to stop men from verbally attacking wemon in their bar... Very disappointed.
author: Ainsley R.

description:
Happy Hours Drinks and Free Appetizers! (Chicken Teriyaki, Shrimp/Veg Tempura, Egg Rolls, Chips with Guac/Salsa, etc...

Comfortable crouches

Bartenders is super friendly - brought out drinks to our crouch

Great music (Top 40's Hip Hop/R&B)

Great place for dates
author: DVS A.

description: Tasteless drinks and bartenders have massive attitudes. If you work at a bar "yes bar", at least act like you care, when people are paying for overpriced tasteless drinks.
author: Bryan J.

description:
I had been trying to check out this place for a bit and finally went for happy hour a few weeks back. It gets very packed because the drinks are quite cheap during happy hour and they also serve some bar food for free.  If you want to try some of the food, make sure to get there early or you won't get any.  Some people serve themselves like it is their last meal. 

The bartenders were super sweet and make good drinks. The crowd ranged from hipsters to FiDi types... a bit of everything. They have nice seating areas, that is if you get a spot to sit. 

The music was pretty cool, although I can't remember what it was... perhaps 80s. It is a nice place to go with a larger group. I won't go out of my way to go back, there are just lots of other places to explore and it didn't get my attention in that special way. I am just not a huge fan of the sweet drinks... and well, it is called Sugar Lounge. :)
author: Amelia M.

description: Decent space for a 5 dollar happy hour drink.  The strawberry cosmo was ok, I don't like when more than one drink is made at a time, she made all 3 at once, so it was weak and sloppy, with lots of the drink on the base and outside of the glass.  Eh, it's ok.
author: Rebecca H.

description:
I guess I shouldn't be surprised when I walk into a place in Hayes Valley with a couple of friends pre-burning man, and find out that half the people at the bar know Sav.  Should this surprise anyway?  He knows half of nyc and everyone in SF!

haha... this is a cute bar, good drinks, and music.  I think I grabbed a sierra nevada.
author: Sean S.

description: I've been here twice. Once on a weekend, where it was packed and filled with the new snobby douchey money techie types you see in the city, but we still got a good table near the back and had great service by the bartenders. As the name implies, the drinks are sweet and colorful, pretty average prices but big. I went on Valentine's day this weekend, Sunday night and it was very chill, mellow lounge atmosphere, red subdued lighting. Lots of empty tables on Sunday night. I could have done without the sports illustrated models on the two screens distracting my sweet boyfriend (and me, hubba), especially on V-day? But whatevs.
author: Kyrsten B.

description:
As happy hour rolls around, I tend to get very hungry in the midst of kicking back a few drinks. It never fails, my stomach will grumble on schedule about 47 minutes and 16 seconds after the first sip wets my lips. I will be so desperate for food that I have paid entree prices for finger foods...you're welcome bars of San Francisco!

Sugar Lounge is the answer to the questions my stomach asks - free food galore the moment you enter during their happy hour times! There is chicken, tempura, Kimchi fried rice and sushi! Eff-Arr-Yee-Yee! I felt like a kid in a candy store but wait...there is free candy too - I can't help but Snicker! 

They also offer plentiful cocktails in addition to the standard bar offerings, the interior is a bit cramped but I spent the night patrolling the food area a la Paul Blart. There were no hostages for me to rescue so I just saved the sushi from being trashed by allocating them into my mouth.
author: Roy H.

description:
The gentleman I was here with is seriously San Francisco's most wanted by the ladies! Okay, so that's un-related, but I had to say it! We were so drunk already, we checked out like 3 other spots before here, some of which he simply wasn't in the mood for (he's a guy, I swear) and decided here because it wasn't packed.  

So we walk in here and get drinks, and damn, it was totally boring. Totally boring selection. Totally boring crowd. Totally boring. But someone recommended us this spot, so there must be something good here, except we didn't get it. So we left. I forget where to.
author: Alexia R.

description: Free food for happy hour. Need I say more? Make sure you also try their piña colada cocktails. It's a great place to sit and chat with pals. A friend and I went here a few weeks ago after having food and drinks somewhere else. We'll definitely try this place first next time!
author: Teresa G.

description:
Sugar Lounge has a great, chill vibe. I really like the decor -- it's hip and a little on the swanky side. 

I went for their Tuesday happy hour and it wasn't too packed, but there were enough people to show me that it's a pretty popular place. They were playing a really good mix of 80s tunes too.

I ordered their drink special, the watermelon long island iced tea... it was like drinking sweet candy, and extremely alcoholic, and only 5 bucks. Not too shabby.

All and all, I'll probably be back.
author: Jamie P.

description:
Signature Cocktails ($12) - listed on the mirror board on top of the bar.  

Ones we tried - Rusty Ginger, Pisco Revival and I have a champagne cocktail, but completely forgetting it's name. All of them were pretty tasty and in martini glasses. 

Only real downside, besides not a lot of seating, was that there was one bartender, which made it a tad difficult to get a drink quickly. 

Overall...I'll definitely go back to check out some of their awesome happy hour specials. You should give them a try too.
author: Dru M.

description:
5 Stars for the Friday Happy hour that is accompanied with free food!

If you get there early enough, you can enjoy the complimentary quesadillas, chicken teriyaki, chips and salsa, tempura etc.  The previous 2 times they also had vegetarian sushi rolls that were the highlight, but last Friday they did not so that was disappointing.

Drinks are good, the place is cozy.
author: Lisa X.

description:
Fun bar. 

Free appetizers for Happy Hour. Nice little loungy area by the window and by the restrooms (odd??).

Bad bartending-service (slow and not friendly).
author: Helen D.

description:
I have only blacked out twice in my young adult life, and both of those times have been at Sugar Lounge. Within one week of each other. So 5 stars for how STIFF the drinks are and -2 stars for how STIFF the drinks are. 

I definitely remember enjoying the atmosphere. Sugar Lounge has an laid-back ambiance.  The inside is small and intimate with pretty feminine décor: pink walls, handblown glass lights and abstract art hanging on the walls.  

Here's a skewed review of what little I remember about Sugar Lounge on a Friday & Saturday:

-FRIDAY NIGHT: Soft rock plays in the background and is not blaring like other bar/lounges, so it's very easy to hold a conversation. Easily found a spot for a group of 5 on the couches in the front. Drinks were yummy. I believe I had a few Black Widows, one of the signature drinks written on the mirror above the bar. I am, by no means, a lightweight, but a few of those Black Widows were MEAN.

-SATURDAY: There's a live DJ spinning hiphop and old-school classics. Called in a few days before to reserve 2 couches by the DJ for my birthday. No table service or bottle requirement to reserve these sitting areas for 5 stars for that. No dance floor, but we made a makeshift dancefloor between the couches and in front of the DJ. It was HOT. They need to do something about ventilation in there. Thought I was pretty smart to avoid the Black Widows this time, but the Jameson + Ginger still got me.

I hope to check out the happy hour + food one of these days. Hopefully, third time's a charm for me.
author: Monelle A.

description:
5 dollar drink specials all night:  Strawberry Martinis and then White Russians. 

A supremely tasty Old Fashioned and Manhattan. 

Chill atmosphere, a little crowded as the night progressed but hey that's what happens on a Friday when a place is even somewhat good. 

I was glad that we tried the place out, despite the fact I usually avoid joints with the word lounge in them.
author: Emily D.

description: Rad spot that was surprisingly low key. Awesome assortment of drinks and they certainly don't skimp on the alcohol. Good for small groups; not the place for a large gathering.
author: Rudy R.

description:
Fun place in a nice neighborhood.
Nothing really special, it's kind of like any other lounges.
author: Mindy H.

description:
Great Happy Hour. Cheap drinks great bartenders and if your throwing a party they let you have your own mix!

close to home-good spot
author: farah b.

description:
Sugar Lounge is adorable!  The lounge is pink, yet it's a sophisticated, underwhelming, dimly lit pink that won't have the boys running out the door.  Also, if you get there early enough during happy hour there are free hors d'oeuvres!  Select happy hour cocktail of the night is $5.00, well drinks are $5.00, and $3.00 beers. 

I really need to revisit this place because the last time I was here I was pretty drunk and ended up forgetting the capital of Thailand (apparently I was THAT drunk... go Asian Studies major from Cal!).  Story of my life.  Redo soon please.  Pink palace style!
author: Fei L.

description:
Arrived at 6:30 when the happy hour was alive and well in addition to the darkness of the interior quickly overshadowed the sun that was attempting to peak through the windows.  On a busy night, seating can be limited, but the ambiance and vibe of Sugar Lounge will sure to please most.

They have free finger food during happy hour (which gobbled up very quickly by the bar patrons) and any place that does something like this is great in my eyes.  This is definitely a cocktail-ish bar and boy do they make them well!  My only complaint is that the bartenders do take their sweet time taking orders...

With that being said, I'll be sure to make it back to Sugar!
author: Natan O.

description:
We organized a birthday party here on a Saturday night.  We brought in about 50 guests, and this long and narrow space held us (plus around 50 others) quite comfortably.  

The DJ played a danceable mix of hip-hop, though there was really only room for about 20 people on the dance floor.  A minor annoyance was that the music was a bit too loud away from the dance floor, making conversation a strain.

I didn't drink that night, but there seemed to be a consensus that the drinks were good and strong.

All-in-all, it was a good night.
author: Zain K.

description:
Back in 2006 or 2007 forty or fifty of us Yelpers descended upon Sugar for a Destroy Your Liver (DYL) Happy Hour.  The lone bartender was totally unprepared for the three hours that followed.

I decided not to write a review that night, somehow it just didn't seem fair.  But now that I live up the street from the place, I feel uniquely qualified to give an accurate depiction of Sugar Lounge.

It truly is a "grown-up" bar.  The funny thing about Sugar is that you can't really categorize the clientele.  You've got B&T, Hayes Valley freelancers, musicians, food industry, local alcoholics (guilty!), hood rats...seriously, you just never know what kind of people will be there.

On the bright side...the bartenders are Aces and I have my favorites, but I won't say because they're all computer-literate.   

My one insider tip, is this...if you get there before 5:00pm, they often still have shrimp tempura.  Boo-Yah!

And so for now, I'll give Sugar four stars because I don't give A pluses easily, ask any of my exes and because I don't get any cell service here.  It's incredibly maddening!  Sugar- you should consider getting a cell amplifier or something.  If I could send and receive text messages, I'd be able to invite more people to drink with me!
author: R M.

description:
Great service, cool ambience. Strawberry margaritas with fresh stawberrys = win. Good daily drink specials.
probably would be a good place to cut some rug, however, bartender told me that the usual DJ just moved..so sans DJ.
author: Marc Z.

description:
Last call at 11:30 -- more than lame. And horrible bartender.
Beautiful, dimly lit inside, awesome for date night.
author: Jess A.

description:
Wonderful, heaving breasts.  Plush lips.  Eyes to put starlight to shame.  A figure that makes Lombard street look like a laser beam.  Oh, and those legs are gonna walk me right to the promised land - and back again.  Too bad she's stone cold dead.

What makes the heart of a bar, the very life's blood itself, if not the alcohol?  I ordered at least 6 Bombay gin and tonics, the last few even asking if I could get "a little extra", and I kid you not I wasn't even buzzed.  In fact, I felt refreshed and ready to hit the gym.

Refreshed and ready to hit the WHAT?

I asked around and the consensus of those around me was the drink strength ranged from weak to non-existant.  That's just criminal, considering the price of the drinks ($8) and the healthy tips I tend to leave.  No alcohol makes this lounge DOA.

So why the three stars?  Because this place has just about everything else down perfectly.  The decor is dynamite, with a bit of a boudoir feel and comfort to match.  How often do you go to a bar that has throw pillows (clean!) and soft, expansive seating?  Not often.  The lighting is soft and pink without being the typical deep darkness of a bar, so I could see everyone and they all looked great.  The bartenders are both friendly and fast, a winning combination despite the miserable pour strength.

There's free food for happy hour, and it's pretty good.  I was told by a bartender they will be expanding the selection, but there was a little something there for everyone with vegetables, dip, chocolate covered strawberries, some kind of eggroll, and mini-wraps.  Unlike most free foods, there was food available consistantly throughout happy hour, kept warm where required by hotplates.

Dear Sugar Lounge: get the drink pours to be strong pours and two stars await!  Until then, Sugar is destined to be a comfortable place to lounge in after I've spent my money elsewhere, rather than a lounge in which I'd enjoy an evening.
author: Matt H.

description:
This place may or may not have free happy hour food (ie: strawberries, watermelon, tempura, chicken teriyaki, salsa and chips, vegetables, sandwich wraps)

This place may or may not have adorable deco inside.

This place may or may not have very decent happy hour prices.

This place may or may not have a sweet, huge, on point bathroom.

This place may or may not have long great couches.

This place may or may not be a low-key, relaxin good time.

This place may or may not be my new "spot..."

Um. Yeah.
author: Jessica T.

description:
I'm embarrassed to say that I frequent this place. However, the only reason I ever come here is because it's a block from my work and there aren't that many options in Hayes Valley for happy hour. 

The drinks are pretty meh but the worst part about this bar is that it smells like cheap food. They serve random snacks at happy hour so when you walk in you're slammed with smelly snacks. Not rad. 

I'm also not a huge fan of the giant lit up retainers on the wall. I know they aren't retainers but they totally look like 'em. 

I suggest you keep on walkin' unless you are out of options.
author: Alli J.

description:
The review I'm about to post below had been taken primarily from scribbles on cocktail napkins, because I knew I was going to get too wasted to remember. I've got ESPN like that. 

So my friend Kiki and I walked from Civic Center BART to the Sugar Lounge, as I was calming off my slight buzz and mild depression. By the end of the night, I didn't have a care in the world! (except where I was going to puke it all back up, since I was taking BART home). 

The outside was simple; lights, neon-lit sign spelling Sugar in sweet, sweet cursive. Walk in, and it was just...cool. I got that "I can dig it" vibe, and a smile was on my face in no time. We sat at the bar and said "let's be adventureous and try their drink specials". At first, I didn't really want to drink much--I already got super buzzed that day (its what happens when you're my weight and haven't eaten in two days..after only 2 beers). But you only live once, and I just got my paycheck, so what the hell. 

Breanna, our bartender, was just super AWESOME! She mentioned two drink specials that weren't on the menu, and those were the ones we went with. Kiki got a whiskey and coke, even though she gets a little frisky when she drinks it and I was feeling anything but that, and I got the drink, as I coined it--a Breannatini. It had tuaca french liqueur, mandarin organe vodka, vanilla vodka, splash of sweet & sour and pomegranete juice. Garnished with a lemon and sugar rim, omg was that tasty.

Wait--I'm a little hungover, still. That was the second drink. The first one I wrote down on a napkin seemed to have slipped off the table in my drunken stupor, DAMMIT! Just tell Breanna that the girl who called it a Breannatini with the cranberry sugar rim, said to get it. She'll know what you're talking about.

Both of them, ah man. She even took some frozen blackberries and put them in my drink. Didn't do anything for the flavor, but its the perfect ending to a good drink--some alcohol flavored fresh fruit. Yum!!!!!!!!!

I decided I was going to start mentioning bathrooms at places, after my blissful experience at Jimisan with the smelling good and all that. Theirs had a full length mirror. Not good for drunk panda. I had to leave or else I would have started dancing. It was decorated nicely, though, I will admit. 

My third and last drink of the night I believe was on the house--a Mint Chocolate Chip Martini. If you drink more than two sugary drinks, please, please avoid drinking this third one at all costs. I love Breanna for giving it to me, as the "dessert" course to our "meal", but it tasted better going down than coming back up. 

If you want to have the best martini ever, you would do yourself a favor and come here. Just remember--sugary drinks makey for talkin to a guy named ralph later on. Tread lightly. Thats my warning to you.
author: Jaime L.

description:
Sugar...
Oh Honey, Honey 
You are my candy girl, 
...and you got me wanting you. 
Honey, 
Oh Sugar, Sugar
You are my candy girl 
...and you got me wanting you. 

Whether you like Betty or Veronica, it's rather a moot point here since one of the pretty girls you'll see tending bar is ...Farrah. OK, I don't know if her name is Farrah, but the familiar tousled, airborne hairdo is back. Funny thing is I can't tell if they are deliberately going for a retro-1970's thing in this bar. Or maybe just an LA vibe with a pitstop at Vegas...though I think they crash-landed near Bakersfield by mistake.

It's dark in here with their happy hour appetizers clinging precariously against the long wall. They get brownie points for offering white chocolate-covered strawberries and tempura, and of course, standard bar fare like crudite with ranch dip and boneless hot wings. Seating areas are certainly a premium. Best deal is the $3 Beer during happy hour, so I was able to enjoy a couple of Fat Tires without at least monetary regret.

The music does start blaring early, and it sounds like there is a preference for We-Love-David-Hasselhoff Eurotrash-type of music, but I did not stay long enough to critique the music fairly. I have to admit to a trace of bitterness about this place because I have mourned the loss of Hayes and Vine - the previous establishment - for some time now, truly a wonderful memory of a low-key yet classy wine bar. There can never be enough of those in anybody's neighborhood as far as I'm concerned. And if a glass of good red is not available to you, then...

Pour lil sugar on me...oh yeah 
Pour lil sugar on me, honey 
Pour lil sugar on me, baby 
I'm gonna make love so sweet...hey hey hey! (...you go, Veronica, ya slut!)
Pour lil sugar on me, honey.

BAR FOOD/BEER - 3 stars...uhhh ok and a few pleasant surprises at happy hour
AMBIANCE - 2.5 stars...welcome to Bakersfield Vice
SERVICE - 3 stars...Charlie's Angels return...where's the smart one?
TOTAL - 3 stars...cheap drinks...'nuff said
author: Ed U.

description:
Bartender she's awesome...... she sure knows how to make good drinks! 
One of my girlfriends also hosted her engagement party here and the lounge set it all up and they even made a special drink for the occasion. It's a cute bar and I'd def comeback. They even have a great happy hour.
author: Irma R.

description:
No dress code and no cover.

The environment and location is great.  The music is great as well, but the place is just all-in-all boring.  I've been out with my friends before on dead nights, but this place is just ridiculous.  Also the bartender just stands in front of you, kind-of rudely, until you order and they make ABOLSUTELY TERRIBLE drinks.  There is barely ANYONE at the bar, I do not understand why he could not take the time to make a decent drink.

At the bar they have some candies in these little shot glasses, but the candies are the cheapo ones that I'd rather not eat anyways.

So if you want a place to just sit and talk.  Then this is the place for you.  But if you actually want to drink and enjoy your night, then there are MANY other bars you can go to with a chill vibe that aren't so terrible (i.e. Jade Lounge, I've always had a great time there).
author: Pia V.

description: Fun fun fun fun. This place is like Willy Wonkas for grown-ups.  Flirty decor, good food, full-on dessert cocktails. (mostly) Cute crowd.
author: Cris T.

description:
Nice looking place with good drinks, but pretty small and super crowded on a weekend night.

Highlights:
- Had a DJ spinning in the back
- Cool glass shell looking lights on the wall
- Nice drink menu
- Lots of van gough vodka flavors
- Leathery like half couches to sit at for the loungey feel
- People in there seemed cool

Lowlights (my flip side to highlights):
- Super small and skinny place
- Because of seating on the side and bar on the other, there was only a small aisle for standing or passing through
- Very crowded on a weekend night so hard to get through to the bar or find a space to hang--almost popular concerty smooshed

I'd come back if I was in a party hardy mood or could come earlier to snag a spot to chill.
author: Eve K.

description:
All you can eat appetizers and drink specials everyday, how can it not get any better than this? 

They served tempura, salsa, chicken teriyaki, lumpias, and veggies snacks all you can eat till it's gone! It's not the best but how else will you be able to drink so much without food?!? 

Parking Is a bit tuff after 6pm on the weekdays and weekends but it's definitely a little gem in the hour. 

Small, cute and the bartenders are absolutely nice! No drinks made there uses premixed ingredients all fresh unless they don't have it then they'll ask you if you want to substitute certain ingredients definitely nice to ask first then make it! 

Loved it!
author: Linh D.

description:
I used to kick it here pretty regularly when I lived in Hayes valley. Friday for happy hour they break out some free hors d'oeuvres and fire up some good drink specials. They had a couple chill gals that worked there who were always happy to shoot the breeze while I started my weekend. 

Last night the staff and vibe hardly resembled the comfortable spot I used to know. Have you ever seen people that couldn't hide their pretentious judgmental attitude to save their lives? Apparently that is a prerequisite to work here nowadays. 

As my friend got his groove on ( on the 8 square foot dance floor) the bartenders were huddled together with noses turned and hips cocked like a couple of 14 year old mall rats completely appalled that anyone would actually dance to the DJ they hired. When it was time to pay I gave them the universal sign for "may I have the check" by miming a pen to paper. I am fairly sure that anyone and everyone knows what motion I am talking about. Either they have never worked in a bar or they were just attempting to up the snotty vibe a notch by pretending not to know what I was communicating. I am going with the latter. The whispering and elbowing each while laughing had me a bit confused as to what the joke was. 

Rolling your eyes, mocking and acting like a stuck up prick is no way to act to your customers. As we left my friend informed me that the girl behind the bar was the owner/manager's daughter. Makes perfect sense.

Just because you work in Hayes valley doesn't mean you have to act like it.
author: Dru P.

description:
Try to stay away when a bartender named Chelsea is there.  Rude, sneaky, and overcharges guests (especially unsuspecting males) for random drinks that were never consumed.

She offers to take a shot with you and your friends and then charges your card double, claiming you are paying for her and 3 other mystery shots.  When my girlfriend asked about the $26 extra charge on the credit card, Chelsea got very argumentative and rude claimed that my girlfriend "should better monitor what her boyfriend drink as obviously he can't remember."

Literally, the worst service experience in San Francisco.

Not a good way to do business, especially with repeat customers.
author: Ian K.

description: Stumbling into Sugar was the best thing I did the other night. Not a whole lot going on in Hayes Valley and this was a fun little spot to drink the night away. Well dressed 30 somethings sip on signature martinis. I thought the drinks were strong and reasonably priced. The DJ was having a ball bringing tunes back from the 90s. Not a lot of sitting room but if you're lucky you may score a sofa where you can people watch in peace. The pink decor couId use some help. It's like hanging out in a room covered in cotton candy.
author: Danielle F.

description:
Stopped in here for a quick drink the other night and it was okay, but nothing to write home about. I like the whole "menu written on the mirror" thing like Bruno's and Harry's, but its so high up even with my glasses on it was hard to see the drinks listed on the sides of the menu. 

It was Wednesday around 8:30 or so and it was not very filled, but everyone was crowded around the bar (which makes sense). The two bartenders however hardly looked up to even acknowledge a new person there and see who was next, and when I finally got one of the girls attention she was so sullen and frown-faced I was a little scared to order. 

I persevered in the name of alcohol and got a pink drink with muddled raspberries which was okay but made me feel sick a little later and my BF got something that I didnt like at all. He liked it but I dont think we will be going out of our way to go back.
author: Alissa C.

description:
Great little spot in Hayes Valley for a drink or two before really hitting the town... Only problem, bad parking (unless you bike, there's plenty of bike parking) and BAD DRINKS! At least the lil lady that poured ours, she made them either too boozy to be drinkable or not boozy enough.

Mojito = too boozy
Martini= not enough!
author: Christopher L.

description:
Met a gentleman there for a happy hour first  date.  Sugar Lounge is perfect for that sort of thing!  The place has a subtle, pink glow.

The bartenders were nice. Very pleasant. The crowd was yammering yuppies  mixed with plastic surgery Opera dames and bohemians. SL had the Giants game on, very smart.

Got there at 5:30 and the free food spread was A+ ! To me it makes sense to eat while you are drinking booze.  Sugar Lounge is very smart to entice me there with free happy hour bites.
 
 Free food in a San Francisco bar ... am I dreaming??  Bar owners, take notes from Sugar Lounge! Throw us patrons gratis grub once in a while!

Even though they were low on hot chicken I give SL five stars.  I am a hot chicken fiend. Next time I will get there at 5:00pm  cause ... I love the idea of free, hot chicken.

The drinks were cheap, tasty and strong,  served in nice glasses.  Two of those bad boys had a sister going back for seconds at the buffet. 


Sugar Lounge you have my vote for Outstanding San Francisco Happy Hour!
author: SF T.

description:
Great happy hour bar. What establishment still puts out free finger food for happy hour. Not just chips and salsa but sushi, veggies and quesadillas. 

Good service and well poured drinks. What else do you need?
author: G R.

description: Randomly walked in on a sunday afternoon and was so pleasantly surprised by the beautifully lit bar, the chill ambiance, the friendly bar tender with some great talent for mixing delicious cocktails and the happy hour prices!!! love it...
author: Nilu r.

description:
Why on Earth did I ever think this place was a dive bar? Sugar is a great little bar in Hayes Valley with friendly bartenders, ample seating, and really good drinks.

The bf and I came in on a Monday for happy hour without knowing their specials. Right off, we saw that there were daily specials that have no time limit: Monday is the peach cosmo. Definitely sweet but just to my liking! The daily specials are $5 which is a steal compared to other cocktails: the bf's Richmond Gimlet which was also very good was $12, a normal SF price but hey, everyone likes a deal.

They also set out free appetizers on the back wall. At first we thought there was a private event going on, but then I realized that everyone was indulging. This is where you ignore the fact that everyone is reaching into the same chip bowl...

I definitely liked Sugar Lounge and plan to come back to try Tuesday's Watermelon Long Island and Friday Margarita! (No not all in one week.)
author: Emilia S.

description: Sugar seems to want to be a dance club but has no dance floor. It also seems to want to be a fancy cocktail lounge, and it DOES have some original cocktails, but they look hit and miss on being good.  The back alcove was the only place that was quiet enough to talk on a recent Friday evening, though I appreciate that the music was kept at a background level. The free food for happy hour is good and the decor is pretty classy. With a little more focus (and some acoustic dampening tiles), it could be a great place to hang out after work.
author: Bill B.

description:
Came here for my BF's friends Bday where she was coerced to take multiple vodka shots and a three wise men that tipped her over to "get yo freak on" and "I don't care who's watchin~watchin~watchiiinn~~" mode.  It's a nice, small lounge with lots of bar seating and couches on both ends of the bar.  They had tiered trays on the bar filled with chocolate kisses, which I thought was very cute and appropriate :)  The DJ that night was chill and even took requests :) ~~ mixed some house and hip hop.  

Ok, so story time...

We had the space at the far end of the lounge reserved so it was nice and comfy.  There was a weird, creepy ass guy standing next to our section at the bar...winking and STARING at any and every female that walked past him.  He even had the nerve to put his jacket down on our couch where we were sitting...and gave unnecessary attitude to one of the bday girls' friends...  I guess he worked himself up so much that he blew some major gas on our section ... and the mini dance floor cleared almost immediately.  So, we were sitting on the other side laughing...and the DJ came over to us asking where everybody went...  ohhh....it was the stinksville.

The end.
author: Kat C.

description:
Sugar Lounge is a somewhat run-of-the-mill, generally solid bar, but for one thing. They have a whole buffet at happy hour with free food! It's the best kept secret in town. Want to eat out and also drink cocktails, but you work for a nonprofit and so you need to choose one or the other? 

Go to Sugar Lounge at 5pm and eat a free dinner AND get drinks. They also have nightly drink specials, but in keeping with the bar's name, they're usually pretty sweet and often look like something you may have used as a starter drink when you were 17.
author: Michael B.

description:
I like this place because I'm old and I can't hear as well as I used to and they're really good about keeping the decibels at a level where you and your friends don't have to yell at each other all night and end up leaving with your ears ringing and throat scratching.

Also, the barkeeps noticed I was drinking Guinness like a damn fool that night so I didn't even really need to verbally communicate my drink order to them.  It was all eye contact, thumbs upping, and nods the whole time.

Nice place.  Looking forward to handing over more money to them at a later date.
author: Michelle W.

description:
So I feel like updating my review and give it more stars since recently every time I go to Sugar Lounge for happy hour there's tasty and free finger food (not just on Tuesdays like it used to be), and the new bartender girl is friendly and knows how to pour a healthy glass of wine. The first time I complimented her for the generousp pouring she smiled and said "oh that's how I pour for myself at home". 
I like.
author: Feliz L.

description: A nice little hole in the wall of a place to grab a quick drink. The decor and lighting are relaxing and yet still conversational, but the TVs seem out of place. Very friendly service.
author: Phil C.

description:
Happy hour here is awesome! We had over an hour wait at Suppenkuche so we decided to wait for it at a bar down the street. Sugar is great because their happy hour is cheap and fun, and not crowded like Absynthe. 

We got the glass slipper martini, and that was really good. Beers are like $3 so we got a Blue Moon and something else offered on the special that day. 

Fun and easy going. Atmosphere is nice and chill. Decor is dark and nice as well. The corner lounge seats looked great, but when we went, it was filled with 3 of the most annoying viet girls I've ever heard, and 3 retarded white guys. All were drunk, all were loud...but hey, I had a great time making fun of them with my posse, and we were only there for an hour, so I guess that's ok.
author: Debby L.

description:
Sugar Lounge is a really great spot.  Went to a surprise birthday party there on Saturday.  The crew at SL was accommodating, friendly and fun!

The bartenders make KILLER drinks, the DJ is off the hook and even the bouncer was fun (maybe it was that we shared our food  -they let you bring in your own food!- with him).

Great place for a party or drinks with a friend!
author: Annette G.

description: I've only been hear for the happy hour, but man is it fantastic! Free food? yes please. I was expecting peanuts and pretzels, but they actually had, like, a spread! It's got a great feel and wasn't too loud, but unfortunately it was way too crowded so we left after one drink. I definitely want to come here again.
author: Sonia J.

description: Stopped in for a drink with my date and sat at the bar. Kinda dead for a Saturday night but around 10:30pm people started piling in. I tried the "pussycat" drink and man it was STRONG. The bartenders here are friendly and don't mess around with the drinks. Highly recommend this place for an after dinner cocktail.
author: Katie Anne N.

description: LOVED the Pink Pussycat.  We were there around opening and had great drinks!!  Went back later on a Saturday night.  They were SLAMMED, but the bar back was very helpful about getting us drinks.  The bartender once she saw we were there earlier made an extra effort to get us drinks!  Defiantly will be back when we are in the City again.  And of course, you can't beat the bar top.
author: Teri F.

description:
Good location if you need a drink after a show/ballet/etc. at the Opera House. It's kitty corner to Absinthe, so also a good spot to catch a pre-drink if you're early for a reservation. 

It looks like they sometimes have food goodies to munch on, but sadly nothing on the Saturday afternoon we stopped in. We had just finished a performance at the Opera House and had some time to kill and I found Sugar Lounge on my Yelp app. Our group wanted bites on drinks, so we trucked it on over. As I mentioned, unfortunately no munchies to be provided that day, but I didn't want to be that group that walked in, stood there figuring out what to do for 10 minutes then leave without ordering anything, so I ordered my usual - a Manhattan. 

Manhattan was decent - not the best, not the worst. The pour was rather hearty though. (Me likey.) 

Service was quick, but without a smile... at all. Meh... maybe the groups uncertainty left a sour taste in the bartender's mouth. Oh well. 

Good location. 
Mediocre, yet stiff drinks. (Nice selection though.) 
Blasé service... 

In a city with sooo much to offer in regards to bars and lounges, I wouldn't go out of my way to visit again, but I wouldn't be against it either.
author: Kris I.

description: LOVE this place.  Its cozy and swanky.  You can get premium cocktails for regular 10 ish bucks a drink... or they have one signature cocktail on special every night.  Last night was the pomegranite martini.... this was AMAZING!  The bartender was super fun and friendly.  Also they have snacks.. candy, chips and guac and salsa, chicken, and asian h'ourdourves for happy hour.  SOO above and beyond normal expectations.  Happy hour drink specials are unsurpassed!
author: Julie B.

description: Decent, nice, and yuppie-ish bar and lounge that's very Hayes Valley. I came here after my cousin's wedding with the bride and groom and a few other cousins and family friends. We were extremely drunk post-reception by the time we got here, but we snagged the back room and kept drinking and bonding. Good beers on tap, decent music, mixed and eclectic crowd... this is the kind of place that proves even if the yuppiest of bars, you'll still meet some weirdos and freaks in SF. Which is a wonderful thing indeed.
author: Seth G.

description: It's 4pm on a Sat. You've just finished watching a matinee show and want a drink. It's that awkward hour where lots of places don't open till 5pm. We spent about  30 minutes shuffling cars to adjust to whatever crazy parking restrictions and browsing Yelp on various iPhones exploring our options. Like magic, we happened to be across the street from Sugar right as the place opened. We lavished in having the whole place ro ourselves, spreading out along the couch and the surprisingly comfortable little stools around the coffee tables. They know how to make a strong drink and that's the kind of sugar I want in a beverage. Highly enjoyable spot to have a drink. I'd definitely return even though I'd probably have to share the place with other patrons next time.
author: Megan K.

description:
this is kind of just an average bar overall, in a cute neighborhood, nothing really remarkable either way. But...

Get there early for happy hour and it's a 4-star for sure. I went at 5:30 with a friend and got chips and salsa, tempura, lumpia, and more... for free. FREE! Seriously, nothing beats decent free food, I'm sorry. We got seats on a comfortable couch here as well. It wasn't overly crowded and I felt really comfortable there.

In terms of drinks, HH prices for wells and beer are okay, but I wanted a margarita so I got one for $5. Which isn't expensive, but isn't a HH price. However, I was solidly buzzed off the one (big glass!) so totally worth it. 

If I'm in Hayes Valley early during happy hour time, I'm there for sure.
author: Courtney A.

description:
They close at 12 on week nights. Boo. The drinks are alright, and the bartender is very friendly.

I can't really rant or rave about this place at all. Came here for drinks with a couple of friends. We ended up going to Rye afterward because they were closing early on a Thursday night. I don't know why.
author: Alyssa G.

description:
I have been to this bar about 10 times in the last 3 months, it is one of my girlfriend's go to spots...but not after my last experience.  I went to Sugar with a friend and it was probably my worst bar experience to date (even beyond SF).  The woman who was working (she had dark hair and was a little bit chubby) was foul and needed to get slapped, several times!

We ordered two peach cosmos (which is my fav drink here) from her and she literally made enough for one cocktail and divided it between the two of us, we both had about half of our glasses full.  It was not tasty at all.  My friend opened a tab with his credit card.

We chatted and then went up for another round, which I gave my credit card for, and chose to order different drinks since our previous drinks were disgusting.  Unfortunately, the lady took our drink orders again and although she filled the glasses this time, we both only drank half of the drinks because they were also gross.  So we decide to close out our tabs, but the woman lost my friend's debt card.  She was SO rude and told him he didn't give it to her and that he needed to check his pockets.  She then came out with a flashlight and said, "let me look on the floor to see if YOU dropped it."  He called the next day to talk to the manager and they apologized and said the girl was "confused."  I think that means he should get a free drink, considering he has to come all the way back there for his card...just my two cents!

Some might think 1 star is harsh, especially since this is one experience out of several, but you shouldn't give someone half a drink, you should be able to make the drink appropriately if you are a paid bartender, and you shouldn't lose a customer's debt card and then accuse him of not giving it to you (i.e., don't be a douche).

In sum, this place sucks!
author: Kevin M.

description: Its a fancy dive bar!.. Meaning it has fancy drinks, great lighting and just the right amount of "dive" to keep me comfortable.
author: Jenise C.

description:
Eh, not really a fan. Sure, they have decent prices at happy hour but don't mistakenly order one of the specialty drinks that aren't on HH or else you'll get a $12 sugary surprise! Ok, to be fair it wasn't a horrible drink but definitely not worth the $12.

Another gripe, I just don't like the layout of the space. 6pm on a sunny Friday afternoon and the back half of the bar was way too dark. Maybe my experience would have been different if we were able to snag some space up front?

Also, the happy hour food was kind of a joke. Either go all in and put out a respectable spread (ala Lion Pub) or don't even bother. Sorry but raw carrots and overly salty Costco tortilla chips do not a happy hour make.

Two stars because the bartender was really busting his ass and never stopped smiling. My quest for a decent happy hour spot continues...
author: phil h.

description: Dropped in for drinks and snippet of the niners game before heading out for a music festival, my gal pal and I LOVED this place. This bar looks like it was given a 24-hour makeover by a bunch of sorority girls, with a $2000 budget: everything is glittery and pink, but very clean and classy. Our bartender was this sweet girl who gossiped with us about cute Giants players and served up a delicious gin drink (will update with name later).  I also liked that if you are a decent human being and order a drink, you can help yourself to snacks that are just chillin' out there. I had some chips and salsa, at 11am. Like, totally, fabulous.
author: Rina M.

description: Happy to have stumbled upon this fun bar. Great cocktails, bartenders are very friendly, and awesome atmosphere. I came here on a Friday night and the music was very fun. I was with a big group and  we made the back a mini dance floor. It's nice to get away from the usual bars and try somewhere new like Sugar Lounge. The bar lured in people and was very happening. I liked the turntable in the back, artwork, and the back lit wood bar stocked with top-shelf liquors. Definitely going to check out their weekday happy hours with free hors d' oeuvres!
author: Stephanie M.

description:
Good cocktail selection and they're tasty and well made, but the staff is snobby and not very attentive.

The crowd here isn't the best - it's kind of a random hodgepodge of people...so don't go expecting to strike up a good conversation with a stranger.

But it's a solid option to go with a group of friends for good drinks.
author: Lina L.

description:
I'm a big drinker..the stronger the better, if it's fruity and lovely -  more points to ya! The cocktails @ Sugar incorporated all of these aspects therefore I applaud them. No crazy ingredients, nothing too fancy, just a solid 15 drink selection.

Drinks were well made but why was the female bartender such a bitch?! Yea i said it...when you are working in the service industry - you need to @ least FAKE a smile.

Love the dim lit private room in the back - seats about 5. Grab a few friends and snatch it up ...it creates such a intimate setting and escape from the bitchy bartender haha.

I've been here multiple times with no other complaints. A solid spot in Hayes Valley.
author: Charlene A.

description: I love this bar. It's such a little gem. The drinks are very tasty and the bartenders are  friendly.
author: Lisa M.

description:
Our party had reservations at Absinthe and we were very early.  Our intention was to have a few cocktails at the Absinthe bar but there was barely standing room in there. 

We walked half a block on Hayes and stumbled into Sugar Lounge.  What a great neighborhood bar with very "loungy" seating and a comfortable bar, where we decided to sit.  The bartender was attentive and mixed several excellent drinks for us.  

The next time I am in the area, I plan to return!
author: Phillip D.

description:
Praise  Yelp for that handy-dandy app thingy- turned my frown upside down!

Much to my dismay, Absinthe's bar was above capacity and with a click of a button I was re-directed .2 miles away to Sugar Lounge.

Much to my delight, we were greeted by a heavy curtain parting ways to reveal a long wooden bar, ample couch seating, stellar drink menu, and FREE APPETIZERS (veggie tray, chips/salsa, some kind of chicken, and quesadillas)!

The bartender was beyond patient with our group of indecisive females.

Good vibe, good prices, good service- date spot, girls night, guys night (although no tv screens), solo night...this lounge definitely fits any agenda!
author: Gabrielle J.

description: Sugar Lounge has a nice warm, cozy ambiance. I find that smaller places like this are boatloads of fun when it comes to breaking in those dancing shoes. It also helps when the bartenders know how to mix a fine cocktail. Sugar Lounge has got it going on, but in this grand city these bars are a dime a dozen. If I'm in the neighborhood, I just might find myself within the Sugar Lounge walls. However, it's not worth venturing over the hill and through the woods when the hill and woods have plenty of similar joints.
author: Jaime L.

description:
As forensics laws would dictate, most criminals return to the scene of their crimes. 

This might explain why I chose to return to the scene of company bonding in the way of fernet-shot drinking, purse-stealing, and face-planting a little over a week after the brou-haha.

Mortified by the presence of the same bartender of said tom-foolery, I instructed my friends to buy my drinks while I cowered in the lounge area. Alas, the bar is too small, and my presence too magnificent -- or so I've been told -- to be obstructed and I rather made eye contact with the bartender, rather sheepishly, who returned my awkwardness with a well-punctuated wink. 

Happily, I was able to enjoy a  few refreshingly delicious basil gimlets with some old friends but walk out on two feet. Good times!
author: Suzanne R.

description: Very strong, very inventive drinks. Our bartender Brenna was friendly and made very yummy cocktails. It's a little pricey to go there often, but I will be back.
author: Mark S.

description: It's a cool place to chill and there's lots of couches.  Happy hour goes until 7:30pm, the cocktails are good, and the bartenders are really friendly.
author: Matthew P.

description: Came here for happy hour yesterday (Tuesday).  Happy hour goes from 4:30-7:30pm on weekdays, and supposedly all day Sunday too!  They offer $3 beers, $4 wells, and have one specialty cocktail for $5 each day.  But the best part is the small buffet of free food!  They had a veggie platter, chips & salsa, a gingery version of teriyaki chicken (this was the best food item), veggie tempura and tempura shrimp, and spring rolls.  We arrived at 5:30pm and the food was barely touched, however, by 6:15pm only the chips and salsa were left.  So if you want to take advantage of the food, get there early!  I also appreciate that they keep the music volume low so you can actually carry on a conversation without having to yell at the person sitting next to you.  I'd definitely return!
author: Beatrice W.

description: I went to a private party at the Sugar Lounge.  Fantastic experience!  Tons of appetizers, the drinks were great, and at 10:00 the dj arrived , music got louder and the dancing started.  I'd recommend it for a private party definately!   We packed in the place, but they kept up with the drinks and clean up.  Even cleaned up the cake/paper products from the birthday celebration.  Intimate but still room to dance if you have a dancing crowd.  Great for private parties!!!
author: J C.

description: I went here a few years ago but I was just telling a friend about it and realized i should yelp it! we went in there while we were waiting for a table at Sebo and got in really fast. We weren't able to stay long as our table opened up. But a  very fun place! If i lived closer i can totally see this being a spot  for a girls night!
author: Kate H.

description: Cute ambiance. The seductive red lighting makes it great for a date. I'd say this place is horrible for meeting people as it tends to be quite empty.
author: Kathy S.

description:
A friend rented this lounge our on a Friday night to celebrate his birthday. I liked this place a lot.  It's narrow and small with couches and a dance floor in the back. Essentially it was the perfect venue for the amount of people. 

The drinks are STRONG. Wow. The Martini glasses are huge so you get your moneys worth. Well actually since it was open bar I have no idea how much anything was. Besides strong drinks they were also good drinks.
author: Natalie S.

description:
Went to Sugar Lounge on Thursday night after samurai exhibit at Asian Art Museum.  It was really busy when we got there at 7 (still hopping for Happy Hour...$3 beer/$4 well drinks), so we had to wait about 10 minutes just to order our drink.  However, when we did get them, they were tasty!

I had the French Martini with Grey Goose, Cointreau, and pineapple juice.  There was "sugar" around the rim, which tasted good, but ran down the side of the glass in sticky rivulets (probably because they ran out of martini glasses and our glasses were sweating).  It tasted delicious, but it wasn't just a sweet concoction.  It actually had alcohol in it with a kick!  

I was a fun and lively crowd and a comfortable space, but it didn't have much seating.  I'm looking forward to trying it again when we have more time and can get there a little earlier before it gets so crowded.  It would be nice to sit in the front by the window and just hang out and try the different martinis!
author: Kimberly B.

description: Sometimes it's worth giving things a second chance.  Was at Sugar a few months ago and probably had the worst Old Fashioned of my life.  Yesterday went back and Bridget made me a "new" Old Fashioned and it was tasty.  A little sweeter than I'm used to but good flavor.
author: Jen C.

description:
I think Sugar Lounge has earned itself a tie with Kennedy's Curry as the best happy hour in the city.  Sure, it's 4:30-6:30pm happy hour with $3 beers may seem mediocre at best, but there is more to it... they have a wall full of freshly prepared food for happy hour! 

Mind you, these are not your shitty trail mix or salty nuts, but rather endless deep fried foods.  It ranges from the healthy veggie platter and teriyaki chicken to a cornucopia of fried delights such as lumpia and tempura shrimp.  I'm bringing a bum or two with me here next time!
author: Joey S.

description:
Nice space.  Not too crowded, nice space in front and rear with lounge area and tables.  A seated bar and a standing bar opposite.  Hot hors d'oeuvres are a nice tough.  OK, maybe not exactly hors d'oeuvres, but at least they're hot and a notch above popcorn or pretzels.

Drinks are reasonable, staff is great, and the whiskey selection is above average.
author: Ken B.

description: First & probably last time I will come here.  We got to Sugar about 10ish.  Went in & it looked like a cool place.  The guys ordered a few drinks & we found a seat in the front of the lounge next to the window which was cool.....once we sat down & started to get situated we noticed the music the dj was playing.....which was no bueno!!!  Went from rock to hip hop to pop......killed it the whole scene and I know we weren't the only ones feeling it cause people were leaving like no ones business.  The guys finished their drinks & we bolted out the door too.
author: Natacha M.

description:
Sugar Lounge definitely hit the sweet spot! A lovely lounge bar in Hayes Valley that is spacious with warm decor (without being too pretentious), comfortable couches, and adequate tables and bar stools. By far, one of the cleanest bar bathrooms, too! The vibe here is totally chill with friendly patrons, and even friendlier bartender(s). Great selection of wines, with some draft beers, champagne, and lots of special sweet mixed cocktails. Couldn't have picked a better spot  for a Sugary Sweet Swap UYE last Sunday http://www.yelp.com/events/san-francisco-sugary-sweet-swap!

After a macaron crawl (Miette, La Boulange, and Paulette's), Patty and I parked ourselves at the front tables, awaiting the other sweet tooths. The bartender (whose name escapes me- so sorry, please forgive me) was super friendly and sweet, by allowing us to use the refrigerator for the chocolate covered strawberries that Patty made, and freezer for the Humphrey Slocombe ice cream that Alex brought. She even offered us plates and forks (without us having to ask)! When everyone arrived, as "Eight is Enough" (Nicole, Patty, Ana, Alex, Heidi, Tatyana, Kevin, and myself), we nibbled on Strawberry Shortcake, Chocolate Covered Strawberries, Rum Balls, Chocolate Covered Toffee, Oatmeal and Regular Chocolate Chip Cookies, Banana Bread, and Humphrey Slocombe Ice Cream (Secret Breakfast, Blue Bottle Vietnamese coffee, and Guinness Gingerbread)! 
We washed the sugary sweets with (of course) sugary drinks. Some had wine, and others had the specialty drinks/martinis. I forgot the name of my exact drink, but it had Mango (and that was the selling point for this Mango Freak)! It was super strong and kind of hit a few of us like a Long Island Iced Tea would. Regardless, can you say Massive Sugar Overload? 

Our bartender rocked, and she cleared the tables after every sweets round. We offered her and other bar patrons some of the cookies and sweets, which were much appreciated. When we thought our sugar fix was filled, our awesome bartender gave us a round of shots that tasted like a Lemon Dreamsicle (think Lemon Drop but with a hint of cream). 
There was definitely a whole lot of sugar high and buzzing going on!

*Special thanks to the Eight for RSVPing, attending, and bringing their sugary sweets! Hope you guys had as much fun as I did. Thanks for making the first UYE organized by Patty and myself a successful one.  

Sugar Lounge is truly a gem! Great lounge bar with a chill vibe, and awesome bartender(s)! Without a doubt, I'll be back at Sugar Lounge!
author: Gill C.

description:
[Weekday review] Great cocktails and tasteful music at perfect decibel levels to have a good chat with friends. Love the ambiance. Cozy.
 
[Weekend review] Come here for the second-stop-of-the-night: The one where it's mainly about getting more alcohol into your system than getting to know your peers. Lively (meaning: loud)!
author: Janett R.

description: As everyone says, the cocktails are good. I've never made it to their happy hour (which is supposedly great), so I'd like to try it one time. Beyond that, there's nothing really notable for me to say about this place. The crowd is a sometimes-weird mix of people, and I don't really know what vibe they're going for beyond "pink".
author: Geena B.

description:
Great DJ spinning every dance song I loved in high school.  The Ginger Bee was pretty good, but, could not compare to my first 2 drinks at The Orbit Room.

Walking in we thought the crowd was 100% dushy (read: Yuppies). But, as we all sweat and grinned to the tunes we had a great time.
author: Miriam S.

description: Had drinks with friends here the other day.  Cool vibe and look.  Bartenders were fun.  Drinks were excellent, no shitty watered-down, sugared up Kool Aid.
author: Kevin M.

description:
When my friend Gill G. sent out a UYE for a sugar sweet swap at the Sugar Lounge (http://www.yelp.com/events/san-francisco-sugary-sweet-swap) I was sooooo in!  So I prepared my sweet to bring - very traditional chocolate chip cookies just like Nana used to make and off I went!  Well off Kevin N and I went - we were green and decided to carpool.

So we arrived at the Sugar Lounge on one of the hottest days of the year so far - I mean it was hot as in 93 degrees outside!  But as we walked in this place was for sure cool.  I love the colors and the great lighting!!  So we saw our group and everyone was enjoying the sweets!!  After a few yummy tastes I walked up to the bar to order my first drink.

I am like Gill G and can't remember the name exactly - it was like a Pomma Ice tea with Mango and let me just tell you that one drink had me tipsy....the bartender was wonderful, friendly and so helpful.  She actually made the event so much more fun with her fun attitude and even cleared away trash from our table!  Thank you!  

I am planning to come back to this spot again for sure - wonderful service and a very fun place to have a few drinks and relax!  Plus it's in my old Hood - how can you not love Hayes Valley!!
author: Heidi S.

description:
Small little bar dying to establish itself as a lounge.  The only lounge part of this place were their sofa chairs and couches.  

Very attentive bar and the resident mixologists knew how to fix you up.  If you're unsure what to order, just look up at the wall and you'll see what drinks they can concoct for you.    

I also noticed turntables with an ipod attached.  Where's the dj?  Eh, who needs him when you got a trophy girl that knows how to entertain.

Final words, this place saved my wallet from breaking.  Good mix of crowd.  Just a little too small.  I'd come back if I'm staying at the Hotel Whitcomb again. 3.5 stars as it wasn't so special, just your average bar.
author: Mikey S.

description: Chill spot for after work. Free food, cheap yummy drinks. I would come back!
author: gabby m.

description: Hmmm, how did I not know about this place?  It's walking distance from work which makes it a great happy hour spot.  They have free (hot) bar food (I didn't taste it, but my friends liked it), the drinks were well poured, the crowd was fun, and I like the decor.  My only complaint is that they could have used another bartender, it took a while to get a drink.
author: Tonie C.

description: Initially I didn't think much of the spot--really packed and barely a dancing floor.  Fortunately as the night went on, it cleared up some.  I'd have to say the DJ was pretty good here--a good mix of remixed oldies and current/not so current hip hop.  Would come back if I were in the area, but wouldn't make a special trip.
author: Christopher W.

description:
4:30 - 7:30 Happy Hour! 

Any place that has a happy hour until after 7 automatically gets a big star point in my book. Why then am I giving this place only 3 stars? The happy hour drink specials are not very exciting. $3 beer and $4 well drinks. None of the special fun cocktails like my favorite, pomo lolita, is discounted. Even a more straightforward drink like Malibu sunrise cost $8 bucks. Although the price wasn't all that attractive, every drink I had was DELICIOUS! Top notch quality.  Plus 1 star. $4 LEMON DROP is the best deal for a fun drink here. However, minus one star for having no wine specials. :( I like wine just as much as I like beer and cocktails and I love to mix things up. (Dangerous, I know!)

The highlight of Sugar Lounge's happy hour specials is not the drinks but the free food!!! We got here a little before 6, and most of the good stuff was gone. I walked in, went straight for the buffet, and shamelessly cleaned out the hot food items which included teriyaki flavored chicken bites and super spicy jalapeno grilled cheese sandwiches. I also loaded my plate up with fresh fruits and passed on the chips and salsa. Fruits they serve here are actually quite fresh and not yucky or mushy which you may expect from free food. Thank you, Sugar Lounge. 

So, if I like the buffet deal so much, why am I giving this place 3 stars? I like eating while I drink continuously. After the buffet was done, no food was available. This place doesn't serve food as part of their regular menu. This means that when the buffet is done, it's time for us to relocate to another bar that has more substantial food or a restaurant, which is exactly what we did. You could have kept us here and made loads of money, if you served food. A bar without food is not a place I can spend too much time in.

It's very dark here, so you can easily loose track of time. It's a fun place with fun drinks. If my friends wanted to come back to hang out, I would not be opposed to it.
author: Su K.

description:
Well...I met a few people at this venue yesterday for a social event. Although the lighting was great, and the music was excellent, this place soon turned out not to be my cup of tea.

You see, unless you are a cute girl or a group of loud cute girls, the bartenders won't pay attention to you. While I was there, the two bartenders on duty  (male and female) had a hard time making eye contact with those who wanted to order drinks that weren't cute ladies (they weren't busy at all-if they were...I would have understood), and were too consumed with flirting with each other or kicking it to the music.

Second, the bathroom at this venue (during my visit) was absolutely gross. This second issue was the deal breaker for me, and I absolutely lost my appetite. I do not recommend eating here because, to me, if a bathroom is filthy, well...the kitchen area must be equally gross. If you want to enjoy drinks, then...go for it (the alcohol should kill any micro organisms in your drink).

So...if you are an extremely cute girl or a group of extremely loud cute girls that never have to use the bathroom when enjoying drinks...then...I definately recommend this place for you.
author: Darrel D.

description: Overly sugared drinks, not good.
author: Briana B.

description: I can't decide if this place is intentionally tacky or not. There is a decent drink selection and it's priced okay for the area, but the decor makes me feel like I'm in one of Barbie's funhouses. But perhaps that's what they were going for? The crowd seemed off and, as a previous review states, boring. Maybe a bit creepy as well thanks to the older Jersey-shore types hanging around the bartenders. Not the first place that will come to mind if I want a drink in the area.
author: Brittany L.

description:
Adorable inside - interesting 80s/90s music you would expect to hear in a super divey bar - but it works somehow.

We went on a Monday night and the bartender was adorable - she had us try a chili-tequila martini that was delish - we were really happy with their martinis - pomegranate juice yes please!

We're definately coming back for happy hour...
author: Chelsea D.

description:
Warning: their malibu mojitos are dangerously addictive.  I find myself thinking about it at this very moment.  It is by far the sweetest mojito I've tasted in the city.

The place was packed when I strolled in at 11:00 p.m.  Little did I know that it would clear out in 45 minutes, and only our party would be left.

The DJ need to play something besides underground hiphop every once in a while to get people on the dance floor (however small it is).  Nice beats, though.

Happy hour from 4:30-7:30.  Definitely worthy of a return visit.
author: Jenny L.

description:
Now that Jade and their $2.50 happy hour has gone to the big bar in the sky, I find myself at Sugar Lounge a little more often.  M-F hosts a happy hour, starting at 4:30, with $3 beers and free appetizers (most of which are not bad at all, especially for $0).  Sugar Lounge is Jade Bar's classier, grown-up sister who wears a lot of black and pink, likes good music, demands a little more of you, but manages to stay laid-back.  The atmosphere is stylish and dark without being pretentious: good date location!

The specialty cocktails are good ($10) - I have sampled several, and they were all pretty tasty (I'm not really a fan of sweet cocktails, though, so I usually stick to beer).  The bartenders are nice and make a mean drink - there's one pretty and personable brunette girl who was making a delicious-sounding (I was too past-my-limit to try it) apple-pie shot on a recent visit.  (According to my male friend, she smelled good, too.)  Best of all - no credit card minimum!  If you want one $3 beer on your card, by golly, that's what you'll get.

When it gets crowded, it's claustrophobia-inducing, so I recommend going on an off-time - Monday nights and Tuesday afternoons seem to be pleasantly dead.
author: Jennie K.

description: Dark and cozy. Great cocktails. Closes at 1.30 instead of 2 am which is weird but really great sometimes cause that last drink usually doesn't add much anyway...
author: Linn L.

description:
I love this bar. Came in on Friday night at 1030 and it wasn't overly crowded. We were even able to score two seats at the bar to order our drinks.  It is a bit pricy, but I love the ambiance and the loungey feel.  It's dark, they usually have a good DJ, and the drinks are good and strong.  

My favorite part about SUGAR is the couches and the little room in the back near the bathrooms.  There's a curtain, so you can close yourself off from everyone else in the.  It's perfect for having inappropriate photo shoots with your girlfriends or for some romantic quiet time with a date.  I plan on making this  my new spot in HV.
author: Jenny W.

description: I like the interior of this place I really do. They pour the drinks pretty strong here too. They even have hooks under the bar which makes it a classy joint according to one of my old co-workers. It's definitely not as sweet here as the name makes it sound. It turns into a club after nine so be prepared to dress to impress. The specialty drinks sounded tasty but this lightweight decided to stay away from them. Not bad, it certainly didn't hit my sweet tooth.
author: Amy J.

description: This place is so well decorated, the ambiance is sexy, people are good looking, the cocktails are amaze-balls, and the only reason it didn't get 5 stars is because I'm super, duper, mega picky and the bathrooms were so-so.
author: Laura D.

description: Sugar Lounge is like being inside an adorable, red, and juicy maraschino cherry. Having a monster sweet tooth, I stared googly eyed at the menu and picked the Bees Knees (Jameson, Wild Turkey American Honey & Frangelico). It was sweet and strong!
author: Laura F.

description:
The best part about the SUGAR happy hour is the fact that they serve free food. Not a full meal, mind you. But a nice assortment of veggies, fruit, and tempura that will satisfy your pre-drinking hunger. 

The drink selection is what you expect from any SF bar/lounge. HOWEVER, be warned... The bartenders here do not skimp on the alcohol when making a drink. yoza. 

The only downside is that SUGAR can get quite crowded due to its small size. But who needs a seat when you have all that free food to attack!?!?!
author: Black K.

description:
One would expect a bartender to know what drinks their bar serves, just like one would expect anyone to know the basic function of their job. One might even expect them to be able to serve these concoctions with style and flair if the establishment has style and flair.

I do not think this is unreasonable, especially when your bar is trying to be this upscale lounge complete with fancy drinks, a super chic yet comfortable decor (with very cool melded glass light fixtures, worth their own mention), tasty finger food, a DJ spinning ambient music that makes you want to sway and a three tiered candy dish filled with chocolate. Obviously with a place this swank you are paying attention to detail, right? 

Apparently bar tending skill is not on the list of things that you need to pay attention to when running a hip lounge. Sugar, in addition to their many sugary drinks that probably excite a lot of their clientele but do nothing for me, has about 30 scotches on their menu (and a long list of whiskey, tequila, vodka and gin) which makes me feel okay about having to watch a bunch of social climbers drink pink and aqua drinks out of a glass that should be reserved for gin with a splash of vermouth and an olive. 

I decided, last night, to order the Lagavulin 16 year, neat (once the bartender came back in from her smoke break). She had me repeat my order 3 times. At first I thought maybe she liked listening to me speak but then she pulled down a bottle of Laphroaig and asked if 15 year was okay.
