I informed her, with what I am sure was an incredulous look on my face but a kind tone to my voice, that she had not even pulled the same brand I ordered, forget the year. She actually had to ask the bar back to help her identify my order after I had to, for a 4th time, repeat the name and point to it on the menu. 

Then....... the horror!!! She pours it over ice. ICE!!! I thought I was going to lose it, but I kept cool as a cucumber. I told her, in a smooth but assertive way, as the atmosphere dictated, that this is no way to treat a lady or a scotch. So what does she do then? She takes a cocktail strainer and strains it out of the ice into another cup and walks away. 

Sorry, no amount of cool makes up for that, no amount of cool at all.
author: Drue C.

description:
Ended up at Sugar (last night Friday) for one last drinkie before heading home.  The place was comfortable.  They had a ton of free apps (on Fridays) for anyone to nosh on while imbibing.  They looked good.

I didn't want to like Sugar and yes, there is a subtle spendy feel to the decor that seems out of place on Hayes Street but honestly, whenever I've visited, I've enjoyed myself.  It is basically a great neighborhood bar.  Clean bathrooms too.

They always have a DJ that is playing great loungy house music.  Not too loud so you can still chat with your pals.  DJ Dwayne last night was great.  He even came over to say hello to me because I gave him a thumbs up on one of the tracks he played.   I'm a music snob and can easily ditch a place if the music is not great. 

Actually, taking a moment to really think about this review. . .I'll be honest, Sugar has huge heaping bowls of chocolate kisses everywhere.  I'm not kidding, these bowls are grand looking and overflowing with chocolate kisses.  Peanut butter filled, dark chocolate, caramel filled, milk chocolate.  It's no secret that I love chocolate and I love kisses. 

There you go, 4 freakin stars!
ps-Bumped into a good old school SF friend last night.  great to see you Robert!
pps-I'm older so anyplace I go where I don't feel like all the other patrons older sister is cool with me. . . Sugar is one.
author: James M.

description:
I think my ambivalence towards Sugar is partly due to coming on a lazy Tuesday. The crowd was thin, and I was feeling more like throwing back a pint of ale somewhere dark, loud, and kinda sticky. 

Actually, I'm lying. I was feeling more like going to sleep.  And I don't think anything I've ever done to a pint of ale that qualifies as throwing it back. 

I do like a dark, loud, and kinda sticky bar. This kind of bar probably also has a pool table where one of the balls is missing, but you can still play 9 ball if you pretend the 14 is a 4.

Anyway, Sugar is not that bar. You can't even GET a pint at Sugar. Sugar is a very pink cocktail lounge. 

I have nothing against very pink cocktail lounges. But when I'm in a very pink cocktail lounge mood (which, I will admit, is rare), I'm probably not going to go to Hayes Valley. It just strikes me as a little out of place.

Another reason for my ambivalence towards Sugar was that I seem to be out of practice with bars in general, because this happened:

Bartender: What'll it be?
Me: (looks around, disoriented)
Bartender: ...
Me: Uhh...?
McV: Do you have, like... specials? 
Bartender: We have 3 cocktails for $2.
Me: Wheee! (giggles)
Bartender: Blue Hawaiian, Chocolate Raspberry Martini Or Black Cherry Brandy Vodka and Soda.
McV: We'll take one of each!
Me: No, you fool. That is THREE drinks!
McV: Really? 

(It would be super awesome if he had actually interpreted Blue Hawaiian Chocolate Raspberry Martini as one drink. That would be quite a drink indeed)

Me: We would like TWO of them.
Bartender: Which ones?
Me: Uhh... Can I have the Cherry one with Diet Coke?
Bartender: Uhh...
Me: Or is that gross?
Bartender: Uhh...
Me: OH CRAP you mean soda like tonic water, not soda like choose my favorite soda, um, nevermind, I'll just have that one with soda soda. 
McV: What were the drinks again?
Bartender: Blue Hawaiian...
McV: I'll have that!
Me: What's in it?
Bartender: Uhh...
Me: Nevermind, I'll just drink whatever it is.
Bartender: OKAY. I'm going to have to see some ID here.

That's when you KNOW you've fully humiliated yourself.  To be fair, the bartender was a very good sport during this whole disastrous exchange.

The cocktails were ... worth $2 each. (Especially because there were also free Tootsie Rolls and Hershey Kisses at the bar!) 

But even for $2, drinking sweet cocktails in a very pink lounge just isn't as fun as throwing back a pint of ale (okay FINE, daintily sipping a pint of ale) somewhere kinda sticky.
author: Liz G.

description:
What a refreshing experience.....a Happy Hour that is completely free of amateur drinkers. If anyone in this place was under 30-something, then they held themselves to the level that this bar deserves.

Happy Hour is 4:30 until 7:30 with $4.00 well drinks and $3.00 beers. The well is upscale, depending on your drink of choice.....the beers are all bottled and on the premium side (I saw Heineken, Peroni, Blue Moon, etc.). Not bad for 3 bucks!

The bartenders were beautiful and bore a striking resemblence to Paris and Nicole (the hot Nicole, not the Anorexic-looking Nicole.....you know, the one with boobs). It looked at first glance that "The Simple Life - The Bartending Episode" was being filmed. Except these ladies know what they are doing, are slightly better looking.....and they pour a fantastic drink!

I was welcomed immediately, even though I had chose to go "casual" to work, and I was the MOST underdressed person in the place. Even Paris and Nicole were dressed as if they were going dancing at the Starlight Room. 

My drink was strong, even though $4.00 might seem steep for Happy Hour.....their regular drink menu is in the $7-$10 range. This keeps the kids out, I'm sure. Everyone seemed to be mature professionals enjoying normal after-work conversation.....not your typical shot-slamming, beer-bonging frat scene. I love it. When I want to rock out with my cock out, I can choose to go to a bar more suiting that behavior.

Did I mention the FREE appetizers? That's right. FREE. Hot and cold, light and heavy, something for everyone. Get there early for the good stuff.....I've seen tempura prawns and the like.....they do not last as it is "buffet style" and what's there is there.

I like to eat. I really like to drink.

I can take the FREE apps or leave them. I'm coming back for the level of professionalism and intelligence that the customers, and Paris and Nicole, are vibing. Oh.....and the strong drinks.

Here's the breakdown:
1 star for atmosphere.....I felt like a grown up.
1 star for selection.....high end liqours and beers.
1 star for the staff.....these girls make Paris and Nicole look like idiots.
1 star for FREE apps.....ummm, can I say GENIUS?

Don't feel bad kids, they have a DJ who turns it up a notch once the grown ups have all gone to bed.....so come later and don't fuck up my Happy Hour.
author: Big J.

description:
If you have a sweet tooth and are an aspiring alcoholic, this place is for you!

While they have a full bar, they have a select menu of very sugary drinks for you to imbibe.  If you happen to go during happy hour, they also have a small offering of nibbles.  However, prices of drinks aren't really conducive to happy hour drinks.  If you're looking for cheap happy hour drinks, walk 2 blocks down to Jade.

The atmosphere is pretty good at this place.  I can imagine it getting busy at times as it's not that big, but on a Wednesday night before Thanksgiving, our group was the majority in the bar.

I'll definitely be back at this place!  It's close to my house, as well as within close proximity to many good restaurants (Absinthe, Citizen Cake, etc).
author: Melanie N.

description: I usually don't write reviews but I have to say that coming to Sugar Lounge was a very enjoyable experience.  Not only did I love the decor but they have a great happy hour. Loved that it wasn't super crowded like most places so I could easily have a conversation.  The bartenders not only made great drinks but we're attentive.  I will be frequently visiting this bar.
author: Franchesca R.

description:
Do you remember in middle school and high school when every year on the first day of school some nerdy, awkward kid (not THIS nerdy, awkward kid, I knew better) would show up, dressed like one of the cool kids?  He'd proclaim, "Yeah, me too!  Right guys?"  Then the popular kids would smirk, say "Yeah, you too", and proceed to beat the snot out of him for trying to bring his nerdy, awkwardness into their circle?  Well, that's kinda what I think of when I think of Sugar...

The decorating is nice, the seating is comfortable (but limited), the bar is well stocked, organized, and back lit.  In other words, Sugar has the trappings of being a cool bar, but it's so inept that it can't even achieve that.  The DJ played the exact same "tsst, tsst, tsst" beat under EVERY song (and they weren't good songs, either.)  The crowd was self-obsessed and WEIRD (yeah, the two guys sitting next to us arguing who's better Usher or Kanye West would've been GENIUS...if they hadn't been serious.)  One bartender kept the drinks flowin', but the other three spent the night congregated in the corner gossiping and only poured drinks for their friends.

We left after I'd gone up to the bar to order another round of drinks.  The manager wondered up to me, and asked me to dance.  (Turns out, she'd asked all the guys in the room, and I was just the next on the hit list.)  When I said no, she interrupted the conversation of two girls next to me and said, "He doesn't want to dance!"  (Was she trying to embarrass me, or herself?)  Then she said "Well at least buy some jello shots, they're only a dollar!"  Jello shots?  What, am I at a frat party?  No thanks.  Instead of ordering another drink, I paid my tab and we left.

I'll give it two stars because the bar was clean, and because the one bartender that was actually pouring drinks was fast and courteous.
author: Kevin H.

description: We stumbled in here after our dinner and got our little handwritten reserved corner... good drinks but common 300 dollars for ONE bottle of vodka? It's not like we were asking for a handjob as they pour it for us... on top of that the creepy door man with the ponytail who looks like someone from a Hitchcock movie need to stop staring at the ladies... cute bartender 4 stars... creepy door man staring at our ladies' boobies 1 star...
author: Nathan D.

description:
came here last night with my gurl Kimby T and two of her awesome friends. The minute you walk in the place not only dose it feel good but smell great. The music good and the level was not that loud, which was great because then we can hear each others conversation. 

The bartender, she was so nice. She even served us her new receipt cocktail drink it was very good.
Also love the black velvet posters on the bathroom doors.
author: Der Maibaum L.

description: Really small, with a major lack of seating. But, it's super cute and the drinks are delicious! It's definitely the kind of place that I need to arrive earlier to, or for happy hour maybe? I'll definitely be back!
author: Sonya D.

description:
Let it be known that I was a HUGE fan of Hayes and Vine, the long-gone wine bar that used to occupy the Sugar space. The service was friendly, the wine flights interesting, the pate divine.

With that said, I was really looking forward to checking out Sugar. It has a super cute sign that appeals to the girlie-girl in me, and the couple of times I poked my head in, the place looked pretty cute. 

So, when my friend, Javier, and I decided to have a drink in my 'hood, we chose Sugar. It was a Wednesday. Music was bumping. It wasn't too crowded. It looked okay.

That is, until we went to get a drink. We stood at the bar. We smiled. We leaned in... even held out money to show our intention. We even changed our location at the bar to a spot closer to where the bartenders were. The Barbie-blond girls at the service end of the bar turned and looked at us, then returned to their conversation.  I felt like the Julia Roberts character in Pretty Woman when she was snubbed by the bitchy sales women.

After 10 minutes of this, well, you can imagine. We left. 

+1 star for location.
+1 star for ambiance.

- 3 stars for ignoring paying customers and making them feel like invisible, cheap whores.

How does this story end? Well, no need to fret.
We ended up having a lovely time across the street at Absinthe, where we enjoyed their lovely tequila flight, which was served to us within 10 minutes of being seated.  (and our server was handsomely paid for being friendly and prompt!)

Big mistake, Sugar.
BIG mistake.
author: Tiffinie T.

description:
Hayes....at night.  It's good for you. 

Interesting drinks, but more so if you show up after two spots beforehand.  I properly suggest going in this fashion if you are prepared for a big night OR on a second date.  Not that I was on a second date...BUT that's the kind of feel I get.

Think 'Wish' meets 'Anu' but more mellow and subdued with cuter bartender's...ooh-la-la...
author: Yelper A.

description:
This place is mellow.  Lots of civic center people for their happy hour.  

BY THE WAY, when you talk about a bar's happy hour, don't be an asshole and omit the duration and price points of the happy hour.  Do it like this:  Happy hour is 4:30-7:30, 3 dollar beers (some good ones, in bottles, the only one you can't get is Chimay), 4 dollar cocktails (wide assortment).

It's quiet as hell in this place early on, and it's darker than Joseph Conrad, but it's clean as shit, and they provide food for free at the happy hour (get there early tho, they don't restock).

Anyways, good spot for some drinks in Hayes Valley.
author: Michael P.

description:
Three stars for ambiance alone. The cool, modern interior belies the bland, bland vanilla flavor of this spot. It's just...bland. Wine list? Bland. Bartenders? Bland. Music? OK. Crowd? Well, at least they're fairly attractive for the most part.
Wine Lovers Beware! The wine has tasted like it is improperly stored on both of my visits. Very brief, lackluster list with no real gems but the Edna Valley Pinot, which tasted like it had been improperly stored :( 
I love the space and I had good company, so I'm not too unhappy. Next time I'll pass on  the wine so this is still the place I'd go for cocktails in Hayes Valley. 
Plus, there was a pack of cougars doing what I can only guess was practicing a drunken rave style of dancing that was so atrocious and so dangerous in such a tiny space that we got hit with hair a few times sitting at the bar. Now that's entertainment.
author: Autumn K.

description:
I casual place to get a drink with friends if you are in hayes valley, but they had all these specialty cocktails on the menu but they kept saying they were out of this or that.  It's mellow and not crowded.

The other time I was here, I was too drunk by that time to really remember details but we left because it was a weekend night and it was kind of dead inside, so we went to Absinthe instead.
author: Kari L.

description:
Because sometimes you have to cram into a closet-sized sauna to drink $8 glasses of you wine from a $6 bottle. And who wants to sit down? Do you know how many calories there are in booze? A bunch. Burn 'em off any way you can.

One star because the wine *is* tasty, one because my extremely attractive friends are even more attractive in sultry lighting and another because the bartender was really sweet.
author: jason l.

description:
Sweet spot.

 Not divey, touristy, or douchey. Mostly the residents of hayes valley chill here. 

The place is designed with the motif that sweets and alcohol flow hand in hand and really stand behind it with the cool little mints, chocolates, and suckers given for free. They have a pretty wide range of liquors here and serve up some rocking Lemon Drops, Side Cars, and Greyhounds.

If you come in on some random afternoons, they may even have complimentary chips and salsa to snack on!

Overall, it's an excellent place to meet friends for drinks, rendezvous before your date, or just walk in and start your weekend early... like on a Thursday at 3pm. :)
author: Anthony B.

description:
Sugar.  Appropriately named and not just a good looking lounge at that.  They truly deliver a good drink...  Or two...  Or three...

Many sugary props to the Mojito Martini which delivers a sharp shot or two of Hangar One Kaffir LIme Vodka.  Because of this cocktail I acquired a few more imaginary friends than usual... and they all wholeheartedly approve of Sugar.

While I do miss Hayes & Vine just a tad bit, I am happy to say that even the wines are very much up to snuff.  Beer goggles now officially removed.
author: lulu p.

description: Cute bar, but $11 for a basic whisky drink?  I won't be back.
author: Ritch G.

description:
I miss the old Hayes & Vine, but this is definitely a nice addition to Hayes Valley, a stretch previously lacking in good nightlife options. On a given weekend night, you get a nice spillover from post Absinthe diners, plus an assortment of other pretty people looking to meet each other.

It's a fun place to meet up for happy hour (they have some free appetizers on weeknights!), and my favorite is the somewhat secluded backroom, where you can gather intimately but also pass judgement on the people waiting in line to use the restroom (get 'em while they're at their weakest, I say).
author: Nish N.

description: Great place to stop over for Happy Hour if you are anywhere near Hayes Valley or Civic Center. The staff is very friendly, the ambiance is excellent, and the complimentary buffet works for me.
author: Brendan H.

description:
This bar is one of my favorites... well designed, not pretentious, friendly bar staff, creative drinks and a melllow atmosphere.  I typically visit on an "off" night, such as a Tuesday.  The happy hour is generous with free hors d'oeuvres and nicely discounted drinks.

On a more personal note, Mike the bartender is not only a nice guy, but super hot.  He makes an amazing drink with pear vodka.  Ask him about the "Yaya" --- if you ever liked Now & Later candies, you'll love this drink.

I'll go back for sure.  Who's up for happy hour next week?
author: Irja T.

description: I came here during happy hour to eat the  free hors d'oeuvres .  I got a watermelon long island ice tea for five i couldn't finish it only drank half.  Beside they didn't bring out any more food.  I shoulda got a beer but it was Tuesday.
author: John F.

description:
Went here on a Saturday night with the wild bunch of people I work with.  We showed up around 11:30 pm.  Ladies did not have to pay a cover charge.  The men did. One of the guys just walked in anyways and they either (A) gave up on yelling at him to come back and let him party then he left early or (B) they finally kicked him out and the rest of us where too blasted to notice.  

This place is absolutely a lounge!  It was chill at 11:30pm on a Saturday night!  Um, who goes to a bar on a Saturday night just to sit around and drink?  Look around the place!  I think there is a dance floor.  Well, if not we made it one that night.  The dancing area is small.  Music did not do anything for me, it was too slow.  But... the mojitos kick ass! The bartenders are very quick, friendly and make mean drinks.  Wow, they know their mixology!  Like many have mentioned here, a great place to start the night because the drinks are out of this world.

Watch out for those couches.  There is a wooden top rest and it seems like a nice place to place a drink and a small purse.  NO!  My purse fell behind the couch, got my arm stuck, yanked it out and was bruised for 2 weeks!  Long sleeves only for 2 weeks!  Apparently, they are used to this because some dude showed up there with a plan.  A freakin stick with a flashlight.!
author: Yasmin E.

description:
Sugar lounge adds a romantic touch to the already mesmerizing neighborhood of Hays Valley.  The entrance is small, but it's sweetly done with the pink neon light illuminating "Sugar".  I really like the ambience of the whole place, the huge drapes around the entrance and front windows always deserve good impression from the girls.   

I don't know about tthe drinks here because we've always just opened bottle here as it's reasonably priced and just good enough enjoy our own time.  The seating area is quite comfortable to spend a whole night with your special someone. :)   I really love the chocolate here on the counter though!

Sugar lounge and Jade bar are my favorite hang out spots in hayes valley.
author: Wei H.

description:
Very relaxed.  I love it.  If you don't want to be bothered, you won't be bothered.

Owned by same people as Hahn's Hibachi so if you go happy hour time, they serve food there from Hahn's.   One day, they served ebi tempura, vegetable crudite and cheese.  The cheese/crudite spread is better at Lions Pubs, but the ebi tempura was a pleasant surprise.   They even served it with dipping sauce.

I love greyhounds.  They just use some canned grapefruit juice but it's really good here.
author: Wakako U.

description:
I'm a little torn on Sugar, and that's from one visit.

We headed there last night to have a couple of birthday drinks with an old friend, and when we showed up it was great: dark, not crowded, easy to move around, $4 Stellas. I couldn't ask for much else.

And then all of a sudden fancy looking people, the likes of which I'd never seen anywhere between Chestnut and Market, started showing up.

I didn't last much longer after that.
author: Jason R.

description: This place is pretty small. Hard to find a place to sit and not recommended for large groups. The atmosphere is not bad and drinks are pretty good. I've definitely seen better happy hours.
author: Danielle R.

description: Free apps Mon-Fri from 5-whenever they're gone. Chelsea, Matt and Ginger (the bartenders) are rad.  Chill happy hour crowd, great locals and amazing happy hour drink specials.  So glad this is in my neighborhood! i heart you, Sugar. Never change...
author: Mike B.

description: It has been almost exactly a year since I've been to Sugar Lounge.  It is still a great place for happy hour.  Chill hangout, great drink specials, free appetizers.  I have to apologize to the other patrons last night...we ate all of the appetizers.  Sorry, they were really good.
author: Erin S.

description:
not sure what to do with the leftover pickle juice in your pickle jar? well, at sugar lounge they serve it as a back with a shot. brilliant! it's a great  alternative to a ginger back (too sweet).

i'd choose hypertension over diabetes any fuckin day.
author: Rob D.

description: This place is so adorable and cute! The wall and ceiling decorations were so cool I had to take a pic of it. I came here for Happy Hour and I really like this place. It's very small though so make sure to get there early. Friendly service, good prices, free tastes of food...what;s not to love? Overall it gets my approval! Can't wait to go back!!!!
author: Heidi K.

description:
3.5 stars

My friends and I went to Sugar Friday night for a birthday.
The place looked nice, and I had a really cute (and strong) looking drink called strawberry blonde,  complete with strawberries!

Heres my two cents about sugar lounge: A great place for drinks for happy hour after work. NOT a happinin' place to spend your entire Friday. 

Also called sugar because people go get coked up in the bathroom. if that is your cup of tea maybe you'd give it more stars....
author: Molly W.

description:
This is where the Cicero is moving party continued...the place was packed like a bento box at 10ish and eventually went to a accommodating capacity by 12ish.  The peeps there were a bit snobby, but since our friends took up about 1/3 of the bar things were cool.

Great party music, but not really a place to get ur groove on.  Things really turned up when all of us became more faded and the peak of the evening 4 me was when my pal Joe called me out.  He busted the sprinkler on me and a crazy-drunken robot...i was a bit intimidated.

I returned his barrage with a little bit of slinky popping and did the splits between his legs.  All of our friends appreciated our idiocy and Evelyn- the owner bought me a shot of patron. 

See you in Barcelona Cicero!!!
author: omar b.

description:
It's all about pricey specialty drinks, made carefully with fresh fruit in a martini glass with a colored sugar rim.  

A comfy couch, fresh flowers, a make-out room in back, dramatic lighting, the cleanest and prettiest bar bathrooms ever, abundant wifi leaking in from across the street, a good DJ all night long, and the world's must under-appreciated free buffet happy hour.  

Late night it's packed but the rest of the time the bar's light business is your ticket to lounge paradise.

If you have one of those "entertainment" promos on your credit card, they honor that.
author: Gil S.

description:
I'm super generous with the stars so I am holding back on the full 5.  I'll save that for a time when I am not going somewhere alone to slam a drink before the bus arrives.

Sugar was super cute.  The decor was clean and modern with some cool glass sconce things and sofas.  There was a dj in the corner playing some kick back beats.  The place was loaded with chicks in tight pants, heels and hot shirts.  If I wasn't so damn gay I would have been in heaven.  The drink was good.  It cost a couple bucks more than a dump down the street, but you have to pay to hang out in places that aren't creepy and I am worth it!

I'll go back with friends someday and see what I think of it with a serious buzz.  I'll  love it I am sure.
author: Ian M.

description:
This is a great late afternoon, or evening starter. 

Excellent Mojitio's and all the drinks are excellently priced for the neighborhood. The service is good, and the drink menu is well rounded.

Great for at least on drink.
author: Adam B.

description: Somewhere between 3-4 stars.  Went for late night (not HH, where it sounds like they have some good deals).  Specialty cocktails are a bit pricey ($23 for 2?) but they're good.  Watermelon Long Island tastes like a watermelon Jolly Rancher.  At least there's no cover.
author: Ken L.

description:
Update July 26 - A larger selection of Happy Hour nibbles this time.  It's basic stuff but does the job and I enjoyed what seemed like a wider variety this time.  Two salsas instead of one.  Good stuff considering it's free.  And the barman brought drinks to our table this time - how nice!  I'm nudging up a half star - but Yelp won't let me do 4.5.  :)  I"ll be back.

Four stars for drinks and atmosphere.  Five stars for crowd - mellow, mixed and well mannered (yay!).  Three for the Happy Hour food.  

Here's what I don't get.  If you're going to do Happy Hour food, and everyone loves the teryaki chicken nibbles and wipes it out, and the other food just sits and sits.. wouldn't you say to yourself "hmm, maybe more chicken nibbles."  

Ok - some nibbles cost more than others to put out but... the drinks off Happy Hour are pricey so - I'd personally upgrade the food a bit.

Yes it is nice, and thoughtful, that they do Happy Hour.  I just wish - especially since these owners are also owners of a Korean Barbeque - that they'd do it a bit more classily.

Salsa from a jar?  :(

But you know what?  Drinks were good, crowd was great, music mellow and barman very nice guy.  So - eh - I shall live without the better nibbles.

But just nudge that nibble bar a BIT and it would easily be 5 stars across the board.
author: Juliana C.

description:
I am not entirely sure what to make of this place.

A few of my girl friends and I wandered over here after dinner on a Friday.  We arrived when a private party was ending, so once they all left we were sitting alone for quite some time on the back couch.

While I did enjoy the lounging aspect of this place, it was definitely pricey.  I ordered some type of strawberry cosmo, which was fantastic but I don't think I needed to spend what I did on one drink.

The decor was pretty styling, the DJ was pretty good and the drinks were delicious (I tried my friends as well). 

I guess it does get pretty crowded and the place is pretty small, so you may want to hit it up early for happy hour drinks with friends, otherwise you will feel like a tool (does this word work for women as well?) standing around smushed amongst others.
author: Inga B.

description:
This is the cool uncle of dive bars with its yuppie decor and hipster crowd.  If you have outgrown your station in the Mission, Sugar is a low-key place with a mellow crowd.  The free Hershey's kisses remind you that this is not an upscale joint, but it is more clean and presentable than Jade around the corner.  Overall, very Hayes Valley. 

Sugar is pleasantly uncrowded on weekends.  Also very Hayes Valley.

I'm not a mixed drinks person, so I can't evaluate their drinks. The selection of beer and wine is decent.
author: CW P.

description:
So I read my Daily Candy like I drink my morning coffee.  I received an email about the Sugar Lounge and thought I'd round up the gals to hit up this lounge for drinks yes?
We get into this super swanky "lounge" filled with SF's finest.  (Very yuppiesque.)  The drinks are not all that and the music was blaring which took away from the whole "lounging effect".  I'm going to have to say this is not such a sweet spot in my humble opinion.  There are way cooler lounges w/ a cool atmosphere and sweeter drinks!
author: Mijiza M. S.

description:
Stumbled upon this little joint last night after walking around Hayes Valley a bit trying to find a bar that fit our scene. The sign outside its doors had a photo of their bar, which had illuminated shelves. I was immediately sold. I love those! We step in, and there weren't too many people there yet. Over time a steady flow of people came in and the place never got too noisy nor too crowded. Ambiance was very relaxed. It was very chill. There's a dj in the back playing lounge music. 

Here's what I really liked about this place:
1) Clean! Always a plus in my book.
2) Service. Never had to wait very long for drinks. Bartenders were speedy and their drinks were quality at the same time.
3) Cocktails! I had about three rounds last night. Try the Pear Bear (martini with hints of passion and mango juice), Zen Garden (another martini with green tea, lemon, and honey), and Strawberry Blonde.

Don't worry guys, you don't have to sacrifice your manliness in favor of a sugared cocktail. Their menu boasts a wide selection of whiskeys.

Sugar Lounge, you're everything I could ask for in a bar... and possibly more!
author: Monica N.

description:
Went in there on a Monday...totally dead! Had a seat at the bar and the awesomist bartender ever (the inventor of the mentioned honey cocktail) made us some off the menu mango ginger delicious drinks! 

I am sold. She usually works on Sundays and now I know where I will be every Sunday.
author: Allegra F.

description:
Bartenders 5 Star, Happy Hour 5 Star!  Everything else might be 3.5-4 star (especially how cramped it gets!), but I think those two things are so improtant, in weighted average we're still at 5 stars.

The bartenders are really detail-oriented bartenders who are both efficient and friendly, and aren't too snobby to alter a drink recipe (unlike some bartenders at CERTAIN bars!).

Happy hour beers are $3 (except Chimay and Guiness, but this I understand), BUT they include Fat tire and Anchor steam!!  Wells $4, and sometimes a special martini or somesuch at $5.  Did I mention free food?  Always free happy hour chips and salsa, and usually tempura and BBQ treats.  

The crowd is pretty good, a true mix, but a good mix-- blue collar and white collar folks of the kind who generally get along great.  Atmosphere is also quite excellent..

Some very imaginative drinks too.
author: Jaime R.

description:
I like it here.  Nice lighting, not too loud music, good drinks, small back room for a little privacy.  I threw a small party here, didn't reserve it but told the owners I was coming by with 30 friends on a Sunday.

We got full reign of the sound system and danced salsa.  It was a ton of fun and quite intimate.  I like it here too bc it's only a block away from my favorite boutiques.  However, I know to shop first then drink.  The opposite is trouble for my pocketbook.
author: michelle s.

description:
Great bottle service!!! & cute lil bar ! Would have loved to stay longer for the party but the hubby was sick:-/
Definatly gonna come back for happy hour! 

Happy Bday Debo!
author: Lily S.

description:
A group of us planned to meet at Sugar to celebrate a friends birthday several Saturdays ago. Because we were coming in with about 10 people, we called on the Wednesday prior and asked if we needed to reserve a table. We were told no--that as long as we got there by about 8 pm there should be room and not to worry. 

We all arrived and began drinking, the cocktails were decent, though a bit pricey. In spite of that I do need to add--and this will be signifigant later in my review--that we were all ordering lots of these expensive cocktails and tipping well. Then--out of the blue--at about 10 pm, the bartender came over and told us the entire back of the bar had been reserved beginning at 10:30 pm, and we would need to vacate. He pointed to a little, tiny, teeny, dare I say lilly-puttian sign on the table that said *reserved*. 

The rest of the bar was now packed with girating marina-style blondes and the men who want them, so moving to a different location at sugar was not an option. This seemed really insane particularly considering we had called in advance about reserving a table, had arrived early so that we could all hang out together, and had been drinking and tipping for 2 hours, and were now essentially being kicked to the curb. This may be appropriate treatment for Manhatten, but this is SAN FRANCISCO PEOPLE.

Needless to say, I will not be returning to Sugar.
author: Ellen S.

description:
I didn't get here in time for the free food, but the place is chill and the happy hour is decent.  The other good thing is that this place isn't stupidly crowded on a Friday after work, and the music wasn't blaring in my ears at ungodly decibels (I know I sound incredibly old right now...)  After the happy hour the regular drinks are just as pricey as any other SF establishment.  

If anything, I definitely recommend the mojito if you're arriving after the free food and cheap drinks portion of the day.  Some places make a pretty nasty one, but the $9 mojito at Sugar is good (but might be a ltitle on the sweet side). 

I thought it was pretty good - though nothing spectacular. Will definitely be back again sometime (hopefully) if another happy hour is arranged.
author: Shay F.

description:
When Absinthe was packed on Saturday night, we decided to cross the street and have a cocktail at Sugar Lounge.

Here's the deal - the cocktails weren't fantastic ot even really very good. Unbalanced, expensive and the bartender had just a hint of attitude that a new space like this just can't afford to have.

The free appetizers (a crudite plate, tostito chips, salsa, chopped pepper jack and canadian bacon) were not only uninspired, but presented without any serving utensils.

The space was nice and lounge-y, though two others in my party noted it smelled a little like cleaning fluid.

I won't return here when Sauce and Absinthe are cheaper, more friendly and build a better cocktail.
author: Avery G.

description:
I had Halloween candy at the bar!  I got it off of a fancy silver tray!  To chase my sugary girly shot!  Except my sugary girl shot was heavy on the vodka - yay!  
Came here about beventeen drinks into my Thursday night, and at last call no less.  The bartender wasn't even a dick about it, and let us get a shot AND a drink as our "last call" even though he had called it before we arrived.  What a sweetie.  I guess all that sugar rubs off on you.
Very small, I'd hate to be here when it was crowded, but then again, I have to be here when it's crowded to give it a decent review.  I look forward to checking it out again.
author: Jennifer D.

description: Certainly a cool option in a neighborhood that needs more alternatives to the horrifying Marlena's, which may leave you scarred for life.  I like this place and its ambiance; the only drawback was that they had a number of couches/areas roped off as "reserved", which seemed both pretentious and bridge-and-tunnel.
author: Rick H.

description:
Stopped in here early one evening as we were prowling the hood for dinner. The decor is nice, with these funky glass art pieces over the wall lights. The drink I ordered from the cocktail menu was okay (can't remember what it was, sorry), and the wife ordered a Kir Royale (cause she's classy). Bill for two drinks was $19 which was a tad pricey.

3 stars for the nice decor, and pleasant bar staff, but it lost one for the pricey drinks. We'll definitely drop in again, next time we're in the area.
author: Chris K.

description:
LOVE LOVE LOVE. 

DELICIOUS cocktails and FREE food. woo woo woooo! the best! 
the cocktails were on the expensive side- 9-12 bucks, but they were SO WORTH IT. i had the X-rated kiss (OMG SO GOOD) and the Glass Slipper (EVEN BETTER!!).  these cocktails were really strong, and it was GREAT that they had food so we could balance out the booze.  

the atmosphere was nice- everyone was chill and minded their own business.  the bartenders were nice and helpful, and they make really MEAN COCKTAILS!! :D!!

i will definitely for sure be coming back! i vow to try ALL of their cocktails before i go back home. 

all in all, great place, FREE FOOD, clean restrooms, expensive but YUMMY drinks, great people!
author: Rosa K.

description:
Really good cocktails.  I love the mojito martini - just what it sounds like, a mojito served up.  They have free snacks, but I don't like eating food that other people have picked over, so I can't tell you if they are good  or not.  

It's lounge-y, dark inside with comfy couches and a great place to hang out and talk (although it can get loud when the dj's going).  Eclectic mix of people depending on when you go.
author: eeeee d.

description: We ordered 2 Negronis.  Bartender says that is $12.  I give her a 20.  She comes back and says they are $10 each. I say last time they were $5.  She says that must have been a long time ago. I say it was 2 weeks ago on Oscar night and she served me and I was the only one there.  She says the system was just updated. $8 is not going to change my life. If you want to keep a customer, there is a better response. The correct price is $10 for next time, but these will be $6.  One more thing.  Why are the free apps always empty so early.
author: Vito P.

description:
This is a place that I would never have found on my own. It appears to be a small-ish bar from the street, but once you get in, it's all about the dancing. 

A group of us checked it out on Saturday night and it wasn't too crowded, even though the dance floor is really tiny. It's a good mix of people and isn't meat market-ish at all. 

My husband ordered me one of my regular drinks; vanilla vodka and cranberry and instead, came back with vanilla vodka and ginger ale because the bartender had suggested it. Thanks for the suggestion. It's my new favorite drink!      

If you want to have a fun night of dancing with friends and not have to worry about being picked up on, the Sugar Lounge is the place.
author: Lee H.

description:
Ah, a DJ bar in Hayes Valley.  Small, cozy, and sexy as all get-out, this is certainly a welcome addition to the 'hood.  (Yes, I'm completely aware that it's been open in the old Hayes and Vine spot for nearly two years, but I'm reviewing it NOW, and that's what I would have said had I reviewed it upon its opening.  So there.)

I like the sofas.  Comfy and roomy, they're a nice place to chill out with some friends (or an intimate date) and enjoy one of their singular cocktails (I'm quite a fan of their cosmos - though sometimes they go a little ape shit with the colored sugar on the rim.  Note to bartenders ... cosmos are sweet enough as it is without granular particles of green sugar collecting at the bottom of the glass!)

I like the decor.  Vaguely dark in an almost erotic way, the artwork would have to be declared esoteric and somewhat moody.  The blown glass light sculptures lining the wall apposite the lengthy bar are nice to look at, and an almost irresistible urge to touch 'em.  Go ahead.  Do it.  Touch them.  Rowr...

I like the bartenders, particularly the foxy ones of the female persuasion.  Yeah, yeah, yeah ... I'm aware that that sounds kind of sexist or something.  But I tell you what.  Having a raspberry Cosmo handed to me by an attractive blonde with a one-size-too-small T-shirt is certainly a more enjoyable experience as opposed to being handed a can of Pabst by Polly the nine-fingered matron of Ye Olde Dive with a wart the size of a grape on the tip of her nose.  Y'know, come to think of it, I'd be willing to bet that at least Polly is more interesting in the conversation department.  I'll consider this a draw for now.

I like the music.  Yep, that's DJ Native Intelligence at the turntables, spinning an extremely eclectic (I know this word is used a lot, but bear with me) variety of electronic aural moods.  I've heard mash-ups, I've grooved to dub and raggae, banged my head to heavy-ass drum n' bass, and silkily enjoyed my peach Cosmo to smooth as silk trance that washes over your skull and makes you feel blissful as all get-out.  You GO, Mister Native Intelligence!

And I like that mysterious round table hidden away in the back, behind the toilettes.  Roped off with curtains and resembling in color the inside of a blood-orange, I can only imagine the goings-on that that little place has seen.  Maybe it's only my imagination working, but it most certainly adds to Sugar Lounge's mystique.

I like this place.  And now I inexplicably feel the urge for a huge blueberry Cosmo (hold the Technicolor sugar, please!)
author: Thomas B.

description:
I grabbed a drink at Sugar tonight when my friends were running late to meet me for dinner at Absinthe across the street. I was pretty impressed. I had the "Pink Pearl," which was a lovely combination of kiwi flavored vodka, St. Germain, fresh strawberries and lime juice, although I had initially been tempted by the "Pear Bear." Good stuff, went down easy.

So easy that I finished it off and still had another 15 minutes until my friends were arriving. I contemplated getting another one, but at $10 a pop, I was able to restrain myself and managed to appeal to my rational, logical, you-have-absolutely-no-business-going-around-
buying-multiple-$10-drinks-on-the-budget-of-a-grad student-right-before-you-go-and-have-dinner-at-an-equally-swanky-
and-financially-out-of-your-league-establishment side. So I called it quits at one and got out of there before I changed my mind!
author: Shannon R.

description:
There's no way I can be as chic and glam as the other reviewers on here or those who inhibit Sugar, but I will give it a thumbs up.  It's a cute swanky little railroad car-style bar that makes a nice stopping off point when traveling through Hayes Valley.  My buddy Nick Carlson DJs there on Wednesday nights, so I usually try to stop by and so should you. Nick has excellent taste in clothes, music, and drinks and makes great conversation, even whilst he lays down da beats.  See you there!

p.s. your milage may vary on the bartenders, so make sure to taste your drink and ask them to adjust it accordingly.
author: Jason S.

description:
Awfully crowded for a Tuesday night at 7 (just there for a quick drink), but I liked it, even though I miss Hayes and Vine.  Good lounge-y vibe, nice bartender, though a funny crowd (perhaps someone's office outing?)  It's this Thursday's "Explore Our Neighborhood" outing for my office (I know, I know, venturing out of the TL), but I cringe to think what it's like on a Thursday.  I may have to take the crowd to Place Pigalle, where it's low brow or no brow.

Update:   I just learned that Tuesday is $2 martini night.  That would explain the crowd.  And why my friend bought drinks.  A hiccup of now-explained generosity.  Thursday at happy hour was just fine.
author: Laurel B.

description:
5 stars for literally having sugar (chocolote candy) on hand for the taking, up on the bar...

4 1/2 stars for pretty good and friendly service and a couple of good pinot noir and whiskey recommendations (not combined in one drink, mind you)

2 1/2 stars for how young everyone was (ok, so i'm feeling old, at 36. seriously - i think half of the place was still in highschool, or MAYBE just started college!?)

3 1/2 stars for the DJ - he actually mixed up some tunes that made even THIS old fart consider maybe gettin' the groov on... 

Will I be back? Probably not - but hey, it was something different. And not so loud that you couldn't talk to your neighbor. Booo on last call at 11:30pm though!! But I guess that's the norm around that neighborhood....
author: beth l.

description:
I have been to Sugar a few times now. For those of you who have been around for a little while, Sugar occupies the space that used to belong to Hayes & Vine, one of the more interesting (albeit short-lived) wine bars in San Francisco. The space is virtually unchanged -- the total bar area is the size of a large studio apartment. Thankfully, unlike so many of the bars in San Francisco that have adopted the "P-shaped layout" as I like to call it (you enter the place, and there is a long bar with minimal space between the bar and wall until you get to the end where there is a large open area to congregate -- makes me feel cramped), Sugar is fairly open. There is some couch seating near the window, a nice counter to rest your drink, and a small area  in the back near the DJ stand.

I am glad to see that Sugar has kept the small little half-moon room in the back -- it is nice for a quiet conversation or small gathering or 3-4 people. The drinks I had at Sugar were good and reasonably priced. Unlike the experiences of others, I found the service to be quick and friendly. The music was a good mix of house and hip-hop both nights I was there.

This is a strong addition to Hayes Valley. An additional bathroom and another 200 sq ft would help.
author: Charles H.

description:
I reeeeeeeeally liked this place.  It was my first time inside and it was pretty chill.  I loved the sakura branches sticking out of the giant vases on the bar.  The artwork on the walls fit perfectly for the mood of this place.  The lighting was excellent, the couches were comfortable.  The music inside wasn't too loud, made it perfect to have good conversations with friends.  It wasn't at all crowded but not empty either, comfortable amount of people for a Tuesday night.

Also the bathroom was in superb condition.  It was huge, I was totally impressed, felt like I was in someones house.
author: Mary R.

description:
I haven't read al the reviews but I read a bunch and I'm surprised no one bemoaned the lack of beer on tap!  That brings a drinking establishment down a star in my opinion.

Great happy hour: $3 beers (bottles) and $4 cocktails.  The cocktail I got was strong, decently-sized, but oddly devoid of sugar.  All it was, was crushed strawberries, vodka, and tequila.  It needed some simple syrup or something to sweeten it up.  However, I did not care.  Too busy chatting with the friendly and unpretentious bartender.  Also, I was stoked at how they used top shelf liquors and made it strong so the lack of sugar was not a big deal.

Great little free appetizer spread:  teriyaki chicken, egg rolls, chips & salsa, tempura, etc.  Yum.

Nice ambience too.  I tried to hate it because I do not like frouffy lounges.  But it's suprisingly unpretentious and mellow, and I really liked that.

Sugar, had you served me a beer on tap, you would have received the perfect score.  But you gave me a Heineken in a bottle so minus one star for you!
author: Jen S.

description:
Food and Drinks are a natural combination. Any place that offers free (tasty) food while I drink my *discounted* drinks, is a place I want to be friends with.

One of my favorite places to go for happy hour because of the free offerings of white chocolate dipped strawberries, spring rolls, tempura, and mini turkey sandwiches. Only you have to make sure you get there before 7 or the food will be gone. I have only been here during happy hour so I can't speak for the weekend/nightlife, but the place is clean, well decorated, and inviting. The bartenders are social, and they make excellent drinks. 

So glad I found this place, the only reason it doesnt get a full 5 star rating is because during happy hour times (4-7) that area of hayes valley is a big ol' mess and trying to find parking while people are just leaving work and smashing down gough is a little scary.
author: Crystal A.

description:
a buddy of mine recommended this spot as a possible place for me to get booked as a dj.....so i rolled down there with demo n press kit in hand and......was really impressed with the decor and lighting and ambiance of the place.....very classy, seductive, n laid back......two bartenders on duty....the female is a dimepiece.....has one of the most aesthetically pleasing faces i've seen in the city.....patrons were ethnically diverse but tended to b on the 30 n up side for the most part n 9 to 5 types....but i did go during happy hr on a tues

nice dj booth with a rane empath and 1200's (dope)....good music from rock to r&b to hip hop being played off pandora...some great drink specials (Watermelon Long Island is $5 on one of the weekdays)

only downers would be lack of space to get down on  but thas jus the dj in me tallkin....hopefully i get to spin there one of these days.....i'll be back tho regardless
author: Sang L.

description:
Been to Sugar Lounge twice and I think both times on a Thursday.
Both times the place was pretty empty (read: less than 10 people) and I must admit that I liked that but I hear that the place can really fill up.
Taken its space into consideration 'filling it up' wouldn't be too hard :)

Liked: The lighting, the wine, the scotch, the bartender.
Didn't like: Actually there wasn't anything I really disliked. It's an all around nice place to pop in to for a drink.
author: Rich S.

description:
This place is ok. The atmosphere is kinda nice. Solemn in a way. The glass light fixtures were slightly reminiscent of Swig, but way less detail and not as nice. But still I liked them.

Good drinks, and the food they set out for happy hour just as we were leaving looked good, definitely not the average fare of a happy hour scene. Had some class, but if it was good I know not as I didn't try any.

The Hershey's kisses on the tables in martini glasses were, if nothing else cute. I can't imagine eating them while sipping vodka even with my weird booze and sweet tooth combos.

I'd go back and check out the happy hour for the food.
author: Marz W.

description:
Great lounge to relax.  Although it may get very crowded and HOT during Happy Hour somedays - try Thurdays.
Perfect for after work, 'not quite ready to get home drink', after or before dinner for a quiet relax atmosphere.  Happy hours are good and well priced although premium beers aren't included.
Tasty free munchies, perfect to hold you up for a late dinner.
Bartenders are friendly and attentive.  
Bathroom super clean.
Great groovy ambient music and the DJ may play your latest favorite tune.
author: Yamil A.

description:
Allow me to explain this "A-OK" rating with simple arithmetic:

5 Stars for the DJ and the delicious cocktails, for accommodating a lovely birthday party, and for allowing my friends to cut a huge birthday cake on their table and stash their belongings on the couches.  The joint is safe I never felt like someone was going to run with my jacket if I put it down. 

1 Star for the lack of crowd control in the front and the poor party planning.  The same night they seemed to have a private party with appetizers that took up too much room at the entrance was the same night they just opened the place up for general admission.  Huh uh... i.e. hell no.  Sugar People, if you have a private party, then keep it private.  But don't expect innocent patrons to come back after spending 15 minutes to walk from the front to the back of a very small bar.   

Back to the arithmetic: (5+1)/2 = 3.   In summary - I wouldn't go there voluntarily on a Saturday night, but if there was another bday party, I'd totally put on my party dress again and push my way through the crowd with my elbows out.
author: Maulie D.

description:
Good crowd, good drinks, good location. Yep that sums it up ...a lot of good things but nothing great and definitely nothing extraordinary. 

I would go back and hopefully have a great time and I'll bump them up a bit!
author: Adrienne P.

description: This place was chill. I came here for my first time last night. The ladies serving the drinks were super nice. It's a great place if you're trying to pregame before a show at the Rickshaw Stop.
author: Michael L.

description: Great drinks, good service! The Lucy and the Frenchie can be addicting martinis!
author: Rob L.

description:
Nice loungy bar with a decidedly unattractive crowd.  Not that I was looking.  Uhh.  I hope DM doesn't read this.  

They need more seating.  I hate standing and drinking.  Dancing and drinking, good.  Sitting and drinking, good.  Even leaning against the bar and drinking, good.  But just standing in the middle of the room and drinking?  Oddly tiring.  Other than that, a cute little lounge to hang out with friends.
author: Jason S.

description: Free Food During HH. YES. Almost fell asleep due to the dim lighting? YES Again. Drinks are bit sugary but the price is right. Not much of a crowd (meaning no lines to the bartender), just the way I like it!
author: Kelly C.

description:
I have been putting off creating my happy hour list for a very long time, but I couldn't wait till then to tell everyone about the Sugar Lounge.

Friday, 5 o'clock me and my partner in drinking crime, walk in and are surprised to find its packed! And I thought I felt guilty about leaving work at 5 on the dot.

The house drinks are good and there's plenty to choose from, I liked the mangopolitan and the love shack (a concoction with pomegranate juice) all are made with Hangar 1 vodka and for happy hour the drinks are around five dollars. (5 dolla don't holla! )

To top all of that greatness, there are complementary snacks! Lining the wall on a shelf, you might find treats like onion rings, shrimp tempura, cheese and crackers.
author: Helen J.

description:
Good drinks, interesting crowd.  Someone was break dancing at one point which was just odd, I thought.

Great place to sit with 2 or 3 friends, drink it up, and enjoy the evening.  Nothing really memorable outside of that.
author: Tamara M.

description:
Right down the road from my bar review class...

After a particularly gut-wrenching practice test, some of my classmates and I decided we deserved some drinks.  I suggested Jade, but since we were done around 4 (and Jade doesn't open until 5), we shuffled over to Sugar.

$4 well drinks... $3 beers... twice as much money for the same thing at Jade.  Purple walls, people in suits... pretty forgettable.  The free food offering was nice, but kinda weird.  I felt like I was at a high school graduation party.  Where was the ziti, yo?
author: Alissa K.

description:
Great location, and a really nice place inside.  Something out of NYC's soho or meatpacking district!  You walk in and there's a lounging area in the front, very modern simplistic interior with the bar to the right.  Seriously comfortable leather stools... then a small dj area at the end of the bar and the dj is spinning downtempo, jazz-ambient, etc...     Then , there's this tiny room in the back with a few leather chairs... kinda like an alcove if there's a small group...

The only problem which totally killed it for us was a novice bartender.   Maybe she was under training?  But ALL the drinks (mojito, marguarita) were just awful!   We did go on a weekday, but def order one mixed drink and see if it's any good first... otherwise, stick with beer and wine...
author: Mark K.

description: Nice after work spot.. good drinks, great free food selection- I mean, its practically a whole meal! Perfect!
author: Lara M.

description: I don't know how it happens, but I always seem to end up here when I'm in that area...The drinks are really good and creative. Every time I go int here there's something interesting to try. The joint is a little shotgun style room so I think if could be crowded on a busy night, which is why I go when it's not. SPLAAAAH!
author: Erik U.

description: I've only been here for happy hour but I just keep coming back.  $5 specialty cocktail + free appetizers (not just chips and salsa- also veggies and dip, eggrolls, chicken teriyaki, and tempura veggies= YUM) + some beer special = perfect.  It's rarely overwhelmingly packed but the bar is usually full and the bartenders are very attentive without being annoying.  The atmosphere is cute- a few couches, comfortable bar stools, mellow music in the background.  Also, the cocktails that are served up come in some of the biggest martini glasses i've ever seen- none of those lame "classy" tiny glasses that hold 2 oz. of liquid- you get what you pay for here!
author: Luthien N.

description:
I thought this place was awesome. Somehow, I find myself there on Monday nights, when every other place in Hayes Valley is closed. I always intend to go to Absinthe, but then I forget it's closed, and across the street is Sugar! Cool, dark, cozy lounge. Chill music, nice bartender, overall a good place to relax and have a mojito with a friend.  I got super hungry last time I was there so me and my friend ordered a pizza and had it delivered to Sugar and the bartender was totally cool with it!
I found it odd though that I was one of 6 people in the lounge. Why? I like this place!
author: Lauren G.

description:
You can some of the people all of the time, and all of the people some of the time, but you can't please all of the people all of the time.... 

Whether or not you will like Sugar is both a question of taste and timing. It's not exactly the most roomy establishment on the face of the planet, which means that whilst it's a nice, cosy place to meet with that special someone during the week, come the weekend it's a steamy, sweaty body fest where you have to be willing to press up against fleshy bits (which is not  necessarily a bad thing in itself of course...)

Personally, I like Sugar as one of my many neighborhood bars and will quite happily check it out during the week. But come the weekend... well, see what mood you're in. The clientele are normally as swish as the decor, so it could be worth the squeeze :-)
author: Kevin R.

description:
If there's one thing that Sugar Lounge excels at, it's ambiance. The place rocks the boudoir vibe like there's no tomorrow. The DJ last night was spinning some deliciously tasteful glitchy downtempo. It was some of the best music that I've heard since I've moved to San Francisco.

The drinks were a bit pricey after happy hour, but I was sticking to beer anyway. The beer is reasonably priced all night, and it doesn't suffer from the often cited lack of alcohol that their frou frou drinks do.

Sugar Lounge is a great place to meet up with friends in a relaxed environment. The lounge cleared out about an hour after happy hour, and it became really easy to talk to friends and new acquaintances. I would definitely recommend Sugar Lounge for a mid-week place to spend time with your friends. If I could sum up Sugar in a phrase, this lounge is what all bars would be like if women ruled the world.
author: David H.

description:
You get what you pay for. 

This joint is off the tourist/B 'n T track without being completely WASP. The bar ladies have attitude - I asked her Highness what fruity, refreshing, sweet shot she could recommend and she said "duh, you're in a bar called 'Sugar Lounge'. What do you want, exactly?" Hmmh, no one said creativity or imagination was a requirement for taking up behind the bar, I guess, so my bad. Her French Kiss offering was a hit, so all is forgiven. 

The music was all over the map. A large crowd of drunk asian chicks arrived en masse and for some random reason their Showgirls bump and grind maneouvering emptied the dance floor faster than the bell at the end of play break. 

They do have these super weird glass lights that my group think look like the inside of a retainer. I looked hard for candy. Maybe they put the treats away past playtime? The bathroom line is typically fast and efficient. I like the intimacy and charm of this watering hole, plus girls can dance without having to excuse themselves to another floor or brave a large empty space, if their hearts so desire.
author: Killing Me Softly ..

description: Love this place!! The decor is super cute and girly, and the atmosphere is nice too. Their cocktails are delicious...and strong! Try the pink pussycat and the pineapple express! They also have free food during happy hour, which seems like a no brainer to me! :)
author: Erin H.

description:
I have a huge problem with Sugar Lounge!

Evidence A:  The place is really sleek, cute and comfortable... as am I.

Evidence B:  They barmaids build beautiful cocktails.  Tasty cocktails.  Ass-whupping strong cocktails.  My Maker's Mark Manhattan, well-stirred, no cherry, add a twist comes out perfect every time.

Evidence C:  Every night during happy hour (4-8) they have free finger foods from Hahn's Hibachi (same owners).  Yummy teriyaki chicken, shrimp tempura, wrap sandwiches, and the like.  Yes.  FOR FREE.

So what's the problem?

Sugar lounge is on my walk home from work and my best friend works next door at Bulo.  So I've been having multiple Manhattan's and fried food every single night.  I need an intervention.
author: wineporn S.

description: Sugar, I'm going to be honest here. I think you're a little out of place in the 'hood. There's something a little too seedy/drive-through honeymoon motel about the vibe (pink. everywhere. and for some reason I remember velvet hearts but now I can't think where they would have been). Don't get me wrong, Hayes Valley could use some unpretentious bar options (or more bar options in general), but your prices don't match the vibe. $12 for a so-so drink and a so-so vibe is really not in the cards. Luckily for you, competition is bleak around there so I'll probably be back if I want to grab a quick drink before straying away from HV - but that doesn't mean I'm going to be happy about it.
author: Joanne S.

description:
It's not my typical scene, but I'd go here again for a special occasion...bday or whatever. I went there at about 10pm on a Saturday and the place was full, but not overly crowded. We got served drinks very very quickly and were able to dance with out drinks without so many people that you wouldn't even think about bringing a drink on the dance floor. 
I don't know what people are saying about these apps. I didn't see any, but there were two bday parties in the place so I did get a few cupcakes :)
One bathroom for dudes and one for chicks. I only waited in line, once for about 36 seconds. 
The DJ did only play a couple of mash-ups of really predictable hip hop, but I think that's what the crowd wanted to hear, so good for them. Looked like happy times.
author: Mike M.

description:
This place always has the perfect number of patrons in the lounge. Not too crowded. Not too loud. Not too steamy. Not too pretentious. It's perfect to bring a friend and carry on a decent conversation with 12 inch voices.

The only thing they overdo is their whiskey pours, even in mixed drinks. I always walk out smelling of whiskey. That's the singular and consistent take away I have from this place.
author: Cathy H.

description:
Sugar has cheap drinks during happy hour, whenever that is.  It's the only realiable place in the neighborhood not overrun with tourists, the "Mercedes Set" and cotton-tops jamming into restaurant/bars before the bewitching hour of 8pm when the Symphony, Ballet and/or theatres start.  

I like the local vibe which seriously does fluctuate on it's own werid schedule.  I"ve been there on random Thursdays and they are packed and dead on Fridays.  I don't know the weekend gig because this is strictly a happy hour joint for me, co-workers and those hungry enough to get there in time for the free eats every week night. 
~ Ms. Ali
author: A W.

description: I've been to Sugar twice... but have yet to order a drink.  Wanna know why?  Because it's so steamy inside that I stay only until I can no longer remove any more clothing without fear of a public indecency fine.  This short interval of near-suffocation precedes any ability to actually order from the overly crowded bar.
author: Christine M.

description:
The 4 stars are because I really like the decor!!! Drinks and space... hmmm 

3 weeks ago I had to meet my friends at SUGAR.. This was the only SUGAR I thought of... so I went and got my ID checked... I walked in, it was pretty packed, but a small space so I know it'll be an easy find- (my bunch of asian friends)... Walked in very non-asian... all these stares... like ooohhhhhh yellow meat.. yum! Creepy guys... please DO NOT do that! But the music was fun! Old school beats, people were lively and dancing. Wouldn't mind staying... But I was not on the prowl that night. 

So I stepped out and called my friends:

Judi:  where the hell are you guys?? 
Friend: Sugar, WHERE ARE YOU???? 
JUDI: I AM AT SUGAR 
Friend: The one NEXT TO CELLAR, YEAH?? SH*T WHERE ARE YOU???
JUDI: (Very annoyed) oh man... people come up with more original names plese!!! OK, WRONG PLACE! See  you in 15... 

YESTERDAY: 
Came back again on another Sat... I know.. I came back! We just chilled out, but it was about 1am and where is everyone yesterday?? We passed by Ruby Skyes & Slide yesterday, but the crowd was just skanky! Can't make this up! Granted SUGAR LOUNGE was the 4th bar we hit up that night, but where was everyone???
author: Judi K.

description:
With Absinthe across the street, I've only seen the outside of this place and always wondered.  Last night I was wearing new heels and really needed a seat, so rather then stand at the bar at Absinthe, we went across  the street to Sugar.

Pretty decor.  Interesting sounding cocktails that were all WAY too sweet in reality. Sticking to old favorites didn't seem to work either as my Manhattan tasted like the shaker wasn't rinsed properly -or maybe it was just bad vermouth.  Mediocre music.

What it boils down to is this: I'm thinking we will stay on the other side of the street, cause after I perform the Parking Miracle of Hayes Valley, I need a cocktail, not lolly in a glass.

I know the name is Sugar, but...
author: Cosmolicious L.

description:
Sugar is part of my happy hour circuit. Free appetizers (wraps, tempura, chips n' salsa, teriyaki) with a beer or glass of wine, chill music and you're set, AND you're in this chic looking lounge.  

If you stay long enough at the bar, you will realize there is candy sitting in front of you...
author: Kris O.

description: Friends of friends rented out Sugar Lounge for NYE madness. There was a DJ (i think - when i walked by the DJ booth i just saw a plugged in IPOD), 2 bathrooms and seating.... the workers that night did not look happy at all to serve all the drunken idiots (myself included haha). No smiles no nuthin'. With that said though everyone seemed to have a great time, there was a little countdown for midnight and everyone managed to smash through each other in the tiny space. All in all a fun New Year's!
author: Julie F.

description: Nice place good vibe. Only reason they lack the full 5 stars is that there is one female bartender that has some attitude problem, and really doesn't understand the concept of service in exchange for payment and tips.  Particularly if one tips well they should receive good service.
author: bob r.

description:
This place is super cute.  I came here for a happy hour (school event once again) one day and had a good time.

The drinks were good - mojitos and free appetizers.  It was pretty calm inside and nice if you're with a group of friends.  This is a good lounge if you're looking for a local place to chill.
author: F K.

description:
Molly Shannon, as a 50 year old joyologist, liked to "kick and stretch".

I'm not 50, but I do like to "lounge and drink", and this place has a nice, calm feel to it.

It does feel like the place you go to in between places more than a destination.  Like, maybe after Absyinthe but before Hotel Biron?
author: Tim G.

description:
I have a love hate relationship with Sugar.  I love that it's close to my house and that it's an actual "lounge" in the Hayes Valley, but I don't actually LOVE Sugar itself.  It tends to be crowded on the nights I've gone...or completely empty.  No in between.

However the reason it gets 4 stars from me is because I went there the other night and had a really good time. My friend and I met their new bartender who introduced me to my new favorite drink.  This drink has no name though, which kinda sucks because I'll have to go back to drink it which is good for them and so/so for me.  I'll call it the "Jeanine" and probably stop by for one tonight.  Man, I sure can be luscious..
author: Catrinel A.

description:
during my  unfortunate encounter at sugar i was contemplating whether i had just entered the twilight zone or if this piece of shit bar was actually open!? If I had the authority to shut that embarrassment of a bar down today it would be over for SUGAR!  I have more resentment towards that bar than i do my own parents! WHO HIRED THE LADY WHO CANT DIFFERENTIATE BETWEEN SODA AND TONIC!? 
sugar is inevitably going to be another sad disappointment for Hayes valley to reminisce and mock for decades to come.
author: Kyle B.

description:
What a cute bar. My friend rented it last weekend for her good-bye party and it was a lot of fun. The drinks were great and they made an over-the-top vodka lemonade out of real lemons (not on the menu but you should try!)
The DJ played very danceable grooves and people were dancing, chatting and having a great time in this cool bar.
Also the interior is nice. Modern, but not cold. I like it.
author: Alexandra D.

description:
Went to a great industry event this evening at the Sugar Lounge. The tequila was free and the customers were bartenders, and the bartenders were hot! They have something called "fresh fruit Wednesday." How could that be bad?



(The event & tequila were sponsored by Young's Market)
author: J. R.

description:
Boring.  Vanilla.  Nothing special.  My boy tried to set up a tag team with these cute, nerdy girls, but our dates weren't having it.

Side note for those interested in the art of DJing: 

The DJ that spun that night played good music, but his beat matching was done by looking at the waveforms on his laptop the whole time.  Whats the point of having turntables if you don't use them (AND YOUR EARS) to beat match and make smooth transitions.  To his credit, he reminded me about songs I'd forgotten about.
author: One Black Mans POV.. ..

description:
I AM IN LOVE WITH SUGAR!!! I JUST HAD MY SURPRISE DIRTY THIRTY CELEBRATION THERE LAST NIGHT!?! 

My friends and I just had dinner in Hayes Valley and when we were supposedly walking to our cars to drive to another club. As we approached Sugar, I had to pause and stop. I told my friends, "Do you hear that?? Oh, I wanna peak in!" After telling the door woman it's my birthday and I just wanted to peek into the club and check out the party..she then asks me if I am the birthday girl and says my name..I turn around and my friends say, "SURPRISE!" 

I always prefer smaller lounge type places to drink and dance then BIG clubs! I don't know how I've missed Sugar! The party that night was "Flavor" and the DJs rocked it!! Nice blend of soul, r&b and classic hip hop...there was not one song I didn't enjoy!!!

The crowd was cool, too! It was definitely grown and sexy, not "young and dumb"! No drama, no problems...I got lots of love from complete strangers, the door woman, bouncers, bartenders, DJs, EVERYONE! 

Not sure how much the drinks were (since it was my birthday I didn't pay) , but from what my friends told me the drinks were reasonable!!  I only drank shots so I cannot review their cocktails/mixed drinks, but I will tell you the drinks were STRONG...thus the HUGE HANGOVER today!! 

But my overall experience at SUGAR was awesome because I had a great time...I will always remember startin my "30 is the new 20"  with some SUGAR!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

(Thought parking would be harder....we found one two blocks away on a Sat. I went back during the week and found parking a block away. Keep in mind both times was around 9pm-I'm sure it gets harder as the night goes on!)
author: M R.

description: This review is a couple months old sorry - but we did go there again a couple weeks ago and it was still a great time. My sister wanted a little get together for her friends at work for her, lets say "milestone" birthday. SL is a block from work so we did a test run and I was impressed because I expected a pretentious HV crowd. They had a sweet free appetizer set up and a nice happy hour selection with drink special to boot. Her birthday was a hit, the ladies at the bar let us have whatever we wanted which was 1/2 the bar, and they offered to hold our cupcakes and even served them up. My sister even got to plug in her iPod with her collaborative music selection. They were so accommodating!!! The drinks are a little high price but they make em right so I didn't mind, plus I figure with the appitzers it was worth it.  I'm not talking chips and nuts either, it's real food.  Good times...
author: Patti L.

description:
Good cocktails, friendly bartenders, and olives/cocktail onions/cherries all within my reach thanks to the vertical condiment holders placed on the bar? I like this place. 

Try the Bees Knees, if you can handle your bourbon (it was a little strong for my taste but still yummy) and the blue cocktail (might be a pomegranate something or other...) is really good if you like your drinks on the sweet and tangy side.
author: Amanda R.

description:
I won't return to Sugar.  What a bummer...it's a cool little spot in a great location.  But the bartender was incredibly rude to us and she made it clear that she didn't want our business.  It was about 7:00pm on a Tuesday and we suggested this as a good place for friends to meet for a birthday party.  About 15-20 people slowly arrived, and she told everyone that she didn't feel well, wanted to close the bar and was annoyed that a group had arrived.  We all left in short order with a bad taste in our mouths.  I was embarrassed that I had recommended Sugar.  

I would suggest looking elsewhere if you want to be treated properly.
author: Shanna Q.

description:
My first Sugar review was mean, so I thought I should be nicer.  It IS a cool bar, but maybe it's just better earlier on versus later at night.  Around 1am last Saturday, it seemed like most people were observing vs enjoying, and the dance floor was basically two gap-clothes guys grabbing their girls from behind, pulling their butt into their crotch, and then doing the circular grind.  Not pretty.  I still think Place Pigalle rules.

Ok, revised review....finally went to happy hour. Their dj duane rocks!  Tues-Sat early nights.
author: Melanie C.

description:
Sugar, as the name implies, specializes in sweet drinks. Sweet, fruity drinks in sugar-rimmed martini glasses. With its pink neon logo and designer interior, this place just screams, GIRLY DRINKS! I happen to dislike sweet drinks, and just about anything that alludes to Sex and the City, so one would naturally conclude that I dislike Sugar.


 Wrong For the most part.


 On weeknights, it's a fantastic place to get a cocktail or two. They provide a classy and relaxed environment in which I can imbibe in a heavily poured vodka soda or a decent Scotch, eat some complimentary munchies, and kick back to some groovin' tunes. The bathrooms are clean, there's always a tray of candy on the bar, and the bartenders are attentive and friendly. In fact, despite the drinks being a bit on the pricey side, I can't think of a nicer Hayes Valley bar to visit when it's not crowded.


 Note that qualifier: When it's not crowded.


 Come Friday or Saturday, though, and it's a whole 'nother ball game. In addition to the amazingly weak pours, it gets uncomfortably hot, the music gets cranked up a few hundred decibels too many, and service can lag. Not to say that it's a lost cause on weekends. Luckily for the local barflies, it seems to be more of a pre-party hangout, and in the wee hours before closing, it can be fun again. In fact, it's a decent place to stop by after a late dinner at Suppenkuche or on the way home from elsewhere, providing the douchey post-work/pre-club crowd has cleared out and moved on to hoovering rails at Ruby Skye or whatnot.


 This seems to be the problem with the majority of non-dive bars in San Francisco: On weekend nights, they become sweaty, loud, crowded dweeb corrals. So I won't hold it against Sugar from suffering the same problem as other bars. That'd be like blaming them for a 2am bar time.


 What I will hold against Sugar is the lack of beers on draft. Man can't live on vodka and whiskey alone, and I'll be damned if I'm going to order some frou frou pink cocktail rimmed with crunchy sugar crystals. Perhaps I'm not secure with myself, but I still like my drinks on the manly side.
author: Omid T.

description:
Came here for an after work going away party for an old boss of mine. Pretty nice place, but it was kind of on the small side, drinks were okay, and the food was very so so.

The main thing that was good was the atmosphere it provided. Given that its near a lot of dining, the symphony, and work, the crowd was cool. Didn't feel ghetto or anything like that. The warm color schemes and full bar felt like a very comfortable place to just hang out for a few drinks, but the downfall was when it got full. A ton of people turned out for this going away party and it got packed... quick! So it got hot and crowded making it a voyage through a sea of people trying to get to the bar. 

The drinks were good. I only had Henn on the rocks, but I didn't feel cheated out of my money. Same goes with the mixed drinks. A lot of people didn't complain about it in that department.

Come back? Sure. Not for a party or an event though. Seats were scarce and its just too small.
author: Jay V.

description:
This place is a great happy hour spots located at my favorite shopping area.  The drinks are reasonably priced and they have a happy hour mini appetizer buffet.  The place is cute and very intimate.  The bartenders are friendly and know their drinks.  Reading other reviews, it seems that the place gets really crowded and noisy.  I recommend avoiding this place on a Friday or during the weekend.
