Follow my advice, come with a bunch of your friends, and stick to "early" happy hour, you'll hopefully enjoy the place.

I'll give this place 4 stars because I come here right after a productive shopping day.  That's probably why I'm always in a good mood at Sugar.
author: Jacquelynne S.

description:
This is your typical happy hour lounge. Nothing spectacular about it. Decent drink/beer prices. They have food at happy hour but it always runs out really quickly. Get there early if you want some...

Hershey's Kisses on the bar is a nice touch, though.
author: Paul B.

description:
If guys are looking for some girls to meet, they should definitely go here.  There are nothing but cute girls in this cute bar.  Unfortunately Sugar does not have any happy hour drink specials yet but do know that girls like snacking...and there are a lot of snacks out.  If you want cheap drinks though, you should go to nearby Jade for their $2 Jade Cocktail and $2 beers and then when that's over go to Sugar for some more hanging out and some food.  

Oh, and there's a private room in the back that can be reserved...
author: Tabatha Y.

description:
Finally, a lounge in my neighborhood! It's a medium sized modern space with yummy cocktails and comfy chairs/couches throughout. Bartenders are very nice and I enjoy the hip/easy going vibe. 

The only thing I can think of to improve is their sound system: TOO MUCH TREBLE, youch!

Other than that, all I have to do is walk across the street to Sugar and ALL IS GOOD.
author: Nenette Y.

description:
Time/Date: 10:30 pm Tuesday.

Type/Quality: A bar/lounge that has a local feel and a relaxed atmosphere. I'm not a big Martini fan so I can't testify to the quality but damn 2 bucks!

Price/Quanity: 2 dollar MARTINI night on Tuesday! They have about 4 or 5 specialties. 

Service/Accesibility: The service is fast but the bar wasn't busy. 

Structure/Ambience: Its has the common SF shape of being a rectangular bar with a good 2/3 of stools and chairs and a sofa towards the rear. The lighting is great, the music isn't too loud: its perfect or a get together between friends. However if you are going to spot hot people in a super posh place sugar will come up a little short. Its decorations are modern but no supe
author: Justin L.

description:
This place raises my shackles for many reasons.

1)$5 cover for a DJ?  Please.  The sound isn't good and the music is not special.

2) Snotty attitude of the staff.  We once got a lecture from the bar back about how we were making his job more difficult by asking to hang onto an empty glass so we could get another glass of water.

3) I guess lots of yelpers like the decor, but to me it feels like a hotel bar.  Slick and impersonal.

Sigh.  It's the closest drinking establishment to my home.  It's a crying shame I don't like it.
author: Leigh A.

description:
Cute little lounge bar that offers awesome happy hour snacks.

Great place to hang out with people after concerts.

Very friendly bartender.

Good drinks but you get much better and surprisingly cheaper cocktails at Absinth across the street.
author: Yuchi C.

description:
I give this place 4 stars because of the following:

1) Close to Davies Hall, good for a before or after symphony tipple (although before tipple = 100% probability bf falls asleep during concert).
2) Close to Davies Hall. Did i already say this?
3) Free munchies. I'll take melted American cheese with my martini anytime. 
4) Cheapest bar that I know of in Hayes Valley. Except Jade at happy hour, which is claustrophobic and inclined to ass grabbings. 
5) Nice bartenders. Most of them, anyway. There is one that looks like Jessica Simpson (how many reviewers have said this already; and does she still work there?), she is really nice.
6) Not a lot of seating. Standing in stilettos makes you look good anyway. Even if you can't walk afterwards.
author: Amy K.

description: A groupon brought us in, a great find! The drinks were sweet and strong, nice atmosphere, the bartender was engaging enough. Will keep it on my list for the next time I'm in town.
author: Heathet B.

description: This place seems like a perfect place to unwind after a dinner date and is located in the "gentrified" and ever-increasingly posh area of Hayes Valley.  I came here after dinner for their Black Friday all-day happy hour prices.  The $5 lemon drop I had was good, but a little on the lemony side, and less on the vodka, though it was still refreshing.  It was a slow night and so there weren't too many people there and the ambiance (the BO coming from the nappy-haired man aside) was just perfect for having a nice after-dinner conversation with my friend.  Their cocktail menu sounds delish, so I'll have to come back to check this out for sure.
author: Ben T.

description:
Nice cozy place.  It's a good place to start off the Friday/ Saturday bar/ lounging evening.  

Only problem is this place can get too cozy later in the evening...and that's not too comfortable.  So definitely recommend coming hear around 10:30ish and leaving by 11:30ish...
author: Alan T.

description:
I had a really good time here, but I think that had more to do with the company I was with than the lounge itself.

Pluses:  
- cool, comfy interior; definitely loungy feeling, which i like
- awesome dj when we were there (saturday)


Minuses:
-  drinks were not great, I hated the champagne and my Captain Morgan and coke was way too strong (I know...some of you wouldn't complain about that!)
-  the place started clearing out at midnight,by 12:30, we were pretty much the only ones there...was it us?

I would give it 2.5 stars cuz of my "minuses", but I had a great time and laughed my ass off, so how can I rate it THAT low?!? (plus you can't do 1/2 stars anyways...)
author: vanessa c.

description:
I don't usually like sweet drinks, but the ones here were awesome.  I had never been to this little spot, but it was cool and really chill.  You could actually talk to the person across the table from you and hear them.  

The place was small, not cramped.  I think you would call it intimate.
author: A K.

description:
Walking in the door my glasses instantly fogged.
I understand a crowd on a Sat nite but this was place was ridiculous.

Hot + crowd + no drink in hand = bee-line for the door

might give another try on a weeknight.
author: Dpb T.

description:
Love this place. How can you not like a place that gives out free food during happy hour. Is this a daily occurance? Anyway great drinks, nice atmosphere, and it's tucked away enough in Hayes valley that you don't run into annoying FiDi or Marina douchebags. And if they're there, it's dark enough and the drinks are strong enough for you to evade them. 

Minus one star because I got the worst hangover of my life after a night here. Exacerbated by the fact I went on a cruise ship the next week, I thought my vestibular system was f-ed up for life. But I'm back on track which means I'll probably be back to Sugar. Maybe just a little bit earlier to eat more nachos so I won't be a hot mess.
author: Betsy V.

description:
Awesome music here, but kind a small space and not really any place to dance, so a bit frustrating.  Interesting cocktails, but definitely more on the sweet side, which makes sense given the name.  Big bonus if you know anyone driving, it's super easy to park outside.

Also, there was a birthday crowd here and I think bday boy was a little bit too drunk.  I was afraid he was going to hurl on me.  If his friends weren't smart enough to take him home, the bouncer should've made him leave.
author: Olivia T.

description: Came here for a friend's company's winter party. The place is a bit small, but the crowd that showed up was phenomenal. The drinks, alcohol and sugar, were a deadly combination. Nice place, and a great bar to hang out in.
author: Gurpreet S.

description: I wish I could go here everyday, but I believe my liver would disapprove.  The space is cool; modern and intimate.  The specialty drinks are delicious and the free appetizers are a plus.  It's a perfect place to go after work and before dinner in Hayes Valley.
author: Sandy K.

description: Get the PEAR BEAR! One of the more delicious cocktails I've had. Perfect strength and amount of pear flavor. I'll definitely be back when it's happy hour though....I can't believe I missed all the free food and specials. Another reason to come to Hayes Valley :D
author: Kelley N.

description:
Came in for a drink before Absinthe opened up for the Cocktail Week party last night.  Nice, intimate space with cushy, suede-like benches.

Happy hour drinks were pretty reasonable for the area, and they offered serve-yourself nachos!  They kept the cheese melted in a crock pot.  They also served fresh veggies with ranch dressing and some sort of spicy burrito roll bites that had salami, hot peppers, cheese and other stuff.  

When we came back several hours later for one last round after Absinthe closed, the bartender totally remembered our drink order from earlier in the evening.  That's good service.
author: brewgirl b.

description:
Went to Sugar Lounge last Sat. evening, it was pouring outside so the place was a little empty. I liked the space, it was slick, dark and cool but the plushy seats were comfy. 

DRINK: OMG, strong as freakin' hell...but I couldn't tell till we left. I ordered the Alomnd Joy thinking, this would be easy to handle. Mind you it was quite delicious so I was fooled. Definately worth the price.

SERVICE: Bartenders in hot dresses, mixing drinks for ya...now that is an unusual sight. I thought they were a little cold for such an empty night, considerning most bartenders tend to be social butterflies. I like butterflies..

Happy Hour Snackies...Sweet!
I'll be back for more..
author: Venatius P.

description:
This is one of those places that falls into the category of .... "it could have been a lot better if."

- The bench seats were not so short
- The drink names were not so cheesy
- The back room was more private
- There were more stools along the left wall
- The decor was a little more thorough
- The Collateral was not so poorly designed

Not a bad place to get a drink but I won't be dragging anyone here anytime soon.
author: Jeremy R.

description: Right near my job...has a great happy hour. tends to  get a little crowded...not many seats. good specialty drinks.
author: Carla P.

description: Nice little funky lounge. Stopped in before dinner at Jardiniere to have a couple of their $5 drink specials. Bartender was very friendly. It was Monday night so it was really slow, but I would bet it's a happening spot on a weekend night.
author: S. C.

description:
Sugar,

I've been thinking of you.  The lights wrapped around the poles of your awning are a siren's call, seducing me.  As I enter you I touch your couches--ooo, are these suede?  So comfortable, so relaxing.  

I'm served a Mojito.  It's so refreshing, just the right amount of mint.  What's this?  You've invited friends?  You've served them an Old Fashion and a X-Rated Kiss.  They smile as they enjoy your drinks.

I'm fascinated with the painting on your wall.  The enamel curves of black and red, flowing on a tin bed.

You're lighting creates the perfect ambiance,  Soft lights behind a mica shade.  The candles lit throughout your lounge.  Perfect.

I give to you, Sugar, a piece of myself.  When times are lonely, or when I'm with another lounge, I will think of you with fond memories.  I will fantasize for the time when we will be together again.  

I lust for you, Sugar.
author: Jay B.

description:
Sugar is good when The Jade Bar is packed and there is no place to sit in that hot, humid shoebox of a bar. 


They do have a nice bathroom most of the time; and the seating is not bad if you get there before it's packed. I never do.
author: Dustin H.

description: OMG...can't believe that they have a cocktail called " 41-Year Old Virgin". Seriously this drink is created specially for all those virgins past the age of 40.  I came here last Friday night and it seems like they have a pretty chill crowd with decent prices for all their drinks. I would definitely come back here for thier daily drink specials for $5 all night long, which is a pretty good deal for a bar or lounge in the Hayes Valley.
author: Lu Lu L.

description:
From the outside this place looks perfect. It has that chicago vibe. You expect to walk in and find someone singing, playing the piano or on a viola playing some jazz.

You come in and find it loud with people trying to be heard. Cute seating on the sides and overpriced drinks. The prices wouldnt be so bad if there was more to the ambiance than low lights and seating.

If you are looking for a dressed up dive bar, with nice tenders...this is ur place. Me, I'll go where the duck looks like a duck and take my need for libations elsewhere.
author: H B.

description:
Actually a pretty cool local hang out...only thing they're missing is a couple plasmas to watch the games on...but then again, what Hayes Valley bar has a plasmsa? .....exactly. At least you don't have to wade through the half-dead blue-hairs here to get a drink.

The bartenders are actually very cool. And free happy hour apps! And a frickin' Happy Hour to begin with! Christ! What more do you want??!!
author: Scott N.

description:
A little gem in Hayes Valley.

This small place is the perfect size bar for Hayes Valley. If you're not looking for the packed scene in the marina or over on Polk, this place is a great alternative.  Additionally, the barstaff is nice and the bar offers simple but very good apps during happy hour.  

Drinks are good and it doesn't take 10 minutes to get one.  the mojito I tasted was good and my vodka soda was a good pour. 

I'll certainly come back here for another happy hour when I don't feel like battling the crowds in the marina.
author: Doug C.

description:
Nice and quite during the happy hour. it's cozy and not over crowded.
drinks are nice and it serves free appetizer during happy hour. 
will encore

gotta go there at night later!
author: Florence C.

description: Sugar is a sweet spot. Ok-sorry for the lame pun, but It just couldn't be helped. I am happy I decided to have my birthday gathering at sugar instead  of Le Colonial. A little unknown secret- Sugar does not have a "minimum charge" or "table service", but will still reserve you a table! I needed to have somewhere to put the cupcakes I bought (which no one ate!), and was surprised to find two large tables waiting for me when I arrived! I think sugar may be one of my new favorite places, and I loved, loved loved the bartenders!
author: Michelle K.

description: They have interesting cocktails, a DJ that doesn't suck, and lots of comfy chairs and couches.  Went on a busy Friday night and the crowd was a good mix of people.  The wait for drinks at the bar was a bit longer than it should have been but my vodka tonic was pretty strong to make up for it.
author: Nina L.

description: Sugar, sugar!  Very chic and full of delightfully sweet libations.  I must admit I'm a light weight and didn't even finish the one drink I ordered, but I sure did a good job licking all the sweet tangy flavored sugar off the martini glass rim.  Thanks to Ari C. for finishing off my drink even though she ended up barfing it all out later on.
author: Maria L.

description: Go here for the happy hour. Great prices on drinks and there's always different types of free food also. Chicken Teriyaki, Tempura, Veggies, Chips, just to name a few. It's also nice that this place is relatively close to my work. On a side note, the place does seem to get darker as the night wears on. Not sure if it was me or their lightling.
author: Ajay K.

description:
An okay place for happy hour if you work in the area, I will not recommend it as a destination for a fun night out. The cocktails are okay, the bartenders are not particularly friendly, and the place lacks soul in general. 

Jade Bar or Cav are better alternatives if you are looking for a bar/lounge in Hayes Valley.
author: Mathew L.

description:
The cocktails are mixed well, and free appetizers during Happy Hour are such a nice bonus (clarification: good free appetizers), but I'm never the person in our group that says, "Let's go to Sugar, y'all!" The music tends to be non-descript lounge, which suits the atmosphere well.

The waitstaff tends to be a bit slow if you're sitting on the couches - it might behoove you to sit at the bar if at all possible, or at the very least order directly from the bar.

I've normally been here for happy hours that have seen the place populated but not packed. I did stop in once on a Friday evening to find wall-to-wall people, but the bar was still accessible and drinks were decently quick to be had.

For a bar with a good-but-not-extensive liquor selection, fair-but-not-great prices and a comfortable-but-not-cozy vibe, I don't dislike Sugar at all, but I always find myself wanting to like it a lot more than I actually do when I'm there.
author: Ash A.

description:
Speaking from the new to the city, new to being single black man's perspective .....

Sugar Lounge was more than comfortable. 

When its Saturday night and you wanna hang on the wall sip a drink and head nod all by your lonely you can mos def do that here. 
When its Saturday night and you wanna guzzle a drink  , work up your nerve and throw your best two step out there, you can mos def do that here.
author: Geoffrey V.

description:
Decent neighborhood spot.  Nice lighting, good use of space in an otherwise small venue.  However decor is sparse and looks unfinished.  I'm also unsure where the name "Sugar" comes from as there is no relation to it in the decorations.  Bartenders were unable to make popular, simple drinks (not sure whether this has to do with restrictions on their permit, lack of a backbar, or poor bartenders...though all are equally unappealing in a nightspot).  

Also, the DJ was the only person into the music being spun (and I'm a pretty musically open-minded person).
author: l s.

description:
Nice place. The DJ doesn't know who Roger Sanchez is :

Can you play some Roger Sanchez? 

Ummm, who? I don't have any (with an attitude like I don't know what the fuck I'm talking about!)
author: some g.

description: Tasty sweet drinks, with some comfy and dimly lit couches to drink them on.  On a weeknight, it was nearly empty, which was great, but with just enough folks around to provide a nice festive atmosphere. The bartender was friendly and helpful when asked.
author: Steve S.

description: We used the Sugar Lounge for a private function.  They were very accommodating, the atmosphere was perfect, the sangria was delicious, and overall the party was a success, in no small part due to their great staff and location. Christopher, the chef, did an excellent job, both with the food and the timing.  I would not hesitate to use them again!
author: Kristi K.

description: Very sweet, pretty space... sugary in a nutshell. Free appetizers (including hot food) during happy hour from 4-7, which also serves up $4 wells and $3 beers.  A lovely little lounge-y atmosphere in Hayes Valley if lounges are your thing. I loved the free apps and decent prices on drinks, hated having to sit up straight on a backless stool.
author: margot b.

description: Came in on a Thursday, for happy hour.  While I didn't have any of their signature house cocktails, the bartender prepared my usual whiskey concoction with potency.  It wasn't overly crowded, and they have free appetizers for the happy hour crowd, and I don't mean a bunch of stale pretzels either, but rather, some decent stuff to tide you over until dinner.  They're located right in the midst of Hayes Valley, so it's a good place to stop in a for pre-dinner drinks, if dining out in that area.
author: Damon Z.

description: This place is cool, kinda small like most sf bar/lounges but cool bartenders. The music is meh....dude was playing stunna shades to fergie. mash up heaven. Beat it with Push it? word. The drinks were pretty good, I guess, after you have 5 or 6 they all taste somewhat good. The ambience is cool, nice lighting, a little room to dance, or battle. Bathroom was actually pretty clean for a bar. That was a highlight. Oh and the chocolates on the bar, although they seemed like they were there for a while since they melted the second I picked some up.
author: Jhoe G.

description: Get there before 6pm Sun-Fri and try the hor'sdeouvres with your happy hour well drink. I had the Lolita with tequilla and had enough of the quesadilla to feel that solid "Hey...I'm having a good time for a Wed. humpday!" It is kind of a small space and there is a mixed group of folks I guess hanging out.
author: miriam b.

description: Who needs to be in the marina when you got a place like this, sugar offers the same experience on a very different level, plenty of class and style. Perfect for marinating and drinking.
author: Stanley K.

description: Great place to chill and get a drinks. Very high-quality cocktails, lounge-y vibe and good music.
author: Amar R.

description: My first and only experience at Sugar was really nice...A girlfriend and I headed over there after having burgers at Absinthe, around 7:20  on a Thursday, just in time for the tail end of their great happy hour.  They had free food out and cheap drinks, the bar staff was super friendly, smiling, no attitude.  It was a great place to kick it at the bar and chit chat.  There was a birthday party going on, but that didn't make the place too crowded, they were kind enough to offer us some cake.  I will definitely go back and try one of their sugary cocktails and more than likely spend more time trying to lick the sugar off the rim than actually enjoying the drink.  This was a fun place...Maybe I hit it at the right time on the right night.
author: ellyk E.

description: More like Sour,Bland, no taste,no flavor, no fuego,no amore , no mas, no mas, no mas......
author: Teddy d.

description:
I've been talking about the watermelon martini I had there for 3 weeks now. SO GOOD!!! I'm not usually into super sweet drinks but I wanted something refreshing and easy to drink so the bartender suggested a watermelon martini. It was made with real watermelon juice...even got a little white seed in there. It was perfect, refreshing, smooth, and so easy to drink. 

they also had little tapas by the bar that were free!

This is a great spot to bring your girlfriends or a date that doesn't mind the name...hopefully you wouldn't date someone who care anyway!! I love this little spot.
author: Summer C.

description: Sugar's a great neighborhood spot during the week for happy hour and/or evening drinks with friends.  One Friday first date night, many moons ago, my new "friend" and I tried to have a drink at Absinthe across the street.  Of course, they poo-poo'd us slackers in our jeans and told us it would be an hour long wait for a spot at the bar, so we went to Sugar.  This was my first foray into Sugar on the weekend.  To make a long story longer, we spent half the night dancing with some B&T marrieds in their 40's to Prince and Bel Biv Devoe (because said guy on date LIKED it).  Needless to say, date night was a bust, and I no longer frequent Sugar on Fridays and Saturdays, but Sun-Thurs is fine.
author: Laura S.

description: One of the better happy hours around since they have some free bites. This is my go to bar for Hayes Valley. I've ended up here many times and always enjoy my experience. The bartenders are excellent, the place is clean, good bathrooms, good music and an overall nice crowd. I know it gets crowded sometimes, but what place doesn't.
author: Corey V.

description: nice looking bar...that's about it....
author: Hen A.

description:
like this place a lot - it's close to work, has a happy hour with little nibbles, and has a nice vibe. my male friend was excited at how many women were there and says when he moves back from barcelona, he's going to go there every night. :)

drinks are fun and it doesn't seem to get *too* crowded if you're there for the post-work happy hour, though seating is limited.
author: sylvia c.

description: Standard fare.  Airport lounge.  Everyone looks the same.  Most people pretend to be from out of town.  The bartenders are untrained and uncaring about the quality of their servitude - can't make a mojito to save their asses.  Too small, too crowded, too pretentious for what it is.  Do yourself a favor if you go to Sugar Lounge:  leave, cross the street and have a Ginger Rogers at Absinthe.  That's what I did.
author: Jessica M.

description: This place is such a breath of fresh air for the hood on Hayes.  I had my birthday drank on here and we all loved it.  The drinks were delicious, the space was delovely and location was divine.  My only qualm was, damn it gets crowded.
author: A P.

description:
"what's the matter, Daddy?  c'mon and save my soul!  i need a lil' sugar in my bowl...i ain't foolin'--i want some sugar in my bowl!"

hayes valley is an awesome little neighborhood that i never really ended up in until my final days in sf.  sugar is a great little bar in said awesome little neighborhood, and i totally dug it.  i went during a genart event, so i didn't get an accurate representation of the normal clientele, but i did really like the space and the ambience.  oh, the drinks were good too :).
author: Roshni R.

description: The Bartenders are very cool and make some unique and great drinks. The music was also really good. Started out chill and got dirtier as the night wore on...
author: Nicolas H.

description: went here after work on a rainy day and it was a little bit cramped but free finger food and cheap happy hour drinks.  There were a couple rooms in the back with couches as well as a flooded toilet (hopefully not a common occurrence).
author: David T.

description:
the late-night crowd can be strange. it's definitely better for happy hour. there was quite a bit of sniff sniff going on in the bathroom when we went. i guess when things are that dead you need to entertain yourself somehow. the DJ looked like the mohawk guy from black eyed peas, which is not a bad thing.

conclusion: good for happy hour, not happening at pretty much any other hour unless you have party favors *sniff sniff*
author: Christine V.

description: Drinks were good and strong and the lighting was lovely. It was really quiet, but what can you expect on a Wednesday night?  My only gripe is that the place smelled like a huge car air freshener. Kinda weird.
author: Zoeboe D.

description:
we were walking down hayes looking for a place to chill and have a beer. every place seemed like so much more than what we were feelin. we glanced up and saw sugar. it looked cool enough from the outside, so we decided to see if it was the same on the inside. the ambiance inside was perfect. kinda dark, cool music and most importantly...they had beer! what was even more fabulous is that we got there during happy hour! YAY our beers were only $3 each! 

sugar isn't a very big bar and has pretty limited seating. lucky for us we spotted seats in the way back which was even more fantastic because we were able to sit and chat more intimately without having a bunch of people around us. the service at the bar was fast and the bartender was really friendly. 

this was definitely a good find!
author: Kristin Y.

description: I tried this place because I heard they have free Hershey's kisses(what girl can resist chocolate). I should have known better.... chocolate= ploy to get unsuspecting customers. I didn't like the decor, the crowd, service, or drinks. I didn't even finish my drink I wanted out soo badly.
author: Stacy F.

description: Newly opened Sugar Lounge occupies Hayes and Vine's old space, which remains warm and welcoming. Enclaves for cozy parties sit in front and back with a long bar in between. I don't know if they'll keep doing it, but they had a long table of tasty snacks (warm tofu and veggies,  cheese, and nuts) that nearly saved my life after a long work day last week. The wine, less so--only two red choices, but I think they're expanding the list. A friend had a mojito that she liked well enough, and another friend  had one of their specialty cuban cocktails that ended up being way too sugary. The bartender the night we were theree was clueless and slow, but overall we had a good experience and would go back.
author: Gretchen T.

description:
doof-neno-doof-neno-doof-neno-doof-neno
doof-doof-doof-doof
neno-neno-neno-neno

(that kind of place)
author: Laura B.

description: Sugar is very inviting and comfortable. The night I went (it was a Saturday) it wasn't too crowded but there were definitely enough people so that it didn't feel like I was the only person in the bar. It's a bit pricey but there aren't many bars in the city that are cheap. Also, the candy as bar snacks is a cute and unique touch. BTW....the passion fruit mojitos are to die for....they are sooooooo delicious and I don't even like mojitos.
author: Annie M.

description:
What sells this place for me are the drinks.  With an always changing menu of in-house created specialties by one of the best unknown mixologists in the city, you will never be disappointed by the signature cocktails.  

Sugar is my little early evening/weekday secret.  This place gets crazy on weekend nights so it becomes a little less my scene - but for those of you that love a good DJ, Saturday's guy is effortlessly smooth at creating a great mood.  

So treat your tastebuds to a few true professional bartenders - there to make sure your drinks are big and strong and move on to the next person - because on the weekend that's about all the time they get.
author: Josh S.

description: Talk about neck-of-the-woods... Sugar is right next door since I have graciously completed my move to Hayes Valley. It still, however, doesnt quite the 'neighborhood' bar profile - but is a good place for some savory drinks and free chicken teriyaki. During bar rush hour, it can get really busy and can be difficult to find a seat (or even stand), leaving aside buying a drink. Try a wednesday evening first - its pretty relaxing nevertheless.
author: Sav B.

description: I've gone to this place several times; I always try to go to someplace multiple times before giving it a horrible review.  Pretty hum-drum lounge, the drinks are okay, but the brown-haired woman bartender is one of the rudest people I've ever encountered.  Really weird cos all the times I've been there it hasn't been busy and the customers have been really chill.  She just totally ruins the ambiance.
author: Chris R.

description: The sugar that coats the rim of the glasses are flavored, people- the quite delicious passion fruit mojito had mint flavored sugar, the chocotini sugar was coffee flavored. Yum. It was roughly 1000 degrees inside when I went and totally packed, so hence the loss of a star.
author: Noelle Q.

description: This is a cute upscale spot.  Yes, I did use cute and upscale in the same freakin' sentence.  I also should have thrown in little too...because the joint is tiny but I loved the funky dance music the dj was spinning and as an aspiring interior designer I must say the decor was delicious. Although when I first walked in I thought I should be sporting something sleek and black but I knew I was on point  in my sexy teal top when I heard a gay man say 'ooo look what she has on'!  Girlfriend you are looking good tonight too!
author: Kim M.

description: Cozy little lounge that serves free(!) appetizers during the HH.  This bitch is all over free shit, so I come here often to fill up enough to skip dinner.  If you go early, you can easily snag a couple of small tables to accomodate six people. (Our after work HH once crammed 15 people in the back.)  I prefer this cute place over nearby Jade anyday.
author: Lisa C.

description:
Great interior and space to hang if you can see past the "bartender" and her low-class act and worse attitude:  I would go back if I knew she were no longer there.  This is a gold mine for the owners but they need to observe their employees.

Went on a Thursday night: no crowd, nice low lighting, low music.  Very good spot to get to know a date.  Except, don't expect to get a fast drink if you get the bartender we encountered.  

Walked in at 9.  The classy bartender "greeted" us by announcing with her mouth full "oops, caught me having dinner" as she stood behind the bar shoveling pasta salad into her face from a gallon-sized plastic container.

She either knew the few couples at the bar or was trying hard to make friends as she continually made "witty/catty" comments to them throughout the night.  We finally obtained a first round of drinks after 5 to 10 minutes of waiting for her to get to business as she entertained her audience.

For the next round, I stood waiting for another 10 minutes while she slowly put together someone else's martini.  I ordered a beer and a house specialty drink prominently advertised on the billboard above the bar.  As she squeezed strawberries for juice, she derisively commented to one of her fans "this is coming off the menu - what a pain!"  Um - you are a bartender which entails making bar drinks.

Later watched as a group of two Asian couples stand near the bar considering whether to stay:  bartender failed to greet them but continued texting on phone as she had throughout night.  When they decided to leave instead of order drinks (and spend $$!), the bartender announced to her subjects "guess it wasn't their kind of place".  

Like I said:  classy.
author: Paul B.

description: First it was so crowded we couldn't even get to the bar to order, so we left.  Then we came back later and the place was practically empty.  Weird.  Decor was neat though, down to the tiered tray of Hershey's kisses.
author: spiff e.

description: This is a pretty cool lounge, a decent choice to go hang out with friends and have a few drinks. It's not so loud you can't talk although seating is a bit limited (but if you get there early enough you're golden in terms of that). The crowd is pretty fun overall and the drinks are pretty good and not unreasonable in terms of price. Plus, the neighborhood is fun in general with quite a few other options around. I'm not completely in love with Sugar Lounge but I like it and have been back a few times, so it must be ok!
author: Amber P.

description:
I've given Sugar Lounge so many chances. It's usually dead and when it's not it's overrun by people who think that overpriced drinks and a totally indefensible cover charge are the perfect accessory to their Rockin' Republic jeans. In fact, the only time I can really enjoy this place is if I'm there when none of the normal clientele are.

But last night was the final straw. I went there with a group of friends after our friend's wedding. First, they were charging a cover, which is totally absurd, but let in all the women in our party for free. Note to management: The last thing Sugar Lounge needs is more women. Ladies, take note, you're not going to meet any guys in this crowd. 

Now, in the past I've at least been able to count on getting a decent drink at Sugar -- its one redeeming quality. But the well vodka the bartender used to make my vodka last night was the worst-tasting vodka I can remember ever drinking, except the cheap shit in huge bottles we drank in college when we had no money. And that stuff cost as much for the big bottle as the single crappy, overpriced drink I had last night. 

And today I feel like ass. I blame Sugar Lounge.
author: Allison B.

description: A great find for Happy Hour and it's only 3 blocks from work.  Free Food:  teriyaki chicken, tempura, quesadillas, chips & salsa, veggies, candy and more.  A few of my coworkers and I have been here before, but we thought we'd introduce this place to a new batch of 15+ colleagues & friends this past Friday.  The only downside is that it's a little dark and the only happy hour specials are the beer & well drinks.  But the prices are still reasonable, my lemon drop was $5.
author: Stacey L.

description: I enjoyed this place and think they did a good job remodeling it from the old Hayes and Vine. Hayes Valley needed a few more watering holes. They have Black Cherry Effen Vodka there that I tried for the 1st time and it was quite delish. Truth be told, I liked it more b/c I got a kick out of asking for the "F-n Vodka" than anything ;)
author: Samira S.

description: I loved Sugar Lounge last night. It is in a great part of town with lots of cool shops and eateries. My drink (whiskey/soda) was nice and strong and cost only 4 bucks which is really cheap. There was a nice crowd and the service was fast and friendly. They even serve some appetizers - just veggies and corn chips with dips but it was nice to nosh on something while enjoying my cocktail.  The interior is nice - I liked the modern lighting fixtures and the wall counter, there is also plenty of seating.
author: Flower P.

description:
I stumbled across this place while coming from Heaven's Dog one Friday night and decided to stop in an check it out.  

It's a pretty cool lounge. I love the atmosphere, decor and the DJ wasn't too bad.  Upon seeing the place I knew my girlfriend at the time would love it. And she did when I took her there.   I would have gave Sugar 4 stars but the bartender was getting our drinks wrong to the point where I had to have him re-make them. 

Overall a cool place to chill out and have a couple of cocktails.
author: Terrel R.

description: they serve free food on weekdays only (or so they tell me). i know this bc i held an event here on a sunday and paid over $250 for the food, which the "regular" bar patrons brazenly ate despite signs saying "reserved." if you are a regular, wouldn't you know they don't have free food on weekends? then they were surprised i was upset. i have been to sugar multiple times and find it a cool chill place, with good happy hour prices. just the above occurrence left a bad residue. warning to future event planners to plan accordingly!
author: Helen K.

description:
The attack of the clones has, unfortunately, caused this neighborhood great to fall in ratings.  These days, one has to be there at extremely non-mainstream hours in order to avoid:
- being run over by overly aggressive A-type business types out to show their co-workers on friday night that they can "hang" (hell yeah...and be sure to tape the obnoxious commentary on any and all things not germane to me by the end of the night, after the coke's passed around!  When did these freaks move here from the financial district and union square?)
- having to catch tottering asian chicks in 6" heels unable to hold more than a drink and a half, and then proceeding to ruin YOUR buzz by issuing high pitched giggles throughout the evening.  Over nothing deserving it.  Trust me.
- being bored to death by "events" like going-away do's that involve seemingly heartfelt speeches from EVERY fucking person attending.
- hyper-expensive-jeans-with-striped-shirts-hanging-out members of the male order out to make sure that any possibly single woman with a pulse is well acquainted with the top 10 worst pick up lines in the history of humanity.  

R.I.P., oh glory days of Sugar Lounge.
author: Godot -.

description: It's just what Hayes Valley ordered...a lounge/bar to take over the former, very stuffy, Hayes & Vine wine bar!  I like it!  The drinks are tasty, the staff is friendly, and they have a little spread of fun bites during happy hour!  Great for before or after dinner at one of Hayes Valley's fine eateries!
author: Sarah D.

description:
I was in the Valley of the Hayes meetin' ups with the friends of college days gone by. We settled on Sugar located at the old Hayes & Vine spot. It's a dark, comfy little lounge space featuring specialty drinks, some pre-dinner edibles and a dj spinning ambient beats (DJ's great here). Nice place to meet up with peeps for happy hour and share the latest life goin's ons. I settled on a drink I think called the Helsinki 99 or something like that. The big attraction was that it had Champers, Chambord and some other cocktail mashup. The bar had run out of Chambord, a WTF moment for sure, because if I don't get my Louis the XIVth berry nectar of the gods as advertised I'm likely to go into Tony Soprano mode. The barkeep scrambled to come up with an alternative, "How 'bout we try with some Absolute Currant?" Blech! Blech! Blech! Sure and we can rename it Splitting Headache!! To his credit he made something else far more interesting.

The place is owned by the Hahns Hibachi crew, who have done a great job of creating the lounge atmosphere. The bartenders could be more attentive toward clientele not sitting at the bar. Sweep the room occasionally picking up empties and take drink orders. Hint: you make more money that way.

3 yelpstars for location and ambiance. Otherwise head to Place Pigalle.
author: Johnny C.

description: I stopped in for a drink with some friends the other night.  The decor is great and the drinks are pretty tasty. It's a perfect spot for a pre-dinner drink or to take a date (nice dim lighting). It's not really a place to meet people, fairly empty for a Friday night.  Overall the place is pretty cool.
author: Vanessa A.

description: Drinks here are DIVINE.  I could suck down at least 10 of them in one night.  Maybe I have already...who keeps count after about 7 anyways?
author: Julie N.

description: This joint is kinda small, but there were actually plenty of seats available for friday happy hour which is IMPOSSIBLE anywhere downtown.  For that this place is AOK in my book (not that have I've written one).  Gotta love the free food.  I got egg rolls, tempura, teriyaki chicken, veges, chips/salsa, and high rollers all for the price of a $3 beer.
author: Law C.

description:
stars for best happy hour food :  shrimp/veggie tempura, chips/salsa, veggies/dip, hot teriyaki  chicken.... and it's FREE [while supplies last, usually done by 6]

drinks pretty restrictive tho - none of the fancy mixed drinks are anything off during happy hour, and i'm not much of a beer person.... =(
author: S V.

description:
Major cute, yet modern and masculine decor makes Sugar Lounge a mellow place to chill, relax, and grab a snack. 

The place needs a bigger range of coffees and other non-alcoholic drinks, but the cool fireplace makes up for it.

Oh, and the place has free wi-fi. Perfect for writing that novel, checking your email, or surfing porn in public.
author: Chanpory R.

description: A little crowded, can't really say that there was anything wrong with the place, it was pleasant if not memorable.  I can see how it'd be a cool neighborhood bar, but wouldn't make it a destination.
author: Mike U.

description: Very excited to have this place right across the street from me.  A great addition to the neigbourhood.  In keeping with it's 'lounge' labelling, it's dark, sleek and mordern.  They don't have a wine list yet, so I can't comment on that.  Bartenders were friendly and attentive.  Decor is similar to other lounges like Bambuddha or Living Room, but this place is much smaller and cozier.
author: Rudro S.

description: Pour some sugar on me! Def Leppard would have serenaded this lounge. Drinks were delicious and the vibe is chill. It's a great place to grab a drink before a show on Performance Row.
author: Y C.

description: I didn't really like Sugar.  I was expecting great happy hour options from the reviews, but all they had were $4 wells and $3 beers, no special cocktail that was on sale.  Also, their free food, was a veggie plate, chips and salsa, and cream cheese roll ups.  Also, not what I was hoping for.  The bar itself is really cool, and the drink list looked really good, but as none of those were on sale I stuck to a rum and diet, then headed over to Jade for a real happy hour.
author: Sarah M.

description: I tried to look for a not-so-sweet drink on their menu and it was a pretty challenging task.  The drinks are on the sweet side and a tad overpriced, but still tasty.  The thing that bugged was that it was a mellow Tuesday night and I just wanted to catch up with a friend over some drinkies... but the DJ had the music on so loud, we had to yell the entire time!
author: Miranda S.

description: 3 stars for free appetizers.  3 stars for the 3 love shacks i had.   4 stars for the bathroom...it's FAB!  The staff was super cool...not cold, which is always nice. Though I felt like the youngest person there.. Kinda strange to find in this city...kinda a relief!
author: Liz V.

description: This bar is GREAT! I came here on my birthday a couple weeks ago and i was not disappointed! It was my first time but I read many reviews on yelp, so we decided to check it out! First of all, its SUPER cute and pink inside! Yup, I am a total girly girl so I fell in love with it! We came during happy hour, which btw, they have an awesome happy hour! They also have daily specials, I think the day we went it was $5 PBR and a shot of whiskey! They still had not changed the sign outside from the day before about the Watermelon long island, and when I asked about it, the bartender still made one for me AND gave it to me on the house for my birthday! Wow, I never thought I would get a free drink in SF! ABove the bar there are mirrors with TONS of cool drinks they make! Everything from margs, mojitos, cocktails and martinis!  The bartenders are SUPER nice and friendly! I would recommend this place for anyone who wants a good deal during happy hour! I will def be back soon! :)
author: Melissa B.

description: Definitely a good place to go with sexy decor and pleasant bartenders. What a rare combination! The dj was playing good, loungey music, and you could still have a conversation without yelling into people's ears. I don't live in the neighborhood, but would certainly make a special trip back. I was impressed.
author: Ann F.

description: Finally made it to Sugar last weekend. What an improvement this place is over the stuffy winebar that occupied the space before -  that  wine bar was full of dot-commers left over from 1999 still wearing their blue B.R. dress shirts and pleated Dockers...Hallejuah, I say! Stopped by with some friends after an art opening in the Tenderloin. Lots of pretty people with rosy cheeks, glowing skin and skintight Habitual jeans. The bar staff was a sweet as can be. I love that this bar is small and cozy with intimate sofa seating. I have my eye on the reserved back room for my next girls night out! You know what Mary Poppins says, a spoon full of Sugar...
author: Stephanie ..

description: I've never had a drink in Hayes Valley despite the number of times I've driven through here. But the free cocktails for Genart members didn't hurt.   The bar is actually a cool little spot, although I would probably have a better guage on this place on a nite when it's a bit more crowded. But, good company always makes for a good time, and everybody I met was friendly.
author: Srinivas R.

description: The drinks are good, the location is nice, the ambiance is great, but the service I've had here has been pretty bad with an air of elitism. Not sure why this place would have that attitude, but I've never been treated nicely by a bartender here.
author: Monika M.

description:
Went to Sugar on Saturday night for the first time.  

Positives:  Yummy cocktails, crowd was fine (mostly female though)

Negatives:  DJ was terrible!  It was also super hot in the place, everyone in my group was dripping in sweat within minutes of walking in.
author: K V.

description: Small bar, but great fun. I love the drinks.. a little overpriced, but they have a great happy hour stocked with yummy treats and appetizers. The bartenders are very friendly and the crowd is very chill.
author: Tricia M.

description: Nice little place to go and grab a drink.  I got here around ten thirty or so last night to meet some people for a birthday party.  By about 11 the back of the bar started getting packed and the DJ started playing cheesy hip hop music.  It didn't seem to blend well with the location and we took off soon after that.  But the staff was very friendly and I will try the place again sometime.
author: Tom K.

description: Maybe I am getting old, but actually I don't remember a time in my life when I would have liked a place like this.  I give the people watching 5 stars, because most of the crowd was a joke, doesn't the Marina have its own bars where people can spend daddy's money?  This place was packed, and the bartenders seemed like they hardly even noticed.  Whoever designed that place did a great job giving the two bartenders and the bar back more room than on the other side for the patrons.  C'mon!!!  They should have no more than 2 feet back there.  I hope that I will never be dragged back to this place, I prefer to stay in Oakland where I don't have to pay $11 for a drink.
author: Jonathan U.

description: My friend Ally and I love hitting this place after work for the happy hour special: free appetizers! (and lots of them) It's not really a party spot but its a perfect meeting place for an after work get together. I'd give it 5 stars if it had more seating. Finding a place to sit can be challenging.
author: Bonnie B.

description:
Not bad, not bad at all... sleek with a sort of "Oh, this old thing, I just rolled out of bed and *fell* into it" kind of look (for instance, the art on the wall has this bizarre found art/hardware installation kind of look to it - cool, but maybe trying too hard).

The drinks were good - with some creative uses of the dangerously flavorful Kaffir Lime and Mandarin Orange Hangar Ones... 

Strong drinks, good vibe - why only three stars, Anj?  Because the bartenders NEVER SMILED.  Seriously.  Maybe once when we left, and that might have only been because we were blocking their view of the art.  Talk about a buzz kill.
author: Anjali K.

description: Came here with a bachelorette party on a Saturday evening. There were people in the bar, but not overcrowded. The atmosphere is cute, and both martinis I ordered were t-a-s-t-y!! They are $10/piece, but they are a large-sized martini...so it's worth it!
author: Anne A.

description: Tasteful atmosphere, good selection of Vodka and a pretty cool and diverse crowd. I guess in SF this is considered "upscale" and I guess it could be called that. The drinks were well made and it was nice to not be overwhelmed with with a poorly mixed drink that seems common at many places around town. My friends and I had a great time there and I would most certainly return.
author: Gabriel R.

description: The drinks are tasty and strong, and they always have chocolate goodies on the bar. Yum.
author: Vandana M.

description: Free buffet happy hour = four stars automatically. I can't believe some of the ridiculous complaints that other readers have. If free food can't make you happy, go take a hike.
author: bonnie b.

description: Definitely a girly setting... my friends and I raved about the Hershey's kisses in martini glasses (OMGCHOCOLATEATABAR!), the mauve-colored walls, and well, the girly drink selection.  It's a cozy little space with well-mixed drinks.  I'd love to know where they got the cool glass sculptures serving as light fixtures -- they're really cool.
author: Nat K.

description: Really cute little lounge in Hayes Valley. Great DJ, cool vibe. Great spot to grab drinks with friends if you're in the 'hood.
author: Sarah R.

description:
stumbled upon this lounge on my way to rickshaw for the pipettes show.  wanted a place to grab a quick drink between dinner and the show.  it was pretty chill and the sconces remind me of chihuly's glasswork.  the down tempo tunes kinda evoked the late-90's to me.  

looks like that have a little bar of nibbles for happy hour.  unfortunately i got there after the happiness.  all in all, a decent place to grab a drink and leave.  i don't see myself lounging too long mostly because of the music.
author: Sharlene C.

description: I went to Sugar after a large dinner, so I refuse to give extra stars for the happy hour apps that everyone is raving about. I liked the ambiance here - warm lighting and very cozy. I love when I can actually lounge at lounges.
author: Valerie N.

description: My new favorite bar.  Love the sugar theme, love that it is small and dark, and love the fun drinks.  Each time I've gone, I've returned the next night. Now that's love.
author: shoba d.

description: Friend of a friend had her 30th birthday bash here and rented out the space. Great space for an intimate party - enough to accomodate all your friends. Had a fun time. In Hayes Valley near Absinthe.
author: Jeanne C.

description: I feel kind of bad for taking my cool friends here. We were nearby though. And they have good scotch. The bar looks cool, but I wouldn't say this place is. I guess they can't choose their clientele.
author: Sahra H.

description:
this is a cool shwanky bar in hayes valley. slick decor yet doesnt feel overly pretentious. the drinks we got were super good. pretty pricey at 8$ a piece, but pretty much everything i tasted was hella delicious. this place'll be a nice to place to get a drink when i want a change from going to place pigalle all the time.

(my resolution this year is to visit 50 new bars in SF.  read about it at: http://fiftybars.thisisvlad.com)
author: vlad k.

description: I feel like this place has potential, but its not quite my thing. There was music but no one was really dancing- not enough space anyway. Drinks were decent. Crowd seemed very self-contained; I prefer bars where people laugh and interact and make new friends for the evening. I guess if youre into a low-key evening-maybe on a date or with a small group- and want a loungey, slightly swanky, more cocktails than beer kind of place, then this is the bar for you.
author: Megan G.

description: What better place to come to....especially for Happy hour???!! Happy hour specials AND free food? This place is such a gem-its so chic inside with plenty of seating (if you're happy hour go-ers, get your seats there between 4p-5p bc it gets pretty packed). THey usually have great food during happy hour 4p-7p-tempura vegetables & shrimp, chips & salsa, teriyaki Chicken, stuff like that-where else can you get that for free during happy hour? They have a decent beer selection, although this place specializes in signature cocktails-but they even have TIGER BEER-its not on their menu but they do have it!
author: Dessa R.

description: This is a great place to start out the night.  The venue is definitely on the cozier side, but on a less crowded night light last night, it was a very chill place to grab a drinky drink and catch up with friends.  Supposedly there was free happy hour food, but I got there a little after HH ended and it looked like most of that was picked clean.  The decor and seating all had a nice touch of elegance throughout.  The bartenders were also efficient.  My one gripe about this place is the lack of draft beers, as everything comes straight out of the bottles.  This place can definitely get crowded on weekends, but it's not too bad if you manage to get the little private room in the back.
author: Gary L.

description:
This place has a very chill atmosphere and is never packed.  They have very lush furniture to lounge on and a great menu or drinks to select from, especially their signature drinks.

Minus one star because the last time we were there they were out of a few essential liquors and couldn't make their signature drinks, but still managed to make amazing drinks in spite of it.
author: Megan M.

description: I stopped in briefly tonight. It's dark and warm and comfortable and sexy.
author: Joe G.

description: There's something quite warm and inviting about this little lounge, kind of like hot cocoa. The martini glasses filled with Hershey's kisses of course add to that effect. Service was friendly-- the barback even acknowledged me (which rarely happens) to say that he wasn't a bartender but he'd make sure that I was next, which he did. Fun drink menu but I'm over my sugary drinks phase. They managed to pour a stiff whiskey and ginger, though. That's what I'm talking about. Interesting mix of music but not too exciting. A mellow place to start a girls' night out.
author: Michie L.

description: Final destination to our 'shop & hop' experience, this place had a sweet quiet ambiance.  The crowd is a bit older, or maybe people my age who dress to appear older than me.  Not sure... maybe we need to return on a more happenin' nite.  I guess I would come back here, even just to complete the challenge we forgot we had started: stealing one of the vodka bottles...sneaky sneaky!!  Oh...a SUGARy charm can take you a loooong way.
author: Wendy H.

description: I recently checked this place out to attend a friend's birthday party.  Her and her friend had rented the bar for the night and while everyone there was great, it's probably not a good basis to comment on what the typical/neighborhood crowd would be like.  That being said, it's a nice, not huge, neighborhood lounge/bar.  With Absinthe right across the street and other restaurants and bars in the area, it seems like a nice fit to the neighborhood.
author: Simon N.

description: I love this place.  very casual, hip loungy place.  Nice cocktails and decent free appetizers for happy hour.
author: Baby J.

description: Ehhhhh...I wasn't impressed.  First heard of this place from Daily Candy and got excited but was very disappointed.  I didn't really like the set up b/c it's kind of narrow and long.  The bar decor seems kinda cool but drinks were just so-so.  I went during the first two weeks it was open and since then haven't heard to many ppl mention it (and the last yelp before me was February of '06) so that probably means something...  It's likely a decent neighborhood joint but I don't know many ppl that would bother fighting traffic and parking to go here.
author: Nellie W.

description: I went here this past Saturday as an alternative to the drunken swarms celebrating St. Patty's day elsewhere in the city, and I loved it!  It was exactly what I was looking for that night - a low key bar with good drinks where it was easy to hold a conversation with friends without having to shout or push people out of the way.   As an added plus, they also have an excellent chocolate martini (one of the best I've tried yet!) and I love the wall decor.
author: Chanda A.

description: I like this bar!  It's fun... good mojitos.  You can have your own djs play there...my friend just a had bday party there.
author: Julia H.

description: They had fresh pineapple and chips and salsa!!! I mean come on. And it was the real deal pineapple not that out of a can Delmonte crap, I'm talking fresh sweet pineapple.... Okay anyway. Yes they have some free food for happy hour and they have an interesting mix of it. But the $3 beer is what sold me, or sold itself i guess. it's small and if you don't get a seat in the front or at the bar it's kind of awkward but overall a cool bar.
author: Stephen K.

description:
good lemon drops.

we went on a tuesday night- there were two folks behind the bar, a very sweet but obviously overworked young man who could make a mean drink and an older lady who didn't seem to do anything other than tell the guy what to do. huh?
As i mentioned, i had a lemon drop, the bf had a chimay. the lady asked us what we wanted then told the guy, despite the fact that he was helping someone else. then she just stood there and glared at him. come on now, she could have at least leaned over and gotten the bottle of chimay out of the fridge, how f*n hard is it to open a bottle of beer?

anyways, everyone raves about the free food, and who knows, it might be good if you're a vulture... they put it on a shelf opposite the bar and people crowd around, waiting for the next thing to come out of the kitchen. the place can look packed when you first walk in but if you get pass the hungry mob the back of the place has couches and is actually pretty open and chill.

just kind of meh.
might actually be better without the free food.
author: Melody O.

description: Like it - small but a good atmosphere.  Very low lighting and gets *really* loud.  Not very much seating and it's sometimes hard to squish through the crowds in the narrow strip next to the bar.  Would be better with a small dance floor (as I always claim).  The couple of times I've been here, the crowd has been pretty diverse.  Not too yuppie but also not ghetto.  Always a plus.  I've come a couple of times and actually really liked it on a Tues night.  A little random, but true.
author: Melinda C.

description: Nice place to chat up with friends or a date.  Very modern decor and chill sounds.  My date and I enjoyed a glass of wine, but I also spied signs for cheap happy hour.  Go - enjoy the place!
author: Kayne Y.

description: Quaint, fun atmosphere on a fun block.  Happy hour until 7pm?  Appetizers while you drink?  Awesome.  Wish it was a little closer to my house but will be back.  Love that mini eggroll!
author: Erin H.

description: I came here once on a date.  I think it was a Tuesday...It was desolate but the music and ambiance were perfect for the selected purpose.  I made the mistake of coming back here on a Saturday night for a friends birthday party and we could barely get through the door. The drinks were fairly priced and they had all of those frou frou drinks that people are going wild for these days.  All in all, I would recommend this place but not on a Saturday night at 11....the place is simply too small to accomodate that many people and I dont necessarily consider being bumped into while holding a martini, spilling my drink everywhere, a good time
author: Yasmine D.

description: Totally cool, fun spot...and they have hershey kisses everywhere!
author: Nicole S.

description: The key to this place is that Hayes really needs more bars.  Love the hood for shopping and food, but one bar?  really?  Don't kid yourself into Absinthe and everywhere else is a restaurant with just a small bar.  For a drink, a good space and some dark couches, Sugar fills a huge gap.  The drinks are just ok (real mango?), but the whole place is getting better as it gets it's sea legs.  Don't believe any negative hype, service is friendly and quick, just ask Tabitha why champagne is different from sparking wine.  Good DJ too.
author: JP Z.

description: I had my birthday party (28, v 3.0) at Sugar last night, and it was *perfect*.  Fabulous service, delicious apps + drinks, perfect mingling for the 35+ friends who showed up (thanks, you guys!).  This bar has great flow, so I could easily move around and talk to everyone.  The DJ was spinning at the right volume for conversation (my voice is hoarse this morning, but that's my own damn fault-- I must have smoked a pesky cig at some pt).  Plus, it's not brightly or harshly lit, like half the friggin' bars in SF!  All in all, A+, gold star, I'll definitely be back.  I highly recommend Sugar (and Wish) to anyone planning a birthday party.
author: Sheila W.

description:
My friend and I came for the candy.  I'd been promised Hershey's Kisses and jelly beans, but instead got an overpriced Jack and Coke (despite being told it was happy hour), and cold tempura okra.  

I'm still working through the letdown.
author: Hannah J.

description: Since the last time I was here they have become much better at serving their public. I enjoy the cushy seats and the small atmosphere.  The bartenders are cute and the drinks are fairly well poured. The music makes it a bit difficult sometimes to talk to people around you, but they have become better at atmosphere and mood. I still don't know what those things are on the walls.
author: Brian J.

description: Wish-ish, but not as fun.  Doesn't take many people to have you feeling crowded.  Service was good, pours were generous.  Good for a few rounds, but not for a whole night.  Bonus for hearing Frankie Smith's "Double Dutch Bus" while sipping on our double Chopin overs, and dirty Goose martinis.
author: Barry A.

description:
came here for a date, liked the dark lighting and fruity cocktails - strawberry blonde was great as was the mojito. dj was spinning some good music. as with the other reviews, the bartenders kinda suck and gossip in the corner. somehow i managed to insult one of them within my first 2 minutes at the bar which most likely didn't improve my service.

i would get here on the early side on a weekend as there was standing room only by 10 pm.
author: elissa w.

description: Nice, cute little spot for a drink.  I thought the energy was good and the drinks were amazing!
author: avenelle a.

description: My two friends and I had a birthday there a couple of weeks ago. They were so helpful, friendly, and resourceful. The drinks aren't cheap, but they are strong (which is always a good thing). It didn't get too crowded on a Saturday night and the music was Top Hits.
author: M Z.

description: I think that your experience here really depends on the crowd.  I've been there a couple times - weekdays and, more recently, last night.  Weekdays are pretty low key, small groups, good atmosphere.  Weekends (or at least last night) are super crowded, SO HOT and had a pretty long wait at the bar.  I wouldn't write this place off, but I would definitely bring your own party because the crowd is a little random (read - don't go there with one friend and expect to have a good time).  Just my two cents!
author: Sarah S.

description: The customer service is bad.  The ambiance is pretty cool though.  I am not sure what to say much about the seance room in the back (behind the bathrooms), but maybe they can do something different with that space.  Otherwise, it was just ok.
author: Dan D.

description: I'm pretty sure this place is fun. Ended up here late night, so it was a tad blurry... I remember it being swanky which I liked at the time. Made me want to order a dirty martini. Lot's of loungey couch-y areas and a DJ.
author: Courtney R.

description: Sugar... just the name is appealing!  I have a sweet tooth, so going to a bar named "Sugar" was enticing.  I really like the atmosphere, there are couches, it's kinda dark, and it reminded me of an LA type bar.  There are candy dishes on the bar, which I thought was really cute.  This is a great bar to go to on a date, with friends, even for a party or small get together.  I'll definitely be back.
author: Sarah F.

description:
Bought 13 drinks, bill came up to $41. Well worth it, given you get free food as well during happy hour.

Shrimp and Vegetable Tempura, Spring Rolls, Chicken Terriyaki, Strawberries, Nachos, and the list of food items goes on.
author: S. S.

description: Aibo see too many yuppies. Also bartender gurl take drinks away before Aibo finish. Aibo want to say, "Wat iz up wit dat?"
author: Yan Biao B.

description: Went there on a Wednesday evening for happy hour. They had free bites of food, which was great, but their happy hour special wasn't that great. If you want better drinks and better happy hour prices, try Jade just up the road.
author: Todd W.

description: Sugar is a nice little bar - it has a very comfortable atmosphere and the cocktails are yummy... I especially liked their version of a sweet majito.  The happy hour appetizers are a nice touch too.
author: J D.

description: Love, love, LOVE this place. We stopped in on a whim since we were early for our dinner reservation at nearby Absinthe (yummy, too), and ended up having a stellar time, wishing we could have spent more time in this funky cozy bar. The bartender, Matt, was incredibly friendly and we enjoyed some killer $5 lemon drop martinis. The tunes were hopping, and just before leaving we learned they were from Matt's personal collection (this guy has GREAT taste in music). In my opinion, this place beats Martuni's HANDS DOWN. It was a genuine highlight of our trip to SF.
author: Mari-Beth G.

description: Nice atmosphere and decor, it's the perfect combo of hip lounge and friendly neighborhood bar. Cool bartender's who talk to you. Original cocktails.
author: Marc T.

description: This is my favorite place to go for happy hour, not only is it close to my work but the drinks are tasty, the music is good, the decor is warm and inviting, and they give you free tempura!  One of the reasons I love going here is that you can actually have a conversation without having to scream, call me grumpy, but my one complaint is that sometime around 7 or 8pm they turn the music way up and conversation is no longer possible.
author: Sarah B.

description: the sugar lounge would get 5 stars from me if only the music didn't suck so bad up in there! i love their fruity, delicious, creative cocktail concoctions, and i also love that they always have a cheaper drink special every night. i haven't been to the free food happy hour yet,  but being that the bar is just around the corner from me, i know i'll be frequenting it very often. now if they can only play some modern tunes...
author: Kerri B.

description: Free happy hour appetizers and the drinks I've had have all been good. It's pretty crowded on weekend evenings, but I've met here after work with some friends a few times for a drink and it's a much quieter, chill vibe.  Would be a good place to grab a drink before the Opera or Symphony because it's walking distance.
author: Leah K.

description: Don't leave your purse unattended. I've been in some places in SF, usually leave the purse at home. Hayes valley ; sugar should be OK ; not. Met a couple of friends for a drink. The bar stank of BO. drinks were cheap, but after my purse got lifted from a bar stool I was stood right next too. Not cool. Hardly anyone in the bar.............
author: Samantha B.

description: This is a hip place to get a drink and hang out with friends. They usually have a good dj spinning. It's a fun place to relax and enjoy your drinks. Plus, the atmosphere is high class, dark, very elegant with some couch seating, high leather bar chairs and nice lighting. They make some excellent martinis. I've been there a number of times and always leave feeling good.
author: Dawn L.

description:
I have become a regular at ye olde Sugar Lounge and I love it there.  I usually only go on the nights my fave bartendress Brenna is working, she makes great drinks and more importantly to me, she's great people. (and she's easy on the eyes, too:) But I have gone on the occasional Saturday night, and it can get pretty hoppin, one particular Sat night it was freakin nuts!!! and speakin of hoppin, the last Saturday of every month is FLAVOR night, a hip hop party w/ a small cover and a group who takes over the sound system.
And Sundays is happy hour all night (certain beers $3, wells $4). If you're lookin for a cool place to grab a quick drink before, during (yes, you can bring outside food in) or after dinner, or if ya just wanna sit and chill on a Sunday night (like me) then, Sugar Lounge is the place to go. 
And if you have an i-pod and ask really nicely, Brenna will hook up your i-pod to the sound system.  And if it's not too too busy, you can even play a friendly game of bones.
And Bartendress Nicki looks like Drew Barrymore(at least to me, she does)
Oh, and they are fairly well known for being heavy pourers.
author: Phil R.

description:
here is a place truly distinctive in this neighborhood.  they specialize in "sweet" drinks, and my favorite is that cobalt-blue one, that I say is like drinking cobalt.  I've only been in once and plan to drink there again when the situation permits.

recommended to those who either have tired of the other places on Hayes Street or who cannot get into the crowded places in the area.
author: Richard D.

description: i very much wanted to like this feminine girlie-pink bar.... but i felt something was missing. oh yes, the men! i know, i know lately i've been on this crazy spring fever kick and prefer bars with men, so that's probably why i didn't find too much excitement in this place. cute concept, and hell they serve alcohol but i felt myself gravitating towards the front door so i can make a mad dash over to jade. at least jade has a few levels i can play on and has much better voyeuristic options....so i prefer it over there. overall sugar is a nice starter bar with a lot of potential.
author: Michelle I.

description: came in last week and the two bartenders and bar back was moving in slow motion when there were only 6 people at the bar, so we left to go to another bar.  maybe they were just off on a early friday night, but they could have acknowledge that they'll be right with us.
author: Pickle R.

description: was here las nite~now i got a spot to hit up while im in the hayes valley....my kinda spot/loungy....good music....requested for a special drank/shot....ms bartender with the cool tatz mixed sumthin up & bam she had me sayin can i get another one =)....ill b baaaack
author: elmer d.

description: Got a Groupon for this place. Looked kinda cute on their site. Saturday night my girl and I are going out on date night, thought we would try this place. We got there around 6:30 pm, bar was a little full with a few stools open. A couple of girls moved over for us so we could sit together, that was very nice of them. Bartender hardly notices us, finally comes over we told him our drink order. The drinks were very good, here's where the problem is. You do not serve food, did not see hors d'oeuvres, bartender has NO PERSONALITY and he looks BORED. We bought the girls that moved over a round of drinks for being nice. Genius bartender never asked the girls if they want the drinks, or informed them that we would like to buy them a drink. Bartender puts the glasses of wine in front of them, within 3 minutes they leave, they are going to the play. Glasses of wine almost untouched. By the way, Bartender never said more than 3 words to us. So, to the Bar owner, Why would I come back to your place? I wouldn't, there is nothing there. You offer nothing, no food, no bartender with a personality, nothing. Too bad.
author: joy e.

description: When I first arrived at Sugar last night I thought it was super cute but quickly figured out why they might be nearly empty on a Friday night. The bartenders looked completely annoyed to be there and had obviously no desire to be serving anyone. Without a single smile or greeting, they stood around looking bummed out, cell phones in hand. Is there table service? Is there a drink menu? Can someone please be interested enough to make eye contact so I can order? I don't need my hand held when I go out but I would appreciate a little customer service. I expect the emo thing at a dive bar in the Mission but not from an "upscale" lounge in Hayes Valley. I am a bartender myself and I never forget that tipping is not required. You are paying for a service and if that service is not given then I don't expect a tip. There are way too many bars in San Francisco to treat your customers like their presence is unwelcome and in these times can anyone really afford to lose a customer?
author: Caitlin F.

description: Good neighborhood bar. Nice specialty drinks. Good prices. Good service. Cool vibe.
author: Joe C.

description: This place has great drinks and great music. Its rare to find a lounge in SF that you can just meet up with a group of friends and enjoy listening to dance music without going to a club. I think Sugar Lounge is the perfect venue for that. I was there for a few hours on a Saturday and I noticed that it doesn't ever become too crowded and if you get there early enough you can secure a place at the bar and just hang out there all night. I would recommend this place if you're looking for a fun venue to hang out with friends. The drinks are pricey but the music is great so its worth it.
author: N S.

description:
yummy cocktails. tried the mojito martini , mango martini and some other mojito type drink.  those were good..i loved the flavored sugar rim.

my bro also recommended the love shack.  but it seemed way too tangy...my sis forced herself to finish it for me.  i guess its not consistent?  the one my bro tried wasn't that tangy/sour.
author: rien d.

description: very sexy, sophisticated.  went on a tuesday nite for a birthday celebration and the crowd was perfect (i don't like crowded places).  the bar stools are incredibly, surprisingly comfy (leather with backs!  and super cushiony).  i had myself a mean sidecar - tasty and sweet, just like i like it.  i think this is a lovely place for a date.
author: Kate F.

description: i am a new fan of sugar lounge.  teeny little place but it's both cozy and chic which can often be hard to combine well.  super friendly service and the bartender plays great tunes from her ipod (last time i was digging the esthero she was playing).  love the way there is no pretense.  great place to go with friends for a sleek and modern vibe but no attitude.
author: Lija H.

description: i've been here a few times, and the place is pretty low key.  you don't have to shout inside, which is nice.  however, this place is always fairly empty.  the drinks are pretty tasty tho, especially the pear bear.
author: Helen T.

description: this place was fun.  chilled out and very generous with the fernet pours :)  good in my book.  and walking distance of my home.  YES.
author: Kimby T.

description: gets packed and stuffy in here, but i liked the shiney bar...shiney things are nice...all of the seating, and the women's restroom had a nice full-size mirror.  the people walking in and out, in and out, in and out of the backroom were irritating.  stop flashing that light in my face!  the tomato effect is on and i don't want people to see, okay?!
author: Carol C.

description: went here after dinner and the place was dead. maybe because it was a monday night but at least we found parking right smack in front of the place. i've always wanted to check this bar out ever since Daily Candy mentioned its opening a couple years ago. anyway, i tried one of their specialty cocktails even thought i'm not much for sweet fruity drinks (headaches!) I'm down to try inventive cocktails with interesting ingredients and ordered the 'pear bear' made with grey goose pear vodka, passion fruit and mango juices. it wasn't bad, in fact it was pleasant but a little on the weak side (coming from someone who drinks vodka on the rocks!). the bartender was really friendly and chatty with us and that was cool. she was pretty cute too :P
author: kristin e.

description: Dark and Loungy. A good place to go for drinks or have a private party. Happy hour seems to be the thing to do here....if you are going here for a first date, probably not the best place because its quite noisy...maybe a place to go after you have had some time to talk...
author: Kalifornia S.

description: this is a nice surprise in hayes valley.  it's got a pretty good cocktail menu and a nice selection of scotches.  it's a great place to come to just sorta chill and chat w/ some friends.  the DJ when we went was pretty good so i figure this place is quite adequate for those who want to dance.
author: Swarup B.

description: big fan of this place. i stopped by last week with two girlfriends and had a perfect after dinner drink - love shack. ok, so it wasn't a digestif or whatever, but it was a good way to end our girls night. dj gives enough energy and the size keeps it from becoming a relocated marina bar.
author: Heidi L.

description: love it! great drinks, ambience, and house music... who can beat that? and it's tucked away in hayes valley! like i said... LOVE IT!
author: Sam P.

description: So cute. So girly. Perfect for drinks with the chicas. I heart the free food (yummy chicken skewers) during happy hour. The drinks are okay, but I'm sure will get better over time. Love the little touches like vases full of chocolate kisses!
author: Mama L.

description: this is a great happy hour spot.  yummy food stuff and pretty good martinis.  i especially liked the hand dipped chocolate covered fruits.  yummy!
author: Jolsna J.

description: Friendly Bartender! Great wine and drink menu. A perfect place for a night out with the girls!
author: Sierra d.

description: this is your basic small bar. it has a nice upscale warm feeling. i just went for 1 glass of very good $9 pino. yummers!
author: miss l.

description: my girlfriends and i wandered into this place after dinner at paul k on a saturday night and maybe i went on a bad night but i thought it was just alright and nothing more.  if i didn't write this review right away, i probably would've forgotten it even existed.
author: michelle k.

description: i've been here many times and i like this place. i love the vibe (and the chocolates!!) - dimly lit, couches, loungey, that private room in back, nice bathrooms, great downtempo spinning at happy hour and FREE FOOD. i don't like sugary drinks, so i stick to wine and they have an ok selection. also, beer and drink specials at happy hour. the crowd is always different each time i'm here - sometimes hipsters, sometimes marina crowd, sometimes random older folks or peninsula looking ladies out for girls' night out (that sounds snobby WHOOPS). whatevs, the bartenders are really friendly, efficient, and super cute. i'd like to rent this place out for a private party. now i need to come up with a pArTeEeeEeeee!!!!!!!!
author: Mary V.

description: this place is great ! a fabulous addition to my hood. Long overdue for a place like this besides absinthe in our hood. the bartenders we all HOT!!!! And the food that they dish out is awesome for free. I will most definitely be a regular at sugar.......
author: Michael L.

description: i love this place for happy hour. $3 chimay and free food. can't beat that.
author: Miss O.

description: this place is super cute. its dark and loungy with classy decor. very sex and the city-ish. the cocktails are yummy, but a little pricey. good neighborhood too.
author: joanna u.

description: great bar...awesome location.. and yummy drinks...this could easily become a favorite if I lived closer...can't wait to come back for happy hour sometime....
author: Joy Y.
